“The queues are so long that it takes more than seven hours to refill,” said Kumar, adding, “The state government should do something. Since I got the CNG kit fitted my earning has been reduced by 25%.”

Another auto-rickshaw driver, Kuldip Singh said he converted his auto back to petrol. “I started using petrol because my earning has been reduced to Rs 10,500 per month from Rs 18,000. I was not able to save anything,” Singh said.

Bihar State Auto-Chalak Sangh general secretary, Raj Kumar Jha said around 80 auto drivers have reconverted their vehicle to petrol due to the daily ruckus at the CNG stations in Patna.

“How can the state government expect the auto-drivers to convert the vehicles into CNG by January-end, 2021 when they are not able fulfil the demands,” he asked.

GAIL officials in Patna region are looking for private parties to collaborate with to set up more CNG stations. “It is difficult to get land for CNG stations in city. However, five more stations will come up at Saguna Mor, Naubatpur, Digha, Bailey road near RPS Mor and Station road before December 2020,” an official said.

Title: ‘Lota march’ in Muzaffarpur to seek release of toilet funds
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

MUZAFFARPUR: The beneficiaries of Lohia Swachch Abhiyan scheme in Aurai block on Wednesday adopted a peculiar way to protest against the officials for their “callous” attitude in making payments to them for construction of toilets.

Over 200 men, women and children reached the block office with ‘lota (a globular water container)’ in their hands as part of the protest.

The ‘lota march’, organised under the banner of Jan Sangharsh Morch (JSM), was led by a social worker Akhilesh Yadav. Yadav had earlier announced to launch a massive protest march on the occasion of ‘Makar Sankranti’ if payment is not made to the beneficiaries of the scheme by January 10.

“I chose this day as it is a day for making us ‘swachch (clean)’. The day marks the first day of the Sun’s transit into Makara (Capricorn). A sum of Rs 12,000 was to be given as incentive after construction of toilets in the houses of the selected beneficiaries. We met block development officer, circle officer and sub-divisional officer (east) several times, but in vain. Hence, we decided to hold a ‘lota march’ to draw the attention of the officials concerned,” Yadav said.

Aurai BDO Vinod Kumar Prasad said all required processes for making payments under the scheme were underway. “There were some technical glitches due to which we were unable to process the payments. The glitches have been rectified and the payments will be made by the end of February,” he said.

Title: Vijayawada accounts for 5% of all suicides in state
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Vijayawada: Continuing the increasing trend, there has been a substantial spike of 8.7% in the total number of suicides during 2018, compared to 2017, in Vijayawada, according to the latest Accidental Deaths and Suicides in India (ADSI) 2018 report released by National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB). Out of these, 73% of the suicides were by men (211) while the rest were by women (75).

Vijayawada accounts for 5% of all the suicides in Andhra Pradesh and ranks 24th in a list of 53 major cities across India. While the city may account for only 5% of all the suicides in the entire state, the suicide rate (incidence of suicides in the city)—19.2%—is higher than the state average of 10.2%.

Of the 286 suicides reported in the city, at 53%, the most common reason behind the extreme step was family problems. Following that were bankruptcy and illness, which accounted for 11% each, love failure came next at 5%, then came extramarital affairs at 4%. The reasons for the remaining 8% of suicides were unknown.

At 2%, the total number of student suicides saw a decrease as compared to 11% in 2017. The top three means adopted by victims to end their lives were hanging, drowning, and consuming poison.

While the total number of suicides which cites unemployment as a reason were a mere 1% in the city, it is pertinent to note that 9.6% of people who took the extreme step happened to be unemployed.

The number of self-employed persons (vendors, tradesmen and other business) who ended their lives stood at 9.8%. Similarly, while failure in examination might have only been a fraction of the overall suicides, 7.6% of the suicides in the city were by students. Of all those who ended their lives, the percentage of professionals and salaried were 8.9% while the percentage of students who killed themselves was 7.6%.

The ADSI report noted that 17.1% of the people who killed themselves were housewives.

On the other hand, Visakhapatnam which happens to be a bigger city in terms of population and geography than Vijayawada, saw a massive 33% increase in suicides compared to 2017. However, at 290 suicides, they remain variant with Vijayawada by only one percent.

Title: ‘Lawmakers should take part in budget debate actively’
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

PATNA: Bihar assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Choudhary said at Lucknow on Thursday that debate on budget is important for legislators as well as legislature.

Addressing the plenary session on the inaugural day of seventh convention of Commonwealth Parliamentary Association (CPA), India Region, Choudhary said legislators’ first priority should be to study government’s priorities mentioned in governor’s speech and sub-sections of the budget document after it is presented by the finance minister in the House.

“All legislators should ensure their presence in the second sitting of the House. It is their responsibility to review government’s policies and it will only be possible if they are present in the House,” Choudhary said.

He added that motive of budget remains the same irrespective of which party forms the government. “The primary motive of the budget is to eradicate backwardness and uplift people in the lowest strata of the society,” the Speaker said.

The seventh convention of the CPA was jointly inaugurated by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. Deputy speaker of the Rajya Sabha Harivansh and other dignitaries were also present.

Title: Detection of fake marksheets sparks controversy at MSU
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Vadodara: The detection of fake marksheets by the M S University (MSU) in 2019 during regular verifications sought by various organisations has sparked a major controversry with a senate member demanding that the varsity file offences in this regard.

The university gets a series of requests by employers as well as education institutes both in the country and abroad for verification of marksheets submitted by those who have passed out from the MSU. After examining the documents and checking records, the university gives its opinion regarding the authenticity of the document.

In 2019, the university had received 625 such requests from employers and education institutes. It had come to light that 20 marksheets submitted by former students of the university were fake.

While the detection of fake marksheets was a part of regular procedures, it sparked a row with senate member and Congress spokespersons Narendra Ravat demanding that the university should register offences regarding the fakes it had detected. He claimed that the data that was shared by the university recently was only of one year and there may be many more such cases.

MSU vice chancellor Parimal Vyas said that the university had introduced a series of security measures in its marksheets to ensure that any counterfeiting could be detected. “We inform the police regarding this. We will examine the possibility of registering offences and take necessary action,” he said. Vyas said that it was not necessary that the duplicate marksheets were made locally. “This can be done by any person at any place. We are improving our mechanisms to ensure that making fake marksheets is not easy,” he said.

Title: Man killed while trying to save son
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 45-year-old man was beaten to death by one of the five men who were assaulting his son over a petty dispute in the Gomtipur area of the city late on Wednesday night.

The deceased was identified as Kaushik Chauhan, a resident of Abu Kasai chawl in Gomtipur.

On Wednesday night, the deceased’s son, Ankit, got a call from his cousin, Manav, 20, who told him that five men — Sumit Parmar, Dipak Parmar Nirav Parmar, Mehul Parmar and Dhaval Parmar — all about 25 years old, were fighting with him.

On hearing this, Ankit, his father Kaushik and Manav’s father, Tarun, 42, rushed there. As they reached, they saw the five men were beating Manav. When Tarun and Ankit intervened, one assailant took out a knife and tried to attack Ankit. In the brawl Kaushik, who was tring to save Ankit was killed by a blow to his chest. tnn

Title: Public transport proximity key to renting houses: Survey
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Chennai: Proximity to public transport, which was not a top priority in earlier years, is now driving consumer rental decisions, shows a study by real estate search portal NoBroker.com. While preference for proximity to public transport grew from 46% in 2018 to 59% in 2019, the share of consumers considering factors like water and safety stood flat year-on-year. The survey covered all major metro cities — Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Chennai, Bengaluru, Pune and Hyderabad, — with a sample size of 14,526 respondents.

“Although cost of rent, availability of car park space continues to be major concerns proximity to public transport and water supply have seen higher requests in the last year,” Saurabh Garg, co-founder and chief business officer of NoBroker.com said. The survey conducted to study the property-search patterns has found traffic woes taking a toll on consumers and change of workplace becoming increasingly a relevant factor as more people choose to stay close to work.

Amritha Vijaybaskar (28), a Bengaluru-based HR professional shared her experience moving from three houses in a year before settling for a home with access to public transport.

“There was no second thought in admitting how public transport is more than a necessity, especially in a city where most street corners witness traffic jams,” Vijaybaskar said.

The ‘no-compromise’ moto on renting houses only with close proximity to metro station or bus station is on an increasing trend among two or four-wheelers owners too. “Though we have a car only one of us could use it at a time, while the other uses public transport. Since, our offices are at two opposite directions, we compromised on a house midway to save time. However, we had to pay 15% higher rent,” Sukanya Adithya, (35) a Medavakkam resident in Chennai, who takes the public bus from Medavakkam to Adyar. ANAROCK Property Consultants’s vice chairman Santhosh Kumar agrees though not applicable for self-employed people, majority of Indian tenants still find public transport essential. “It goes without saying that people who rent homes are usually professionally active and need to get to and from work with reasonable ease. Depending on the city in question, public transport may be the most feasible way of commuting and the availability of accessible bus and train connectivity cannot be over-emphasised,” he said.

Title: Sebi allows trading in options on commodities
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: Markets regulator Sebi on Thursday allowed exchanges to start trading in options on goods, which could potentially bring down the risk of trading in commodities like gold, silver, rubber, chana and garments. This will also allow traders to take delivery of goods on which they buy options, market experts said.

Till now, futures on commodities were allowed and options trading was limited to contracts on those futures, while direct trading in options contracts on commodities were not allowed. For example, MCX had launched options on gold futures. The current regulation will allow exchanges to launch options contracts on gold.

In a detailed circular, Sebi on Thursday specified the contract sizes for these options, how the settlement will take place, when delivery could be made, at what prices there contracts could be exercised, etc.

According to market experts, Sebi’s decision was a right step at further strengthening the commodity derivatives market. “The provisions shall pave the way for launching options contract in commodities based on underlying spot market price and settlement through compulsory delivery,” said Sanjit Prasad , MD & CEO, ICEX . “These contracts will reduce the risk for the hedgers. Options in agriculture commodities can prove to be an important tool to replace minimum support price intervention scheme of the government,” Prasad said.

Title: Amfi seeks debt funds with tax sops for retail investors
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: You could soon have another option to save taxes by investing in debt schemes of mutual fund houses, if a proposal by Amfi, the industry’s trade body, is accepted by the government. Planned on the lines of Equity Linked Savings Scheme ( ELSS ), one of the most popular tax-saving instruments for Indian investors, Amfi has proposed to allow the introduction of ‘Debt Linked Savings Scheme’, or DLSS , by the government in its Budget proposal.

In addition to offering retail investors another tax-saving option, the proposed DLSS could also “help channelise long-term savings of retail investors into the corporate bond market and help in deepening the Indian bond market,” the Amfi said in its Budget proposal to the finance minister.

“While the RBI and Sebi have taken the welcome steps in developing a vibrant corporate bond market in recent times, it is imperative that other stakeholders complement these efforts, considering the fact that with banks undertaking the much needed balance sheet repairs and a section of the corporate sector coming to terms with deleveraging, the onus of providing credit falls on the other players,” Amfi said.According to latest Amfi data, ELSS — with total assets under management (AUM) nearing Rs 1 lakh crore — was the third grossing scheme type among equity funds, behind large-cap (Rs 1.55 lakh crore) and multi-cap (Rs 1.53 lakh crore).

ELSS as a fund group contributes about 15% to the total equity fund AUM. Since these funds come with a three-year lock-in for enjoying tax exemptions, the fund managers also get a longer investment horizon than other open-ended funds.

In its 17-point agenda, Amfi also proposed abolition of dividend distribution tax ( DDT ) for equity mutual funds. It also proposed similar tax treatment for NPS, EPFO, insurance companies and some other select group of companies “who invest on behalf of their investors/contributors/ policyholders in mutual fund schemes or infrastructure debt funds of mutual funds”. Amfi also proposed that mutual funds should be recognised as ‘Specified Long-Term Assets’, and be exempted from long-term capital gains tax.

Title: Bihar: Vaishali crowd greets ‘lauh purush’ with pro-CAA chants
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

A view of crowd of BJP national president and Union Home Minister Amit Shah's rally in support of CAA at Vaish... Read More

VAISHALI GARH: All roads leading to Khanauna village, adjacent to the venue of Union home minister Amit Shah ’s ‘Jan Jagran Sabha (public awareness meeting)’ about CAA, were dotted with saffron flags and mood of the local residents was upbeat. Reason: It was the first occasion for them to have a glimpse of the BJP stalwarts, particularly Shah.

“Shah has emerged as ‘lauh purush’ (a man with iron will) of the present era. His role in abrogation of Article 370 and 35A, which earlier gave special status to Jammu & Kashmir, has made me a great fan of him,” said 70-year Janardhan Singh, who was being helped by his 18-year-old grandson Sonu Kumar to reach the venue of the meeting.

People were seen jostling with each other to reach the venue as early as possible. “I have come from Dhankaul village under Patepur assembly segment of Ujiarpur Lok Sabha constituency in Vaishali district. Though I am not a BJP ‘bhakt’ (as saffron party supporters are referred to), I have come to listen to the Union minister to know the fact of the matter,” said Ganesh Kumar (55), who ekes out livelihood by giving door-to-door tuition to students.

The motley crowd mostly comprised of youths, who responded by waiving their hands in the air at every shout of ‘Bharat Mata Ki Jai’. The crowd became restless to listen to the Union minister as soon as the helicopter started hovering over their head on the Khanaura Pokhar ground. Slogans like ‘Amit Shah zindabad’, ‘Amit Shah amar rahe’ and ‘Bharat mata ki jai’ rent the air.

Though women were sitting calm and composed in chairs, they too joined the youths when Shah asked the audience to take out their cellphones and dial a particular number to express their solidarity with central government on the CAA. Everybody in the crowd showed their cellphone sets to Shah and started dialling the number. “Lekin mera phone to lag nahi raha hai (I am not getting connected),” rued Pawan Singh (35), a resident of Vaishali Garh .

A woman police constable, who was on duty near the barricade, replied, “Jammar laga hua hai. Phone kaise lagega (Jammers have been installed. How will the cellphones work?). The same complaint came from others in the crowd as well. Movable jammers were installed at the venue as a precautionary measure. Shah’s threat perception is very high.

Mamta Devi (48), a resident of Ufraul village, was more candid in her conversation. “Mujhe CAA ke bare mein bahut malum nahi hai. Lekin netaon ki baat sunkar to aisa lagta hai ki kanoon thik hi hai (Though I don’t have much knowledge about the CAA, the netas’ statements suggest that the law is okay),” she said, adding that several BJP functionaries led by Union minister Nityanand Rai and state party chief Sanjay Jaiswal had earlier visited her native village.

Though the villages around Kharauna Pokhar, the venue of the meeting, have a sizeable chunk of Muslim voters, their presence was negligible. “Battlelines have already been drawn. Abki baar vidhan sabha chunav mein pata chal jayega ki janta kiske saath hai,” said 65-year-Sarfaraz Alam, a tailor.

Title: Patna: Sabzibagh protests echo Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

A child at the protest venue at Sabzibagh area in Patna

PATNA: The Sabzibagh locality of the city has virtually turned into national capital’s Shaheen Bagh with people from all age groups sitting on an indefinite dharna since January 12 to protest against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR). With tricolours in their hands, people can be seen raising slogans like ‘hum le ke rahenge azadi’ and ‘kagaj nahi dikhayenge’.

The protesters said their lifestyle changed since Sunday when the agitation was launched. While homemakers finish their daily chores in haste, businessmen shut their shops early to join the protest. It is mainly from the evening that the protest starts gathering momentum, though some people stay there round the clock.

Ahmad Yasmeen, a homemaker from Langar Toli locality, said, “I finish my household chores early and join the protest in the evening and stay there till 11pm.”

Ninety-year old Soghra Khatoon, who also joined the protest braving biting cold, said, “I decided to stay in India after the partition and no one can force me to leave the country,” said this nonagenarian.

Co-coordinating from the stage, 25-year-old Saujanya Upadyaya said they start the day with national anthem, which is followed by reading of the Constitution. “We talk about our freedom fighters and the importance of the Constitution. We also make it sure that the stage is not used by any politician. It is people’s protest and we all are together in our fight against the present government at the Centre,” he said.

Daniyal Alam, a final-year law student from Dehradun, who came to Patna recently on a vacation, has also joined the protest. “This is not about any community. We are the followers of Dr Bhim Rao Ambedkar and Bhagat Singh,” he said.

Locals also ensure that the commuters are not disturbed. “Our aim is not only to pull the crowd, but also ensure that others do not face problem. A group of young boys has been deputed at the site to manage traffic,” said Prince, a local businessman.

Former Patna mayor Afzal Imam is also a daily visitor to the protest site. “The government is formed for people, but the present government is only working to divide the country on the basis of religion while ignoring issues like unemployment and inflation. After CAA, they have come up with NPR, in which even date of birth of parents will be asked. How many people remember these figures?” Imam asked. He also hit out at CM Nitish Kumar for “neglecting” the poor who voted for his party. “Nitish has notified NPR in the state and we all know that only poor and middle class people will be harassed by this,” Imam added.

Title: Lekhpals and junior officers behind the delay in land acquisition?
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Land acquisition for highways and Ring road projects has exposed the laxity of lekhpals and junior-rank office... Read More

VARANASI: Fast-tracking the process to tackle problems that delayed land acquisition for highways and Ring road projects has exposed the laxity of lekhpals and junior-rank officers.

While necessary forms for collection of compensation amount were not distributed among land owners by lekhpals, SDM Sadar Ballia, despite repeated reminders, did not give the details of land acquired to senior officials.

Sample this. District magistrate Kaushal Raj Sharma issued a show-cause notice to lekhpal Lohrapur for creating hurdles in compensation distribution process among farmers.

Also, a letter requesting the suspension of SDM Sadar of Ballia district was forwarded to state government for not providing records of owners of land acquired for Varanasi-Ghazipur National Highway-29 that led to delay in land acquisition process. List of other lekhpals, who have not completed the formalities of land acquisition, was also sought by the DM.

“A showcause notice has been issued to lekhpal Lohrapur for delay in compensation distribution process. Also, a letter recommending SDM Sadar Ballia’s suspension has been sent to state government,” said DM Kaushal Raj Sharma.

The DM, who had set a deadline of first week of February to wind up the process of land acquisition process for all highway and infrastructure related projects last week, conducted the first hearing on Tuesday evening to clear hurdles of nine highway projects and ring road in presence of NHAI officials, ADM (administration) and special land acquisition officer (SLO).

During the hearing it surfaced that in ring road phase-I project of NHAI, Rs 297 crore had to be distributed among land owners, which have been acquired for it. However, after distribution of Rs 284 crore remaining, Rs 13 crore were left unused in the SLO’s account as the Lohrapur lekhpal did not distribute the necessary forms to farmers and land owners of Ahmadpur, Danupur and Singhpur villages to begin collection of compensation.

The SDM Sadar of Ballia district came on the radar of officials for not providing the details of land records of villages including Kaithi despite repeated reminders from SLO office. This delayed the process of distributing compensation amount among owners of land acquired for Varanasi-Ghazipur NH-29 for past several months.

Notably, the SDM Sadar Ballia also holds the charge of additional revenue officer (ARO) and looks after the record operation department of Varanasi region for the settlement of land along river banks.

The distribution of compensation among the owners of land acquired for constructing toll plaza on NH-2 has also not been distributed so far.

The DM was also shocked to see that despite the directives issued to SDMs concerned last week for solving the issues hurdling the process of taking possession on acquired land at Kachnar, Thathra and Bihda villages were not solved so far.

The officials were also asked to coordinate with NHAI officials for holding camps to complete the process of compensation distribution and solving all other issues.

Title: Biometric devices go kaput in MU colleges
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

GAYA: The Magadh University administration has received several complaints regarding malfunctioning of biometric machines to record daily arrival and departure timing of the nearly 1,700 employees of the university’s central office, postgraduate departments, 19 constituent colleges and one government-funded minority college spread over the five districts of Magadh division.

Though the machines were installed more than a year ago, the present vice-chancellor (VC), Rajendra Prasad, has taken the initiative to monitor the functioning of the biometric machines and link it with the salary payment system of teachers and non-teaching staff.

As per the complaints, besides developing frequent snags, the machines fail to identify and register attendance on the basis of finger impressions of several employees. In many cases, the employees have to make repeated attempts and sometimes the machine positively responds and sometimes it does not respond and ‘timed out’ messages are flashed on the screen.

Conceding receipt of complaints about malfunctioning of the biometric attendance machines, the VC said that a committee has been constituted to conduct a performance audit of the biometric attendance machines.

“The committee will visit all the colleges and university departments, where such machines have been installed. The committee has already visited more than six colleges and follow up action will be taken once the committee submits its report. The private company, which was awarded the contract for the installation of biometric attendance machines and its subsequent maintenance, has been asked to depute its representative to accompany the inquiry committee members during their visit to the colleges and departments where the machines are installed,” said the VC.

He added, “Employees whose attendance is not recorded in the machine have been asked to manually register their arrival or departure in the attendance register.”

Title: Six arrested for looting Rs 2.88L from fish trader
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

PATNA: Police arrested six criminals from different locations with arms for their alleged involvement in loot of Rs 2.88 lakh from a fish trader near Kurji Pul under the Digha police station area in the city on December 26.

The victim, Jitendra Sahni, was riding a two-wheeler when criminals intercepted him and looted the money along with the two-wheeler. The two-wheeler was found abandoned at Patel Nagar under the Shashtri Nagar police station area in the city the next day.

Patna SSP Upendra Kumar Sharma said the arrested criminals were identified as Deepak Kumar, Sunny Kumar, Mantu Kumar, Naresh Paswan, Golu Kumar and Randhir Kumar. He said a country-made pistol, three live cartridges, two motorcycles and four cellphones were seized from the possession of the arrested criminals.

“The arrested criminals are also being interrogated in connection with the loot of Rs 40,000 from a petrol pump at Digha on January 5. They might also be involved in other loot incidents in Vaishali and other neighbouring districts,” the SSP added.

Body found: Police recovered the body of one Amit Kumar (28) from room number 202 of a hotel near pillar number 19 of the railway overbridge on Station Road under the Kotwali police station area in the city on Wednesday night. SHO Ramashankar Singh said Kumar’s body was found lying on bed and he had probably taken overdose of psychotropic substance. He said the deceased had suicidal tendency as he had attempted to commit suicide at least twice in the past. “The youth’s body was sent to Patna Medical College and Hospital for post-mortem,” the SHO added.

Man sent to jail: Police on Wednesday sent a postal department peon, Krishna Kumar, to jail for allegedly kidnapping and fleeing with a minor girl after befriending her on Instagram. SHO of Jakkanpur police station Mukesh Kumar Verma said an FIR was lodged against unknown people by the victim’s father on January 11.

Title: Join RLSP human chain: Kushwaha to anti-NDA parties
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

PATNA: Former Union minister and RLSP chief Upendra Kushwaha on Thursday made an appeal to all non-NDA parties in the state to take part in a human chain to be organised by his party on January 24 on the twin issues of unemployment and education. The RLSP has sent letters in this regard to all major anti-NDA parties, including Congress, RJD and Left allies.

Incidentally, the state government will organise a statewide human chain on January 19 to promote Jal Jeevan Hariyali scheme, liquor prohibition and its anti-dowry and anti-child marriage campaigns.

“Education and unemployment are the main issues in Bihar. The education system has completely deteriorated in the last 15 years since Nitish Kumar came to power. People have been forced to migrate to other states for education and employment,” Kushwaha said. The slogan of RLSP’s human chain is ‘Hame chahiye shiksha aur rozgar, isiliye manav katar’.

Kushwaha said January 24 was chosen for the event to mark socialist icon Karpoori Thakur’s birth anniversary. “We will organise various programmes like cycle rally, foot march and ‘prabhat pheri’ on January 21 to garner support for the human chain, which will be formed outside government schools,” Kushwaha said.

Title: ‘Congress to prepare for all 243 seats in Bihar’
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

PATNA: All India Congress Committee secretary Ajay Kapoor, who has been given the charge of Bihar, said on Thursday that the party would prepare for all 243 assembly seats in the state where the assembly elections are due in October-November this year. He claimed that the Congress will emerge as the strongest of all political parties in the state.

Kapoor, who was on a one-day visit to Bihar to interact with the members of Bihar Pradesh Congress Committee and discuss party’s strategy for the upcoming assembly elections, said the Congress functionaries and workers will work tirelessly to rejuvenate the party in the state.

Asked about RJD, which is presenting itself as big brother in Mahagathbandhan and strongest of all the allies in Bihar, Kapoor said, “All parties are strong but Congress will emerge as the strongest of them all.”

Kapoor refrained from naming RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav as the alliance’s chief ministerial candidate. “These things are decided by the Congress’s high command,” he said.

Kapoor also hit out at CM Nitish Kumar for planning to organise a human chain to promote the government’s Jal Jeevan Hariyali scheme on January 19, saying the latter was “fooling” common people. “Was Nitish unaware of environmental issues when he came to power in the state 15 years ago?,” he asked.

Title: CUSB gets Rs 58L for infrastructure development
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

GAYA: The biotechnology department of Gaya-based Central University of South Bihar (CUSB) has got level A grant of Rs 58 lakh for infrastructure development.

The research and infrastructure development division of the department of science and technology, government of India, had received 143 proposals for the award of grant. Only 17 proposals, including the one submitted by CUSB, were approved, said a university press release. “The grant will be used for the upgradation of research facilities, including the lab,” it said.

Rizwanul Haque, head of the biotechnology department of the university, said the grant was given on the basis of nationally-assessed academic performance of the faculty members. “The CUSB biotechnology department has got a strong and dedicated faculty,” he said.

Title: Now, live ‘darshan’ of Mahavir Mandir
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

PATNA: The Mahavir Mandir near Patna Junction will start live darshan from Friday. Mahavir Mandir Trust secretary Acharya Kishore Kunal said on Thursday that Bihar governor Phagu Chauhan will inaugurate the live darshan at 3.30pm on the birth anniversary of Jagadguru Ramanandcharya.

Kunal said Reliance has selected Mahavir Mandir of Patna as the first Hanuman temple in the country and first temple in east India for live darshan through its mobile phone and television networks.

“Mahavir Mandir, Patna recently donated Rs10 crore for Ram temple at Ayodhya and started providing free ‘Ram Rasoi’ (full meal) to the devotees visiting there for darshan of Shri Ram Lalla daily,” he said.

He further said that seven people will be honoured with ‘Shrawan Kumar Award’ on the occasion for their exemplary service and dedication to their parents despite several constraints.

Title: 1st int’l supercross under floodlights
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Vadodara: Two city-based sports firms will be organizing Vadodara International Supercross at Venus Ground on the Old Padra Road on Sunday. It will be the state’s first supercross to be held under floodlights.

“We are organizing this championship on the lines of IPL wherein every team has been bought by a group. These teams will compete with each other and play for number one position. If successful, we will launch a similar championship across the country. We are testing the waters here,” said Veer Patel, whose Lilleria Motorsports has organized the championship with Aashan Sports and Entertainment Pvt Ltd.

Explaining how this new format will help motorsports in India, Patel said, “It will give automobile industry a platform to showcase their new products and also bring out new talented supercross bikers.”

Seven local teams and 28 riders from across the world will compete in the race. The championship that will be inaugurated by chief minister Vijay Rupani.

“The event will have eight races apart from a junior class category where kids under the age of 12 will race,” said Sunil Nigam, who runs Baroda Automotive Racing club.

The track length is 500 metres and the race will have obstacles like triple jump, table of 150 feet, double jump and whoops.

Title: Cong opposes SMC’s drive to contact residents on cleanliness
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

SKLFSKJFSLKDJSLKJD

Surat: Congress leaders have opposed Surat Municipal Corporation’s (SMC) drive to contact people for positive feedback on cleanliness under ‘Swachh Sarvekshan’ campaign.

Congress councillors have written to municipal commissioner stating that health officials have been moving around in the city and contacting people for their feedback on cleanliness. The health officials are asking residents to submit positive feedback and also taking their mobile numbers.

Aslam Cyclewala, Congress councillor, said, “We are not opposed to feedback, but the way the health officials are visiting localities and asking residents for positive feedback is quite disturbing. If people are happy with cleanliness in the city, they are going to vote under Swachh Sarvekshan.”

“In many places, health officials are facing ire of the residents, particularly in slum areas. It is because the residents are unhappy with cleanliness and lack of water, roads, drainage etc in their areas,” he added.

Last year, the Diamond City was pushed to 14th spot from 4th spot in national ranking and in the last two quarters of this year, it is placed at the 20th place.

Sources said health department of SMC has started a rigorous exercise of door-to-door campaign where officials have been instructed to interact with people. The health officials have been moving around at railway station, bus depots, vegetable markets, processing plants, public and community toilets, commercial and residential localities.

Dr Ashish Naik, deputy municipal commissioner (health and hospital), told TOI, “Till now, we have been successful in getting 1.61 lakh feedback. All this is due to door-to-door campaign launched in the city since January 4. We are doing this activity under information, education and communication (IEC) programme. There is no opposition from residents regarding feedback under Swachh Sarvekshan campaign. Actually, we are also visiting colleges and schools to get feedback of the students.”

Title: ‘Dispose manja from terrace, trees to save birds’
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Surat: City-based NGOs , working for the rescue and rehabilitation of the injured animals and birds have urged the residents in the Diamond City to properly dispose the sharp-edged kite strings (manja) left, especially from the trees , to prevent injuries to birds and other animals.

Voluntary organisations stated that the number of birds injured by the manja decreased drastically in 2020 compared to 2019 during the two days of kite flying festival on January 14 and 15. However, they are still getting an average of 150 calls of the bird rescue, majority of them are entangled in the strings on the trees and on the terraces.

Darshan Desai of Prayas NGO told TOI, “We have received 93 calls for bird rescue from different parts of the city on Thursday. Though the festival is over, still we are getting calls for rescue. The manja left on the terrace and those hanging from the trees and other places is hurting the birds.”

“We have been urging people to dispose the manja from the terraces, plants and trees to save the lives of the innocent birds. Number of calls are for pigeon rescue,” he added.

According to Desai, Prayas alone received 303 calls during two days of the festival, out of which there were 14 casualties. About 41 birds flew away after they were given primary treatment by the volunteers.

Snehal Patel of Nature Club Surat, an NGO working for the rescue of birds and animals said, “This year’s Uttrayan was comparatively safer for the birds, but we fear that the killer manja discarded on the roads, terraces and trees are not good for the birds. Our volunteers have been telling the people calling on our helpline to dispose the manja from their locality to save the birds.”

According to Patel, the rescue calls have actually increased after two days of the festival on Thursday. At present, the centre is receiving about 100 calls of bird rescue. Majority of the cases are critical as the birds are badly entangled in the manja.

Title: Shoaib gets bail, court says no evidence found
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Lucknow: There is no evidence to show the involvement of activist and lawyer Mohammad Shoaib in the violence that erupted during a protest against the citizenship law in Lucknow on December 19, said the district court, granting bail to him.

Shoaib was granted bail on Wednesday, 27 days after he was arrested but the court order was released only on Thursday. Shoaib is likely to come out of jail on Friday. According to the order, the prosecution failed to produce evidence to show Shoaib’s involvement in violence during the protest.

Additional district judge SS Pandey granted bail to Shoaib (76), considering that he was not named in the first FIR filed by police on the night of December 19 for the violence. Shoaib was only accused of conspiracy and the prosecution had admitted it had not come across any evidence proving Shoaib’s involvement in arson, the order said.

The court also took into account that fact that co-accused in the case activist SR Darapuri had already been granted bail. Besides, according to the police case diary, injuries to cops including SP (east) Suresh Chandra Rawat were not grievous, it said. Shoaib’s counsel in defence JS Siddiqui said that the administration had barred Shoaib from leaving his house since 6.30pm on December 18. The next day, after the violence, cops had asked him to accompany them around 11.45pm as “the circle officer wanted to meet him”. However, police had shown his arrest from Clarks Awadh trisection around 8.45pm on December 19.

On December 20, Shoaib’s family filed a habeas corpus petition in the high court to seek the reason for his detention. It was then revealed that Shoaib was arrested for involvement in a violent protest against CAA at Parivartan Chowk. The counsel also argued that it was Shoaib’s fundamental right to peacefully protest against government policies he disagreed with. The government advocate, however, said Shoaib was among the prime accused in conspiring the arson on December 19. He said Shoaib had instigated people to participate in the violence and being an advocate, had used help of his wife to protect himself from arrest. Bail was granted on furnishing two sureties of Rs 50,000 each along with a personal bond.

Title: Yes Bk’s cap-raise holds key: Moody’s
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Mumbai: Moody’s has placed Yes Bank ’s ratings under review with a remark that further direction was uncertain. At the same time, the ratings agency has downgraded the bank’s baseline credit assessment to Caa2 from B3. The placing of Yes Bank’s deposit rating of B2 under review reflects Moody’s expectation that the lender’s standalone viability is getting increasingly challenged by its slowness in raising new capital.

The ratings agency said that the potential credit risk to the bank’s creditors is uncertain because there are several diverse scenarios that could affect it in either positive or negative directions. Yes Bank is in discussions with a number of investors to raise new equity capital, which would be credit-positive if executed successfully. If the bank successfully recapitalises, repairs and cleans its balance sheet, its ratings could stabilise or be upgraded. According to Moody’s, if a private sector solution is unsuccessful, and a regulatory led resolution is implemented, Moody’s expects that Indian authorities will strive to maintain systemic stability and avoid losses to depositors and senior creditors. Any concrete measures from Indian authorities to resolve the bank without losses to the depositors and senior creditors could also lead to a stabilisation or an upward movement in the bank’s ratings.

“Because the viability of the bank absent a large capital injection is in question, Moody’s has downgraded the bank’s standalone credit profile or its BCA to Caa2 from B3,” said Moody’s vice-president and senior credit officer Alka Anbarasu.

A scenario where neither a private sector recapitalisation nor balance sheet repair are forthcoming would be credit-negative, and could lead to a downward movement of the bank’s ratings.

Title: Rly workers to protest against Tejas Express
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

The inaugural run of the train is scheduled on January 17 and that it will reach Surat station from Ahmedabad ... Read More

Surat: Railway employees associated with Western Railway Mazdoor Sangh’s (WRMS) Surat branch will hold a protest at Surat railway station against privatized high-speed Tejas Express that will run between Mumbai and Ahmedabad on Friday.

Railway staff associated with WRMS stated that the protest was against privatization of railway services by the government. Tejas Express is being run by private operators through Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC).

Sources said the privatized Tejas Express train will start operations between Mumbai-Ahmedabad from January 19. The inaugural run of the train is scheduled on January 17 and that it will reach Surat station from Ahmedabad at about 12.40pm.

AK Verma, vice-chairman of Surat WRMS, said, “We are against privatization of trains and other railway services. Tejas Express train is being operated by private operators and they will exploit travelling public and earn huge profits without rendering good services.”

Verma added, “National Federation of Indian Railwaymen (NFIR) has already submitted a memorandum to central government against privatization of mail and express trains in the country earlier. Our demand is cancel this decision and allow railways to operate Tejas Express.”

Title: Ahmedabad: Youth knifed in road rage in Shahibaug in front of wife
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A 22-year-old woman from the Asarwa area of the city on Thursday filed an FIR with Shahibaug police alleging that her husband,25, was slashed with a knife by an unidentified man near Chamanpura circle over a road rage incident.

In her FIR, Komal Ghelkar said that she was riding pillion and her husband, Bhupendra Ghelkar was driving a motorcycle going towards Omnagar area. Near Chamanpura circle, a scooter-borne man, aged around 30, tried to hit Bhupendra’s motorcycle.

As Bhupendra told him to drive properly. The man became angry and began abusing Bhupendra. The heated arguments took a violent turn when the man had pulled out a knife and began slashing Bhupendra’s nose, lips, throat and ribs.

Bhupendra began bleeding heavily and a crowd gathered. Seeing the people, the accused fled.

Bhupendra was taken to a nearby hospital where he was admitted. Komal said in the FIR that Bhupendra had been unable to work anywhere due to his illness for eight years.

Shahibaug police registered a complaint of causing hurt using dangerous weapon. The accused is on the run.

This is the second incident of knifing in a road rage in the eastern part of the city. On Wednesday, a 42-year-old businessman from Naroda Road was slashed on his neck by an unknown man over road rage.

Title: Air ambulance counter comes up at Patna airport
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Health minister Mangal Pandey inaugurates an air ambulance counter at Patna airport on Thursday

PATNA: A round the clock air ambulance counter, joint initiative of two private firms, was inaugurated by health minister Mangal Pandey at Jayaprakash Narayan International Airport (JPNI) here on Thursday.

The minister appreciated the joint initiative of the two private companies which provide air ambulance services across the country. “People can directly book air ambulance from this 24x7 counter at Patna airport now to shift patients to hospitals in other cities,” he said.

Patna airport director Bhupesh CH Negi, Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) commandant Vishal Dubey, Airline Operators’ Committee chairman Rupesh Singh and airline executives attended the inaugural function.

An official of the private firm running the air ambulance service said permission had to be obtained from the state hangar earlier for parking the air ambulance for sending patients from Patna to other cities across the country. “Getting permission was a time-taking exercise. Now, people will not have to go through lengthy processes as all the formalities can be completed at the counter itself,” the official said.

Anshu Aman, managing director of the other private firm, said, “We have issued a toll free number – 9931075125 – for the convenience of people. One can avail the air ambulance service by paying Rs 4.80 lakh to 5 lakh. An ICU team, doctors, nurse and two attendants will accompany the patient.”

Aman added, “Ten to 12 patients avail the air ambulance service in Bihar on an average per month through recommendations from the doctors. Now, they can do it on their own.”

Officials of the two companies said they have planned to open similar air ambulance counter at Gaya airport next week. “One air ambulance aircraft will be stationed at Gaya airport,” they added.

Title: Delhi: NGT asks for report on Sanjay Lake
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

NEW DELHI: National Green Tribunal ( NGT ) on Thursday directed Delhi Development Authority ( DDA ) and Delhi Tourism and Transport Development Corporation (DTTDC) to submit a status report on Sanjay Lake in east Delhi after a plea was filed that it was being severely polluted.

Both the parties involved have a month to submit a factual report on the matter, the tribunal directed. A bench headed by NGT chairperson Justice Adarsh Kumar Goel said DDA will be the nodal agency for coordination and compliance. “The report may be submitted by email within one month,” the bench said on Thursday.

NGT’s order came after a plea by city resident R P Singhal, alleging that Sanjay Lake, near Mayur Vihar, was being polluted by sewage.

Title: Auto industry roots for GST reduction, scrappage policy from the budget
Content: CHENNAI: The automobile industry is stressing on a scrappage policy and a 4% cut in GST as top demands from Budget 2020. The sector which has been hit by the worst slowdown in 20 years is also facing a host of safety and emission regulations which will increase the price of vehicles substantially, hurting consumer sentiments even more.“Old vehicles are a big source of pollution and from April 1995 to March 2005 alone there is a pool of 50 million vehicles which if removed from our roads will reduce pollution, save 10 billion litre of fuel and improve demand. The ministry has already given guidelines for scrappage centres but we need a scrappage policy with incentives where industry can also pool in,” said Rajan Wadhera, president, Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM), the industry apex body.The sharp drop in vehicle sales — particularly buses and trucks — has hit the government’s GST collection too so SIAM is lobbying for a cut in GST to improve sales. “With BS6 there will much higher GST collection as vehicles will become expensive but it will also affect demand,” said Wadhera. “We are asking the government to lower GST so that the BS6 price increase is neutralized and the GST collection remains unaffected too,” he added.Industry is also seeking some tax benefits for personal vehicles. “The auto industry is willing to share its portion towards realising the scrappage policy and this would have a more sustainable impact on the environment. Another suggestion is to extend the income tax benefits available for electric cars to other vehicles particularly personal customers beyond professionals and companies,” said Naveen Soni , senior VP-sales and service, Toyota Kirloskar Motor Meanwhile, on the electric mobility side too auto companies are rooting for incentives. “The government should look at providing incentives to stakeholders for sourcing critical raw materials for EV battery manufacturing in India. This will enable a strong EV-centric ecosystem and will be beneficial for the long-term growth of this high-potential space,” said Rajeev Chaba, president & MD, MG Motor India.Current investments for local manufacturing of lithium ion battery will take another 3 years at least to hit the market. Meanwhile the government has slapped a 5% duty on lithium ion cell. Batteries comprise one-third of the EV cost.

Title: Auto industry roots for GST reduction, scrappage policy from the budget
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

CHENNAI: The automobile industry is stressing on a scrappage policy and a 4% cut in GST as top demands from Budget 2020. The sector which has been hit by the worst slowdown in 20 years is also facing a host of safety and emission regulations which will increase the price of vehicles substantially, hurting consumer sentiments even more.

“Old vehicles are a big source of pollution and from April 1995 to March 2005 alone there is a pool of 50 million vehicles which if removed from our roads will reduce pollution, save 10 billion litre of fuel and improve demand. The ministry has already given guidelines for scrappage centres but we need a scrappage policy with incentives where industry can also pool in,” said Rajan Wadhera, president, Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM), the industry apex body.

The sharp drop in vehicle sales — particularly buses and trucks — has hit the government’s GST collection too so SIAM is lobbying for a cut in GST to improve sales. “With BS6 there will much higher GST collection as vehicles will become expensive but it will also affect demand,” said Wadhera. “We are asking the government to lower GST so that the BS6 price increase is neutralized and the GST collection remains unaffected too,” he added.

Industry is also seeking some tax benefits for personal vehicles. “The auto industry is willing to share its portion towards realising the scrappage policy and this would have a more sustainable impact on the environment. Another suggestion is to extend the income tax benefits available for electric cars to other vehicles particularly personal customers beyond professionals and companies,” said Naveen Soni , senior VP-sales and service, Toyota Kirloskar Motor .

Meanwhile, on the electric mobility side too auto companies are rooting for incentives. “The government should look at providing incentives to stakeholders for sourcing critical raw materials for EV battery manufacturing in India. This will enable a strong EV-centric ecosystem and will be beneficial for the long-term growth of this high-potential space,” said Rajeev Chaba, president & MD, MG Motor India.

Current investments for local manufacturing of lithium ion battery will take another 3 years at least to hit the market. Meanwhile the government has slapped a 5% duty on lithium ion cell. Batteries comprise one-third of the EV cost.

Title: Bihar: Three held for kidnapping, killing jeweller
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: City jeweller Mukesh Kumar Gupta, who was kidnapped from Saguna Mor under the Danapur police station area here on January 10, was killed while being taken to Motihari on the same day, police said on Thursday. Mukesh’s body had been disposed of by Motihari police as it remained unidentified even after 72 hours.

The matter came to light after Patna police arrested three criminals from the vicinity of St Karen’s High School on Gola Road here on Thursday. The arrested criminals were identified as Ramashish Kumar alias Ashish Yadav, Aman Kumar and Rajesh Kumar.

Mukesh’s elder brother Rakesh Kumar Gupta had lodged an FIR with Danapur police station on January 11 in connection with the incident. Mukesh had owned a jewellery shop on Kharanja Road at Danapur.

According to police, Mukesh had left for Saguna Mor from his shop after receiving a call on January 10. Later, a man reached the shop using Mukesh’s bike and left after taking jewellery worth of Rs 1.5 lakh from his elder brother Rakesh.

It was Mukesh who had called Rakesh, asking him to hand over the money to the man. After this, Mukesh’s cellphone remained switched off.

Patna SSP Upendra Kumar Sharma said Mukesh was taken to Motihari in a car by four criminals, including the three who were arrested on Thursday, and killed there.

“They had throttled Mukesh to death inside the car and dumped his body along a road the Chiraiyya police station area in Motihari. The body was recovered on the morning of January 11,” Sharma said, adding the fourth accused was evading arrest. “It was in the car of the fourth accused that Mukesh was killed,” the SSP added.

He said Mukesh’s body was disposed of in Motihari after 72 hours according to norms, but his family members identified it after seeing photographs. He said the prime accused, Ramashish, had kidnapped Mukesh with an intention to kill him.

“Ramashish had mortgaged jewellery worth around Rs 1.5 lakh to Mukesh. He wanted to take it back by paying money. However, Mukesh told Ramashish that the money he paid to him was not enough to reclaim entire jewellery,” the SSP said.

He added cellphone and sim card used to call Mukesh at Saguna Mor was seized from Ramashish possession. “Four more cellphones, three country-made pistols, including a semi-automatic one and 33 live cartridges were seized from the possession of the three arrested criminals,” the SSP said.

Title: Hero Cycles: Hero Cycles targets 5% of global e-bike market
Content:
File photo

CHENNAI: Bicycle major Hero Cycles is riding on its overseas acquisitions to plan carve out a 5% share of the global electric bikes market.The company which has recently acquired a strategic stake in German premium e-bike manufacturer HNF Group — together with German investment trust holding IBG Beteiligungsgesellschaft Sachsen-Anhalt mbH — will use the new joint venture to emerge as a new full-range supplier on the European e-bike market Earlier, Hero Cycles acquired Avocet Sports and set up a Global Design Centre in Manchester to establish a presence in the UK market. The latest German acquisition “marks a major step by Hero Cycles towards achieving a 5% share in the global e-bike market by 2022,” said the company in a statement.Hero Cycles has in recent years forayed strongly into the e-bikes space through the brand Lectro. With Europe leading the e-bikes space with a 20% year-on-year growth, it is a focus market for the company. “Hero Motors Company plans to strengthen HNF with investments in design, brand, distribution, and supply chain and HNF will assume a larger role of HMC’s global center of excellence for electric bicycles with the group’s global R&D center based in Berlin,” said the statement. The factory in Bitterfeld will evolve to be the R&D application center along with manufacturing and Hero India will support with back-end manufacturing & supply chain from India.The JV will combine Hero’s low-cost automotive-quality supply chain to HNF’s e-bike design and engineering strength to target global geographies.

Title: Hero Cycles: Hero Cycles targets 5% of global e-bike market
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

File photo

CHENNAI: Bicycle major Hero Cycles is riding on its overseas acquisitions to plan carve out a 5% share of the global electric bikes market.

The company which has recently acquired a strategic stake in German premium e-bike manufacturer HNF Group — together with German investment trust holding IBG Beteiligungsgesellschaft Sachsen-Anhalt mbH — will use the new joint venture to emerge as a new full-range supplier on the European e-bike market .

Earlier, Hero Cycles acquired Avocet Sports and set up a Global Design Centre in Manchester to establish a presence in the UK market. The latest German acquisition “marks a major step by Hero Cycles towards achieving a 5% share in the global e-bike market by 2022,” said the company in a statement.

Hero Cycles has in recent years forayed strongly into the e-bikes space through the brand Lectro. With Europe leading the e-bikes space with a 20% year-on-year growth, it is a focus market for the company. “Hero Motors Company plans to strengthen HNF with investments in design, brand, distribution, and supply chain and HNF will assume a larger role of HMC’s global center of excellence for electric bicycles with the group’s global R&D center based in Berlin,” said the statement. The factory in Bitterfeld will evolve to be the R&D application center along with manufacturing and Hero India will support with back-end manufacturing & supply chain from India.

The JV will combine Hero’s low-cost automotive-quality supply chain to HNF’s e-bike design and engineering strength to target global geographies.

Title: Tatas, 2 investors to buy 49% in GMR Airports
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

(Representative image)

NEW DELHI/MUMBAI: A consortium of Tata Group and two financial investors will now buy 49% in GMR Airports , operator of the Delhi airport which is the largest in the country, instead of 44.4% as proposed earlier.

In March 2019, the consortium had planned to invest Rs 8,000 crore for a 44.4% stake in GMR Airports. But the deal ran into regulatory hurdles as rules do not allow a corporate owning an airline to have more than 10% in an airport.

Tata, which runs two airlines — Vistara and AirAsia India — in the country, was to own 19.7% in GMR Airports, while the two investors — GIC and SSG Capital — were to hold 14.8% and 9.9%. Competitors of Tata’s domestic airlines had opposed its foray into the airport sector on carrier ownership grounds.

The increased stake purchase of 49% will now see Tata’s share in GMR Airports coming down in a bid to comply with the rules. The two investors’ shares will go up in GMR Airports, which runs Asia’s sixth biggest airport at Delhi as well as the Hyderabad airport. GIC will become the largest shareholder in the consortium.

In October 2019, the country’s antitrust agency, Competition Commission of India, had approved Tata and the two investors’ deal to purchase up to 55.2% in GMR Airports, subject to Tata carrying out certain modifications. Tata intends to route its investment in GMR Airports through Tata Realty and Infrastructure, while GIC will do it via Singapore-based Valkyrie, and SSG Capital through Solis, also based in Singapore. Promoter GMR Infrastructure is divesting a large stake in the airports business as it wants to deleverage its balance sheet.

Title: Patna University VC: Huge scope to create knowledge resource in country
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Ras Bihari Prasad Singh

PATNA: Patna University vice-chancellor Rash Bihari Prasad Singh said here on Thursday that even though population growth has so long been considered as a major constraint to India’s developmental process, the demographic dividend may well be utilised for ensuring exponential growth of knowledge resource.

Speaking as chief guest at the inaugural function of the 4th ‘Knowledge dissemination workshop’ organised by PU Population Research Centre (PRC) at Wheeler Senate House here, Singh said as many as 3.92 lakh babies are born in the world every day out of which 67,000 are born in India alone.

“While ways and means are already being found to check this population explosion, efforts should also be made to develop our country with such a vast population into a land of huge knowledge resource. Fortunately, 67% of the country’s population happens to be youth which can be properly trained to turn our problems into opportunities,” he said.

The directors of all the PRCs, except Jammu and Kashmir, are attending the two-day workshop. Altogether 26 research papers are to be presented at the workshop and a compendium containing 44 papers would be published.

Title: Tejashwi Prasad Yadav takes on Asaduddin Owaisi, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on NPR in Kishanganj
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

PATNA: RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav on Thursday launched his three-day ‘Pratirodh Sabha’ for Seemanchal region from Kishanganj with a veiled attack on the AIMIM president, Asaduddin Owaisi , who had addressed a rally here recently.

“Some parties are trying to create confusion in Bihar. Their leader (Owaisi) came here and said he is not afraid of Lalu Ji. He should have asked his ally, the Telangana CM, to stop NPR instead of preaching against NRC and NPR across the country,” Tejashwi said.

Tejashwi was addressing a rally at Marwari College in the Muslim-dominated Kishanganj district. His Pratirodh Sabha initiative is seen as a bid to stake claim on the Muslim votes of Seemanchal as the state gears up for polls later in the year.

The leader of opposition in Bihar also hit out at CM Nitish Kumar on NPR. He said Nitish is trying to fool people by claiming he will not allow implementation of the National Register of Citizen (NRC), but his government is allowing NPR here.

“I am challenging the CM that if he really doesn’t want to implement NRC then he should immediately call a special session of Bihar assembly and pass a resolution that NPR will not be implemented in the state…NPR is the first step for NRC,” Tejashwi said.

On NPR he said, “NPR is a census pro forma in which people will have to tell about the place of birth of their father. Division will start there itself. Hence, we completely oppose NPR and will not allow implementation of NPR as well as NRC in Bihar at any cost. We are ready to give our blood for preventing the division of the country. We will keep fighting.”

It was his first public meet in Seemanchal, which virtually kickstarted his party’s poll campaign from Kishanganj, which saw an AIMIM candidate win in the assembly bypoll held last year. Muslims form the traditional vote bank of RJD along with Yadavs in the state.

The Seemanchal region has a high Muslim population. According to the 2011 Census, Muslims constitute 42.95% in Araria, 38.46% in Purnea, 44.47% in Katihar and the highest in Kishanganj at 67.98%.

In a bid to woo the predominant Muslim population of the region, Tejashwi said “Whenever we talk about shortcomings of BJP-led NDA, they say they will send us to Pakistan. I would like to assert that Muslims of Seemanchal themselves can destroy Pakistan.”

Title: Environment protection government’s priority: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

PATNA: Chief minister Nitish Kumar on Thursday said steps being taken by the state government to curb pollution, conserve water, promote greenery and protect the environment will greatly benefit the future generations. The CM said the government was taking several steps to control pollution by imposing relevant laws.

Addressing the ‘64th Conference of Chairmen and Member Secretaries of the Central and State Pollution Control Boards and Committees’ at Bihar Museum here, the CM said laws have been made for pollution control, but creating awareness among people about environment conservation is more important. “Awareness among people leads to more effective implementation of laws,” he said.

Speaking on air pollution in Bihar, Nitish said air pollution has become a major concern for Bihar where the number of vehicles has increased manifold with increase in purchasing power of people and good roads. He highlighted steps being taken towards environment conservation by the state government through its ambitious ‘Jal Jeevan Hariyali (JJH)’ mission.

“Around Rs 24,524 crore will be spent on JJH campaign by the state government in next three years and eight crore saplings will be planted across the state,” he said.

Nitish added global warming and climate change have already started affecting weather pattern. “Earlier, the average rainfall of the state was 1,200mm to 1,500mm. It came down to 1,027mm in last 30 years and further reduced to 901mm in last 13 years,” he said.

Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi said environment protection was a top priority of the state government. “About 50% hospitals in Bihar are using bio-medical waste processing facilities upon strict directives from Bihar State Pollution Control Board (BSPCB),” he said.

Central Pollution Control Board chairman S P Singh Parihar, principal secretary of ministry of environment, forest and climate change (EFACC) C K Mishra, CM’s principal secretary Chanchal Kumar, principal secretary EFACC Dipak Kumar Singh, BSPCB chairman Ashok Ghosh and chairman of other state boards and committees were also present.

Title: Liquor smugglers injure 10 cops, snatch arms in Bhojpur
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

ARA: Ten cops, including a woman SHO, were injured when bootleggers launched an audacious attack on a raiding police team, which had seized a large consignment of IMFL and arrested several suspects at a village in Bhojpur district late on Wednesday evening.

According to reports, the attackers not only snatched a carbine and an INSAS rifle from the cops, but also fled with the 72 cartons of IMFL seized by the cops. They also managed to free three suspects arrested during the raid and damaged a police vehicle.

The incident took place at Kaushik Dularpur village during a raid being led by Mufassil SHO Jyoti Kumari, who was injured in the stone-pelting attack. Three cops, havildar Shammi Aalam, homeguard Ram Iqbal and driver Rabindra Kumar, who received serious injuries, are admitted at the Ara Sadar hospital.

Police sources said the police party was outnumbered and came under heavy stone pelting, which left all 10 cops, including SHO Jyoti Kumari, injured.

After the incident was reported, Bhojpur SP Sushil Kumar, along with ASP Ambrish Rahul, ASP (operation) Nitin Kumar, and SHOs of Town and Nawada stations started a massive search operation during which the looted weapons and some of the seized cartons were recovered.

“We have arrested 29 people, including some women, and they are being interrogated. We have also recovered the looted weapons. Till now we have managed to recover 32 cartons of IMFL and efforts are on to recover the rest,” the Bhojpur SP said.

Title: India set to become defence equipment manufacturing hub: Rajnath
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Rajnath Singh flags off 51st K9 VAJRA-T, a tracked self-propelled Howitzer developed and designed by L&T, in S... Read More

Surat: India will soon become an arms manufacturing hub and net exporter of defence equipment because of active participation of private sector now, defence minister Rajnath Singh said in Hazira on Thursday.

He flagged off the 51st K9 VAJRA-T gun from L&T’s armoured system complex (ASC) in the presence of group chairman AM Naik. L&T has till now delivered 51 K9 VAJRA-T guns of the total 100 to Indian Army.

Addressing the gathering at the ASC, Rajnath said, ““I have been told that more than 75 per cent of K9 VAJRA-T gun has been manufactured in India. Over 5,000 people have got direct employment and 12,500 indirect employment through this complex. It is a matter of great pride for us. This is first time after Independence that private sector is giving a new dimension to manufacturing of defence equipment in the country. Strategic partnership (SP) model, which has been introduced in defence production policy, will enable private sector to manufacture fighter aircraft, helicopters, submarines and armoured vehicles and emerge as global giants.”

“In the past, defence industry could not perform to its potential as the private sector did not receive the support. Thus, our dependence on import of arms for our defence forces increased. We are prepared to make policy changes to provide a better platform to both public and private sectors to work together and contribute in nation building,” the defence minister said, commending L&T for ensuring its participation under the SP model..

He said the government was determined to make India a defence manufacturing hub under ‘Make in India’ initiative. The $26 billion defence industry will provide employment to over three million people by 2025, the defence minister added. The government is setting up defence corridors in Uttar Pradesh and Tamil Nadu for promoting manufacturing of defence equipment in the country.

“The government has taken various initiatives to increase manufacturing of defence equipment in India. We have simplified industry licensing process, increased foreign direct investment (FDI) cap, taken steps to promote defence exports, streamlined defence offsets policy, establishing defence investor cell, providing government-owned trial and testing facility to private sector and launching schemes for startups and SMEs to promote innovation,” Rajnath said.

The defence minister after he visited the L&T’s ASC said it was a strong example of ‘naye bharat ki nayi soch’.

The guns are equipped with India specific modifications

L&T began manufacturing the K9 Vajra-T 155mm/52 calibre tracked, self propelled Howitzer gun after winning the largest contract ever awarded to an Indian private company by the ministry of defence through global competitive bidding. The contract involves delivery of 100 guns in 42 months with an associated engineering support package (ESP) covering spares, documentation and training etc. The 51 guns delivered are equipped with India specific modifications such as auxiliary power pack, air-conditioning and firefighting systems etc for desert conditions.

Title: Textile weaver cheated of fabrics worth Rs30 lakh by three persons
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Surat: A textile weaver was cheated by a broker , owner of a textile shop and a mill owner to the tune of Rs30 lakh worth fabrics. Salabatpura police on Thursday registered a complaint in this connection and launched a manhunt to nab the accused who are on the run.

Vipul Shah, 40, owner of a powerloom unit, had supplied grey cloth worth Rs30 lakh to Mahesh Sarang, proprietor of Ganesh Fabrics; Pinkesh Patel, proprietor of Kailash Silk Mills; and Bhupendra Joshi two years ago. The trio had issued cheques for part payment against delivery of fabrics, but all the cheques bounced when presented in bank.

Shah said in his complaint that he had contacted the trio on their mobile phones, but they stopped receiving his calls. A few days ago, the complainant met Bhupendra Joshi, broker, who threatened him and asked him not to demand money again.

SG Chauhan, police sub-inspector, told TOI, “We have registered the complaint against the trio under IPC sections 406, 420, 120(b), 504 and 506(2). One of the accused had threatened the complainant a few days ago. This prompted the complainant to approach us. A manhunt has been launched to arrest the accused.”

Title: Co-lo case: Sebi clears 9 ex-NSE, current execs
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Mumbai: Sebi has given a clean chit to nine people, including NSE ’s former MD Ravi Narain , in a case in which it was alleged that a host of the exchange’s executives had colluded to favour a handful of brokers. The two sides had allegedly teamed up to make illegal gains using the NSE’s optical fibre network that connected to its derivatives trading server.

Popularly called the NSE’s co-location or co-lo case, there were several allegations of wrongdoing against Narain and other ex-NSE executives — senior VP (operations) R Nandakumar, co-lo head Jagdish Joshi, and chief technology officers (CTOs) N Muralidharan & Ravi Apte. Several serving NSE executives named in the case have also been exonerated. These are chief operating officer (trading) Mayur Sindhwad, CTO (projects) Sankarson Banerjee, CTO (operations) G Shenoy, and VP (regulations) Suprabhat Lala .

The case relates to the allegations of wrongdoing between 2013 and 2015.

In its order, the markets regulator said that none of the nine executives was occupying a post of director and/or a key managerial position at NSE during the relevant period, which was between April and July, 2015. “The materials available on record also don’t indicate even remotely the role of any of the noticees as an employee of NSE in facilitating Sampark Infotainment to establish the (optical fibre) connectivity at NSE,” the regulator said in its order.

In this high-profile case, it was alleged that exchange executives had allowed a non-registered service provider Sampark Infotainment to lay optic fibre network connectivity between the exchange’s trading room and the servers of select brokers. This was done in such a way that these brokers enjoyed a faster speed of trading over all others.

In the exchange trading business, where there are very sophisticated computers that use complex algorithms to take advantage of price discrepancies within micro-seconds, such advantages could result in huge profits.

It was also alleged that these nine NSE executives did not act in a fair and equitable manner in their dealing with the brokers. A further allegation was that NSE had amended its rules in an opaque manner to allow Sampark Infotainment to provide network services from within its premises, despite the company not being registered with it. Sebi didn’t find any evidence in this matter too to proceed against these officials.

Title: ‘Pay as you use’ motor cover sees test launch
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Mumbai: The insurance regulator has approved two proposals for usage-based motor insurance policies under its regulatory sandbox scheme.

The scheme allows insurance companies to come out with products that are not just innovative but radically different in the way business is done. However, the policies have to be launched as a pilot project and distributed in relatively small numbers in a controlled environment until they are proven.

Bajaj Allianz’s motor insurance policy allows customers to pay the premium depending on how many kilometres the car has travelled. Edelweiss General Insurance has got the nod for an app-based multi-vehicle, usage-based floater policy for motor own damage cover.

Bajaj Allianz has also launched a health insurance product with a co-pay feature (where the customer pays part of the bill) in partnership with fitness tracker GOQii. “I firmly believe that a healthy lifestyle, coupled with health insurance, increases the life expectancy of a person. Under the co-pay model, we are associating with GOQii wherein, based on the engagement level of the insured on the health platform offered by GOQii, the percentage of their co-pay will be decided,” said Bajaj Allianz MD & CEO Tapan Singhel . “Additionally, in India, the premium for a motor insurance policy for the own damage part is based on the age, make and model of the vehicle. ‘Pay as you consume’ model will help us change,” said Singhel. According to Edelweiss General Insurance, the IRDAI operational guidelines for the sandbox allow the pilot product launch only between February 1 and July 31 this year. “The emerging era of shared mobility makes it a very relevant product for vehicle owners today, where they can pay as per the usage of the vehicle and/or driving behaviour. Further, as the policy covers multiple vehicles in one, it saves you time and any hassle involved with buying multiple policies for multiple vehicles,” said Edelweiss General Insurance CEO and executive director Shanai Ghosh.

Title: HDFC Bank to upgrade credit card systems
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: HDFC Bank will carry out an upgrade of its credit card platform to provide new features that will give more power to customers in a phased manner. The upgrade will happen on January 18, between 1 am and 12 noon, leading to a limited outage in services. Though phone banking, net/mobile banking and interactive voice response systems will be unavailable for card customers, cards will continue to function for both online and offline purchases.

A spokesperson for the bank said it will be upgrading to VisionPlus V10, the latest in global banking architecture. “This migration is an industry-first in India and will offer a superior user experience for credit card customers. It will enable the bank to be completely future-ready and enhance customer experience by offering faster resolution of credit card disputes. From about a week to less than a day and instant card creation, even during browsing on an e-commerce site,” the spokesperson said.

The instant card generation will initially be available only for existing customers but is likely to be extended to non-customers later. The bank will speed up dispute resolution by making the process straight through. The new system will allow the users to file disputes by clicking photographs of charge slips and uploading them.

In future, there will be value-added service through partnerships, as the bank will be providing faster API (application programmed interface) integration, allowing more third-party service providers to plug in to offer their services to HDFC Bank customers.

Cardholders who are travelling overseas will be able to apply for an immediate increase in their credit limits through the bank’s app.
