Title: Gujarat: Vejalpore nagarpalika president, 250 BJP members resign from party
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

A grab from CCTV footage of the meeting in which Vejalpore Nagarpalika VP Santosh Pundhkar is seen attacking p... Read More

SURAT: In a major blow to BJP in Navsari, president of the Vejalpore Nagarpalika , Rajesh Modi along with 250 supporters resigned from the party’s membership on Thursday. The flood of resignations follows the party leadership’s failure to take disciplinary action against the vice-president of the nagarpalika who had slapped Modi during the general board meeting in December.

Unruly scenes were witnessed at the general board meeting of Vejalpore Nagarpalika on December 27 after the issue of the expansion of Navsari Nagarpalika’s limits came up for discussion.

After he was not allowed to speak, vice-president Santosh Pundhkar got irritated and slapped Rajesh Modi at the meeting.

Sources said that there are a total of 36 members in the Vejalpore Nagarpalika, of which 33 are from BJP and three from Congress. More than a year ago, Pundhkar also tried to bring about a no confidence motion against Modi by forming a rival group with 15 members of the nagarpalika.

However, as there was no discussion held on the no confidence motion against the president in any of the general board meetings held in the last one-and-a-half-years, Pundhkar and his supporters were extremely angry.

During the last general board meeting on December 27, verbal exchanges took place between Modi and Pundhkar over the expansion issue, where Pundhkar slapped Modi in front of the entire nagarpalika members.

Talking to TOI, Modi said, “Pundhkar had formed a group of 15 BJP members in the nagarpalika to remove me from the post and take the control. He wanted to do wrong things to earn money illegally, which I opposed many times. As none of his work was done in the nagarpalika, he took the opportunity to slap me during the general board meeting.”

Modi further said that he had given an ultimatum till January 14 to the party leadership to suspend Pundhkar and his group of members in the nagarpalika. However, after no action was taken, they decided enmass to tender resignation. “I am also prepared to resign as the president of Vejalpore nagarpalika,” he added.

When contacted, Navsari district BJP pesident, Naresh Patel said, “We had assured Modi of taking action against Pundhkar and other 15 members of nagarpalika. But he resigned from the party. I have received information from the party leadership that all the 15 members including Pundhkar will be suspended for their act before January 20.”

Title: Despite nation-wide ban, plastic kites and Chinese manja have free run this Sankranti
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

HYDERABAD: Sankranti , turned out to be a messy affair with many areas in the city littered with remnants of plastic kites and Chinese manja this year. Ironically, there is a state-wide ban on single-use plastic and nation-wide ban on manufacture and sale of Chinese manja.

Environment Foundation of India’s Arun Krishnamurthy said, “Debris of plastic from kites and manja was found on city streets, drains and even tree tops. This is going to cause a considerable harm to the environment for years.”

“The single-use plastic ban needs to be enforced strictly. It is also proof that National Green Tribunal’s ban on Chinese manja is not being implemented properly,” environmental activist Prof K Purushotham Reddy said.

On Thursday, Meerpet police recorded the statement of 14-year-old Mandala Narsimha, who suffered burns when his kite came in contact with overhead electric lines.

“When the boy pulled the manja, sparks from the electric lines and fell on him. The dry grass on which he was standing also caught fire,” Meerpet SI B Krishna Reddy said.

Sai Anirudh, a resident of Habsiguda, said, “I had a near-death experience a day before Sankranti after a plastic kite came flying down and got stuck on my face while I was driving my two-wheeler. I couldn’t breathe or see anything until I realised what was happening and removed the plastic from my face.”

Taskforce police seized Chinese manja worth Rs 2.6 lakh from Shivlal Kite Shop in Himayathnagar, Gopal Singh Kites Shop in Domalguda on Tuesday night and apprehended the shop owners Birju Shivlal and Lalchita Kishan.

Telangana State Forest Department officials added that six mobile teams were formed to check sale and purchase of Chinese manja.

“Six mobile squads conducted searches on 250 shops and recovered 118 kg of synthetic manja,” a forest department release said.

Birds bear brunt of festivities

The forest department officials and volunteers of wildlife and environmental NGOs rescued 39 birds including pigeons, crows, eagles and black kites during Sankranti celebration. According to rescue volunteers, a few birds were found dead and several others were injured after getting caught in manja between January 13 and 16.

Soudharm Bhandari from Greater Hyderabad Society for Prevention of Cruelty to Animals said eight birds died in past three days due to injuries from glass-coated manja. Forest department asked citizens to contact on helpline number (18004255364 & 040-23231440).

Title: Free power, water in Delhi: AAP to give guarantee cards
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Arvind Kejriwal

NEW DELHI: As free schemes take centre stage ahead of Delhi assembly polls , Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is planning to give guarantee cards to the people of the national capital. The cards will guarantee people 200 units of free electricity and 20,000 litres of free water per month for the next five years, apart from free bus ride for women and free pilgrimage scheme for senior citizens. The party is also mulling appointment of “mohalla marshals” in several areas to make them secure.

The guarantee cards will be delivered to the residents in all 70 assembly constituencies well before the assembly polls, which are scheduled to take place on February 8. AAP Rajya Sabha MP ND Gupta said that the guarantee cards and the party’s poll manifestos are likely to be distributed separately. We are planning to distribute guarantee cards before the manifestos, sources said.

Gupta said that the appointment of “mohalla marshals” may find a mention in the party’s manifesto. “These marshals would be deployed as security persons in various mohallas and would be paid by the government for their services.”

Free welfare schemes of the AAP government have found many supporters in Delhi. In a bid to capitalise on the love of people for the free schemes, Delhi Congress has also announced that if elected to power, the party will give monthly 600 units of electricity and 20,000 litres of water free.

AAP and BJP functionaries have been locking horns over the free welfare schemes of late. Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal and other leaders have repeatedly claimed that the saffron party would stop free services like electricity, water and bus rides for women, if it came to power in Delhi. AAP MP Sanjay Singh had on Wednesday got into a confrontation with BJP parliamentarian Gautam Gambhir on the issue. “BJP functionary Anil Jain had said that his party was against any kind of free services to people. Now, Gambhir has contradicted the claims made by Manoj Tiwari,” Singh said.

Hitting out at chief minister Arvind Kejriwal, Gambhir had said that he was not against free services for poor, but those who could afford them should pay nominal charges. Singh alleged that BJP leaders were continuously opposing the free welfare schemes of the AAP government.

Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari has, however, clarified that no existing subsidy started by the AAP government would be altered. On Thursday, he again slammed AAP leaders who have been claiming that BJP would stop the free welfare schemes if it came to power in Delhi.

“AAP leaders are habitual liars and always twist the facts to suit their interests. After coming to power, BJP will give five times the benefits given by the AAP government. Several central schemes that were stopped by the AAP government, would benefit people” Tiwari said.

Title: Natesan amassed Rs 1,600cr illegally: Senkumar
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Former DGP T P Senkumar , who claimed to be an active SNDP union member after his retirement, has accused SNDP Yogam general secretary Vellappally Natesan of amassing illegal wealth worth Rs 1,600 crore and demanded a comprehensive probe against the members of Vellapally family.

Addressing reporters along with SNDP union leader Subhash Vasu, who raised similar allegations against Natesan, on Thursday, Senkumar alleged that Natesan has a hoard of wealth amounting to Rs 1,600 crore, ‘which he accumulated through unaccounted donations received against school and college admissions and appointment of teachers’.

The duo also demanded an administrator rule in SNDP Yogam for a three-month period and fresh elections after that. “Many people have told me about the bitter experiences they had due to Natesan’s leadership. There are schools and colleges which are managed by the SNDP Yogam and Sree Narayana Trust,” he said.

“We must know where this money went,” Senkumar said demanding probes by directorate of revenue intelligence, income tax department and enforcement directorate. Senkumar also accused Natesan of mismanagement of the micro financing project aimed to benefit Ezhava community and misappropriation of funds. “Majority of people converting to other religions are from Ezhava community. This is because of poverty. The micro financing initiative was supposed to give them loans at a low 4% interest rate. I hope the legal battle against the financial fraud will have a proper conclusion,” he said.

He also questioned the authenticity of internal elections of SNDP Yogam and alleged that Natesan was winning the elections through unfair means like bogus votes. Senkumar said Natesan and family should stay away from the Yogam administration for a while. “A reputed and reliable retired judge must take over the administration for three months, and a free and fair election should be conducted under the watchful eyes of the judge. We are ready to accept Natesan, if re-elected properly,” he added.

Title: Make expert committees’ reports public: Farmers
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Amaravati: Upping the ante, farmers in the capital city area demanded that the state government should first make the experts committee reports public before seeking their opinion.

In response to the advice of the high-level committee comprising ministers and officials, to file their suggestions and objections with the Capital Region Development Authority (CRDA) commissioner, the LPS farmers sent mails to the CRDA office. Farmers said the minister’s appeal on the issue was amateurish. They raised strong objection to the government calling for their views without making its stance clear. “Everything is going on in closed-door meetings. The experts’ committee reports are not made open. High-level committee meeting notes are not circulated. How could they expect us to respond?,” asked farmers’ leader and advocate Mallela Seshagiri Rao.

The LPS farmers filed separate petitions to CRDA commissioner taking strong exception to the way it was handling a serious issue without consulting them. “We are the stakeholders of Amaravati, the capital city development project. How could the government take unilateral decision and ask us to file objections and suggestions after taking a call,” said N Venkateswara Rao of Venkatapalem village.

He said he had become a stakeholder of the project by giving his land and getting a returnable plot from the CRDA. He said he has the right to make submissions to the committee and the experts committee should have heard all the LPS farmers before finalising its report .

Another farmer, K Srinivasa Rao, demanded that the government should first make both the experts committee reports (GN Rao committee and BCG committee) open and allow the people to file their objections.

“Without the material mentioned, I will be handicapped to make submissions. It is against natural justice,” said Rao. The farmers asked the CRDA commissioner to provide the copies of expert committee reports. He also demanded the CRDA to release the experts’ committee reports in Telugu which could put the CRDA in a spot. The farmers also objected to the high-level committee comprising ministers and officials going through the contents of the reports without making them public documents.

Meanwhile, CRDA made special arrangements to accept suggestions and objections from farmers at the CRDA office as the high-level committee set a Friday deadline for the process.

Title: 10-yr-old dies, another boy suffers burns
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: A 10-year-old boy accidentally fell from a four-storied building at Madhapur, on Wednesday, while flying kite and died. In another incident, a boy suffered burns when the kite he was flying came in contact with an overhead electric wire at Badangpet.

According to Madhapur police, Nikhil, along with three other boys, went to an under-construction building to fly kites . “While flying the kite, Nikhil fell from the fourth floor and died,” Madhapur SI V Srinivas said.

In another case, 14-year-old Mandala Narsimha suffered burns when his kite came in touch with an electric wire in Badangpet. “When the boy pulled the manja, sparks from the electric wire fell on him. The dry grass on which Narasimha was standing also caught fire and he suffered burns,” Meerpet SI B Krishna Reddy said. The body was shifted to Osmania General Hospital for treatment. TNN

Title: JNU: 72 per cent of students registered for session
Content:
Jawaharlal Nehru University

NEW DELHI: According to the JNU administration, 6,140 students have registered for the winter session, accounting for 72.3% of the student population. Of these, 4,192 are hostel residents and 1,948 day scholars. The administration said these figures constituted 65% of the hostellers and 95% of day students. These claims were contested by JNUSU , which said the figures cited by the administration related actually to students who had cleared their mess dues.The university also extended the last date for registration by another two days to January 17. In a statement on Thursday, JNU vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar said that there was a last minute rush on January 15, the last day, and students had approached the administration to extend the deadline for the winter semester registration.After the changes in the hostel fee structure, a hostel resident paid from Rs 3,008 to Rs 3,020 for a period of six month during the registration process. This includes Rs 1,800 for hostel rent for six months, Rs 1,100 as security deposit and Rs 108-120 as tuition fee.The VC’s statement also claimed, “All schools and centres have announced their time-tables and are working on conducting tests for those students who did not complete the last semester academic requirements. The university has been doing everything possible to help the students continue their academic activities. A great number of faculty members are actively working to make sure that the academic interests of the students are addressed.”JNUSU had called for a boycott of both classes and the winter semester registration process when the university refused to accede to the demand for the hostel fee hike rollback. The protests have been going on since October 28, when the Inter-Hall Administration meeting was disrupted because JNUSU representatives hadn’t been invited. The amended IHA manual was, nevertheless, passed, prompting immediate protests by the students.JNUSU asserted that the university administration was doling out misleading numbers. Contrary to the administration’s claims about the number of registrations, the students’ union maintained that only 40-45% students had registered. Satish Chandra, JNUSU general secretary, said, “The administration is giving incorrect data. They are counting those who have cleared their mess dues, claiming them as registrations. In fact, many students are yet to register and the boycott of the registration process will continue."

Title: BJP fails to win civic body byelections in Varanasi, Sonbhadra
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

BJP flag in a rally

VARANASI: The Bharatiya Janata Party ( BJP ) has failed to win the municipal corporation byelection in Varanasi and two nagar panchayats in Sonbhadra district.

Samajwadi Party (SP) candidate Shafikuzzama Ansari Babu registered victory in Saraiyya ward (66) of Varanasi Municipal Corporation (VMC) with 1,752 votes on Thursday, while Congress and BJP candidates finished at fourth and fifth positions, respectively. The seat had gone vacant after the death of Riyazuddin Ansari, father of the winning candidate.

An Independent and a candidate of All India Majlis-e-Ittehad-ul-Muslimeen (AIMIM) secured second and third positions with 1,558 and 1,234 votes, respectively. The Congress candidate could manage 533 votes while the BJP candidate got only 408 votes.

SP district president Piyush Yadav , city president Rajkumar Jaiswal, senior party leader Shalini Yadav and many others joined the victory celebrations. “ The victory is the result of party workers’ hard work,” said Piyush Yadav.

In Chopan Nagar Panchayat bypoll in Sonbhadra district, Independent candidate Farida Begum, widow of former chairman Imteyaz Ahmed, defeated BJP’s Satya Prakash Tiwari for the post of chairman by a margin of 550 votes. Farida got 2,873 votes, while Satya Prakash got 2,323 votes.

Another Independent candidate, Nisha Devi, widow of former chairman Babloo Singh, registered victory by defeating Anil Singh (Independent) with a margin of 1,587 votes for the post of chairman of Renukoot Nagar Panchayat in Sonbhadra district. Nisha got 3,476 votes, and Anil secured 1,889 votes. BJP candidate Sharda Devi could get only 51 votes.

Title: Kirana store to Bollywood, Jeff Bezos feels Mumbai’s pulse
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos with partner Lauren Sanchez at an event on Thursday

MUMBAI: No matter what the analysts tell you, brick and mortar stores are here to stay. At least for as long as Jeff Bezos needs to cook. The wealthiest man in the world who introduced the world to online shopping carts is often found walking the aisles of a grocery store in Seattle, pushing that metal wire cart loaded with all that he needs to indulge his passion for cooking. “I’m not a good cook, but I like to cook. I just like to walk the aisles of a grocery store without a plan and then put together a meal,” said Bezos, on his first trip to Mumbai on Wednesday.

Love for the physical store isn’t limited to his own pleasures. The founder of the world’s largest online retail giant has been courting neighbourhood mom-and-pop stores in the country as delivery agents. “In fact, I just visited a tiny kirana store today which was an incredible experience. They do regular business but they also provide a space for online packages. I met this young man who helps his parents run the store and how it’s improved their lives to have this extra source of income was a moving experience,” said Bezos, while fielding questions from actor Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Zoya Akhtar at a gathering from the Indian film industry.

For Bezos, who has been to India thrice since his first trip 11 years ago, “there haven’t been perceptible changes of great magnitude” . But it is for those reasons that he finds the country endearing. “Certain thi-ngs are the same and I love those things. Every time I come here I see so much energy, dynamism and colour… everywhere you go and everything that you do, I’ve never seen more diversity in the world. Also, everybody here seems to be focused on self improvement. I get a boost of energy. I’m like wow, it’s so alive here,” he said.

The centi-billionaire worth $116 billion did not perfect his winning formula right at the outset, though. “I wanted to be an archaeologist and that was pre-Indiana Jones. Then I went to college wanting to be a physicist but realised half way through I wanted to pursue computer science which became my greatest passion and that’s how I ended up doing what I do,” Bezos recounted.

Clearly, time isn’t something that Bezos has on his hands, one would imagine but the man who at 56, is perhaps more occupied than most people are in the prime of their lives, dismisses the thought. “There’s this false idea that CEOs are under the most stress. No, but why? I’m a CEO and when you’re in charge you can delegate your stress. It’s not hard work that people dislike, it’s being out of control and I hate being over scheduled,” is how he put it.

If it’s his grandparents that Bezos considers his greatest influence, it is an unlikely item in his wardrobe that he credits as his “lucky” charm. “A pair of flashy Texan cowboy boots with red stars that you’ll see me wearing every time we send a rocket into the sky,” said Bezos, the space-obsessed cofounder of an aerospace company who revealed that the alien official in the last Star Trek film was “indeed me”.

Title: Agra: Scared of injection, murder accused confess to crime
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Nahar decided to kill his paramour as she was not able to conceive

AGRA: Directions for an injection was all it took for Agra police to call out the bluff of a 35-year-old man who had allegedly murdered his paramour and was acting unconscious to escape with around Rs 1.5 lakh she had received as alimony.

Identified as Nahar Singh , a resident of Benai Kala village of Etmadpur police jurisdiction, the accused had on Wednesday night made a distress call to emergency helpline 112 informing them about an attack by a gang of robbers near Sikarata village. He claimed that they waylaid him while he was heading home along with his ‘wife’ Preeti (28) on a bike and robbed him of Rs 12,000 at gunpoint. He added that they even killed his ‘wife’ when she resisted the robbery bid.

Superintendent of police (rural west) Ravi Kumar said, “As Etmadpur police was conducting a raid in a nearby location in connection with another case, they rushed to the spot mentioned by Nahar along with the Dial 112 team. They then found him lying on road in a partially unconscious state. However, our personnel noticed that he didn’t have even a single scratch on his body and his wallet, mobile phone and bike were all intact while the woman was lying dead in a pool of blood.”

“The accused claimed that a gang attacked them and killed his wife before fleeing with cash. Our team immediately cordoned off the area and sent both of them to S N Medical College. While the woman was declared brought dead, the accused was lying in an ‘unconscious’ state even though doctors could not find any injury mark. Suspecting foul play, our team asked doctors if they can use an injection to help him gain consciousness, on hearing which the accused jumped up from the bed and tried to escape,” he added.

The SP further said, “After conducting a thorough medical check-up, we decided to question the accused. He soon confessed that Preeti was a divorcee with whom he was in a live-in relationship for many months. Though he was planning to settle down with her, he was unhappy as she was not able to conceive a baby boy. Hence, decided to eliminate her to steal the money she had received as alimony.”

Police said that Nahar is already married and has three daughters. They registered a case against him under IPC section 302 ( murder ) based on a written complaint lodged by Preeti’s relatives.

At the time of filing this report, a panel of doctors were conducting an autopsy of the victim to ascertain the cause of death. Police sources, however, claimed that the victim was probably killed by a sharp-edged instrument as the skin on her head was peeled off.
