Title: As meat prices soar, revelry muted on last day of Sankranti
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Vijayawada: The three day-long Sankranti celebrations concluded in the city on Thursday. Citizens celebrated Kanuma, the third day of Sankranti, with great religious fervour.

People did pooja for cattle and offered special prayers to vehicles to as part of the Sankranti Kanuma celebrations. Cattle used to play a significant role in farming before advanced technology and machinery came into use. So as a thanks, farmers worship cattle on Kanuma day, acknowledging their services. “Kanuma day is considered as a day of rest for cattle. We decorate the bulls, cow, sheep on this day and offer them fodder and prayers. Cattle are considered as family members in the Nuzividu region of the state,” said K Ramanna, a farmer from Mylavaram.

Meat markets in the city were crowded right from early hours of Thursday morning. The cost of country chicken, mutton, and fish sky-rocketed due to the festival demand. “Hosting feasts is an important part of celebrations on the last day of the Sankranti. But this year, we have minimised our lists considering the soaring price of meat. Cost of onions, cooking oil has also increased and it affected our celebrations,” said M Lavanya, a home-maker from the city.

Meanwhile, Sankranti celebrations conducted by the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) ended on a high note on Wednesday. Endowments minister Vellampalli Srinivas, who attended the programme as chief guest, appreciated the way the event was conducted by VMC officials. “Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy has asked officials across all 13 districts to conduct Sankranti celebration on a grand scale. Our government is giving top priority to culture and tradition. Sankranti is a harvest festival and our officials brought the village atmosphere to the city. It is our responsibility to continue our traditions and culture for future generations,” the minister said.

VMC commissioner Prasanna Venkatesh and his wife participated in the traditional Mr and Mrs Ramp Walk conducted at the event.

Krishna district collector A Md Imtiaz, MLA Malladi Vishnuvardhan presented the prizes to the winners of Rangoli, dance, singing and cooking competitions conducted as a part of the celebrations.

Title: EOW books gutka manufacturers for Rs 1900 cr GST fraud
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhopal: Madhya Pradesh EOW on Thursday booked four directors of Kaipan Pan Products Private Limited for allegedly evading GST (goods and services tax) worth Rs 1900 crore through fraudulent means. EOW had raided business establishments of prominent pan masala and gutka manufacturers in Bhopal, Indore and Gwalior following complaints of massive tax evasion. Several child labourers were rescued during the operation, said officials.

“The timing of the raid was very important. We found labourers working at 4.30 am. What kind of shift is it? There were no records of stock, materials and labourers working at the unit. We have enough evidence to prosecute them,” said an EOW officer, wishing anonymity.

When contacted, EOW DG Sushovan Banerjee confirmed the action and said strong steps would be taken against those involved. the directors have been booked under section 420 (forgery), 120 (criminal conspiracy) of IPC or and 122 of GST Act.

Raids were conducted at factories of some of the top brands in Govindpura at around 4.30am. Separate teams had raided other gutka companies in Indore and Gwalior. The raid team in the state capital was led by EOW SP Arun Mishra. Ready stocks worth more than Rs 5 crore were found at these units. EOW had shortlisted these companies immediately after chief minister Kamal Nath ordered a crackdown last week.

On January 3, in his first meeting of the year with bureaucrats, CM Nath had said: “Shudh Ke Liye Yudh is a massive drive that is gathering popularity through public support. But there needs to be action against gutka and paan masala sellers, apart from cartels involved in the manufacture and supply of fake medicines.”

“Unaccounted’ packs are sent off to different destinations. They have 40 labourers only to load packs of gutka pouches in trucks, so you can imagine the amount of gutha that is produced and supplied from this factory alone.”

Knowing that the clandestinely produced gutka is loaded in trucks early in the morning, the EOW team raided the unit at 4.30am. As they detected more illegal activities — like child labour and mixing of tobacco in gutka— personnel from departments like labour, revenue, commercial tax, excise, central excise and police also joined the operation.

Officials said that the government has been trying to plug leakage of revenue from gutka and tobacco companies. Excise duty is calculated under ‘Pan Masala Packing Machines (Capacity Determination and Collection of Duty) Rules, 2008’, modified in 2010, and ranges from Rs 14 lakh to Rs 77 lakh, depending upon the price per packet of pan masala (non-tobacco) and production capacity of machines. For flavoured supari, the tariff is charged on MRP and duty is calculated at 2.36% per packet, excluding 35% abatement.

It is alleged that the companies have been under-reporting the capacity of their machines in collusion with a section regulatory officials. Company officials tried to argue that some of the machines were not in use. “Each and every machine was in use when the unit was raided. Number of labourers made it clear that the production was being under reported,’ said the EOW officer, adding that mismatch has been found in the declaration and production capacity of machines.

Title: Kite festival posters in Tulu
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Poster using Tulu script for kite festival to be held at Panambur Beach from Friday (Right) Poster in Tulu whi... Read More

Mangaluru: A poster released as part of the three-day international kite festival is in Tulu . The festival will be held at the Panambur Beach from Friday.

The poster by artist Dinesh Holla , that is being shared on social media, has a line written in the Tulu script that reads, ‘ Kudla International Kite Festival ’.

Dinesh Holla told TOI that the poster has the picture of Koti- Chennaya, the legendary Tuluva twin heroes, and Aati Kalenja, an ancient traditional folk art.

“This is an attempt to draw the attention of the people towards vanishing art forms of Tulunadu,” he said. Holla has designed nearly 19 publicity posters for the festival, all highlighting the art and culture of the region. Since he is not an expert in the Tulu script, he has also designed a few posters that are in the Kannada script, but in the Tulu language. Most of the posters are based on the theme Yakshagana, Bhoota Kola, fishing, kambla and other such activities.

International kite flyers have begun arriving in Mangaluru.

The three-day international kite festival is being held as part of the Karavali Utsav.

Use of the Tulu script, and the demand seeking inclusion of Tulu in the 8th Schedule of the Constitution has picked up in recent years. Recently, Dilraj Alva, owner of Sri Ganesh Prasad (SGP) buses that operate between State Bank terminus and Mangaladevi, painted one of the SGP buses on route 27 with Tulu vowels and hashtags : #Tuluto8thschedule and #TuluofficiallnKA_K, in order to support the campaign.

Title: Man attacked for telling hoodlums not to pee in open
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Vadodara: It’s getting riskier to stop people peeing outside others’ houses in the Banyan City. A day after a labourer was stabbed in Angadh for stopping two people from relieving themselves outside his house, an auto rickshaw driver, Vijay Vankar, was attacked with a knife on Wednesday for exactly the same reason in Kishanwadi.

Vankar was attacked when he confronted the accused trio, Alpesh Thakor, Arjun Machhi and Anko asking them not to pee outside his house. Vankar told the police that Thakor, who allegedly runs a liquor den in the locality, and his clients used to relieve themselves near Vankar’s house on the ground floor of a government housing scheme.

Vankar’s wife Hema oftened complained about the stench emanating from the urine near their house. On Wednesday evening when Vankar was returning home from work, he saw the three accused sitting outside a barber’s shop near his house. He approached them about the problem of severe stench. But instead of listening to his plaint, Thakor used casteist slur against Vankar which enraged him and they got into a brawl.

In his complaint Vankar said that Thakor pulled out a knife and asked Anko to stab him. However, Vankar sat down when Anko was about to attack him, thus saving his life. Then Thakor and Machhi held Vankar while Anko hurled the knife on his forehead. Vankar got severe cuts and bled profusely from his forehead, but the hoodlums continued to kick and thrash him.

When his wife and a friend came to his rescue, the trio even beat up his wife. Vankar was taken to Jamnabai Hospital for treatment and was later referred to SSG Hospital. Vankar registered an offence of assault, causing hurt, criminal intimidation and under the Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe (Prevention of Atrocities) Act. However, cops are yet to arrest the trio.

Title: 10-year-old boy killed by speeding car
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 10-year-old boy was run over by a speeding car near Pashupatinath Temple in the Singarva area of the city on Wednesday evening, when he was trying to catch a kite near his home.

According to the FIR filed with I division traffic police, the deceased was identified Salahuddin Bareli, a resident of Bhagwatinagar near Singarva lake in Odhav.

His mother, Sayarabano Bareli, in the FIR stated that her son had gone out to chase and catch kites at around 4pm on Wednesday.

“When he was catching kites, a car driver had hit him and he suffered severe injuries to his face and other parts of the body. I was informed by local residents that my son had met with an accident,” Bareli stated in the FIR.

The boy was rushed to the Asarwa Civil hospital in an ambulance but died on the way. After doctors declared him brought dead, I division traffic police registered a complaint of negligent driving causing death against an unknown driver and began an investigation.

Police are looking for CCTV footage to identify the vehicle involved in the accident and to identify the accused, who fled after the accident.

Title: Orient Electric eyeing fan mfg in Telangana
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: Orient Electric Limited, a part of the $2.4 billion CK Birla group, has Telangana on its radar for setting up a South India focused fan manufacturing facility, a top official of the company said here on Thursday.

Orient, which makes fans in Kolkata and Faridabad, said it is seriously looking at setting up a plant down South as part of its focus on this all-season market. “We will set up a factory in the South and will take a firmer decision in the next 8-10 months,” Atul Jain, executive VP, Orient Electric Ltd, said, pointing out that the company is talking to governments of all the south Indian states.

Jain was in town to announce Orient’s latest offering — air circulating chandeliers.

Title: Cyient Q3 net up 17%
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: City-based IT major Cyient Ltd on Thursday said it has posted a 17% rise in consolidated net profit for the third quarter ended December 31, 2019, at Rs 108.3 crore as against Rs 92.3 crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous fiscal.

This was despite a 6.9% degrowth in consolidated revenue from operations at Rs 1,106 crore during Q3FY20 as compared to Rs 1,188 crore in Q3FY19.

The company said while its aerospace & defence, portfolio and transportation business units (BUs) witnessed a YoY decline of 15.4%, 8.7% and 9.5%, respectively, BUs like communications, energy and utilities, medical technology and healthcare and semiconductor, IoT and analytics clocked a YoY growth of 0.4%, 6.4%, 23.2% and 2.3% during the quarter. tnn

Title: TruJet flight makes emergency landing
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Vijayawada: A Vijayawada-bound TruJet flight from Kadapa made an emergency landing soon after it took off from Kadapa airport, on Thursday afternoon.

According to airport officials, the pilot was quick to report that bird had hit the flight within seconds of taking-off, informed the control tower and landed back at Kadapa airport.

A total 110 passengers—including the Andhra Pradesh government chief advisor Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy—were on the flight at the time of the incident. Soon after landing, maintenance crew conducted thorough checks and eventually grounded the flight. The same flight was also scheduled to go to Chennai from Vijayawada and hence, both services were cancelled.

With no alternate options provided to complete their journey, passengers were infuriated about the development as many had to delay their trips.

Title: Birds bear brunt of festivities
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: The forest department officials and volunteers of wildlife and environmental NGOs rescued 39 birds including pigeons, crows, eagles and black kites during Sankranti celebration. According to rescue volunteers, a few birds were found dead and several others were injured after getting caught in manja between January 13 and 16.

Soudharm Bhandari from Greater Hyderabad Society for Prevention of Cruelty to Animals said eight birds died in past three days due to injuries from glass-coated manja. Forest department asked citizens to contact on helpline number (18004255364 & 040-23231440). TNN

Title: Heavy rain, hail lash west UP
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Agra/Meerut/Bareilly: Heavy rain and hailstorm lashed western Uttar Pradesh on Thursday throwing normal life out of gear. Meanwhile, IMD officials have said that the prevailing conditions are likely to continue for two or three days, with the region likely to receive more rains.

While Agra received over 4mm rainfall on Thursday, chilly winds brought the temperature in the city down by around 12 degrees. Officials of the Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) operated gas heaters at over a dozen places apart from lighting bonfires in other spots. The air quality also improved on Thursday with the city recording an AQI of 174 (moderate). On Tuesday, the same was 314.

In Meerut, Thursday’s rainfall of 5mm broke a two-year record of maximum monthly rains received in the city. The maximum monthly rainfall received in January this year is 25.2mm as compared to 17.6mm in 2017. Heavy rains and hailstorm accompanied with fog led to an increase in AQI — from 204 to 232. The maximum and minimum temperatures recorded in the city were 15.4 degrees Celsius and 9 degrees Celsius respectively. While the maximum temperature was six degrees below normal, the minimum was two degrees above normal.

Raj Kumar, meteorological department in-charge of Meerut region, said, “Cloudy sky with one or two spells of rain or thundershowers is likely on Friday and Saturday followed by dense fog next week.”

In Bareilly, there was a nip in the air due to mild showers across the city. While 1.2mm rainfall was received on Thursday, IMD officials have predicted more in the coming days. The maximum and minimum temperatures were recorded at 19 degrees Celsius and 12.5 degrees Celsius respectively.

Ashish Singh, a local resident said, “For the past few days, there was some relief from the winter chill especially during afternoons. Mild rain on Thursday has further intensified the cold.”

Weather expert Neeru Agarwal said, “Mild to moderate rainfall occurred in the city due to western disturbances. Though it didn’t make much difference to the minimum and maximum temperatures, it has revived chilly winds. Cloudy weather conditions will prevail for the next couple of days and city is likely to receive light to moderate showers.”

Similarly, rainfall and hailstorm also lashed parts of Firozabad, Mathura, Etah, Aligarh and Mainpuri districts.

Farmers have claimed that rains and hail caused damage to wheat, potato and mustard crops. Mohan Singh Chahar, regional president of Bharatiya Kisan Sangh’s Agra unit, said, “There is major damage to potato, wheat and mustard crops in Agra region. We have requested the authorities to conduct an assessment of the crop loss in a time-bound manner and provide suitable compensation to farmers.”

District agriculture officer Rampravesh Verma said, “As many farmers have reported crop loss, we have asked them to claim insurance within 72 hours.”

Title: City boy G Krishna Praneeth tops all-India CA final exam
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

celebrating excellence: G Krishna Praneeth (second from left) with his mother and brother, and his mentor Rama... Read More

Vijayawada: City student G Krishna Praneeth achieved the first rank in the all-India CA final examinations held in November 2019. Praneeth, who was born in Bapatla in Guntur district, completed his education in Vijayawada.

Praneeth said that he was happy to clear the CA final examination in the first attempt, that too with top rank. “It is a dream come true for me. I never expected this result. My father Madhusudan Rao works in an automobile shop and my mother is a housewife. My hard work and the continuous guidance of my principal auditor Rama Mohana Rao helped me achieve this success,” Praneeth said.

“I secured 78% marks in CPT and 69% in IPCC, both in the first attempt. I did my articleship at M.N Rao associates and prepared for more than nine months to crack CA final exam ,” Praneeth added.

Praneeth’s guru, Rama Mohana Rao, a principal auditor, said that he was happy with the success of his student. “Praneeth is the first to achieve all-India first rank in CA final from coastal Andhra region after NJ Yeswswi from Tenalai in 1970. Praneeth always tried to learn from his mistakes. He is a real inspiration for the CA students. I can proudly say that social background is not a barrier for achieving success in CA,” Mohana Rao said, beaming with pride.

“Discipline, commitment and sincere hard work needed to crack CA final in first attempt. My student made proud with his success today,’ he added.

Another one of Mohana Rao’s students, V Anjaneya Vara Prasad from the city, achieved the all-India 46 rank in the CA final.

Title: Gujarat: Woman from Borsad found murdered in Brampton city
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Heeral Patel

VADODARA: A 28-year-old woman from Borsad taluka in Anand district was found dead on Thursday under suspicious conditions in Brampton city of Canada. The police is looking for the husband of the deceased who is also from a village in the same taluka.

The deceased Heeral Patel from Pamol village in Borsad taluka was married to Rakesh Patel from Kinkhlod village in the same taluka in 2013. She had settled in Canada with her in-laws. Her brother Vinay Patel and a cousin were also living in Canada.

Heeral was having strained relations with her husband and in-laws off late. The couple eventually decided filed for divorce and the formalities for ending the marriage started couple of months back, said Heeral’s uncle, whose name is also Rakesh Patel.

Heeral had gone missing on January 11 and the Toronto police started looking for her. According to the police, she was last seen on January 11 at 11pm local time. An elaborate search was launched to locate her.

The body of the missing woman was eventually found by Peel Regional Police from Brampton. It was located in a green space in the area of Nexus Avenue and Fogal Road. The Homicide and Missing Persons Bureau of the Peel Regional Police have started investigations in the case.

Heeral’s uncle said that it had come to light that the body had injury marks on it. He added that a relative of her husband based in the USA had once threatened that he could get her killed.

The police considers her husband as prime suspect in the case and have asked him to surrender. The body will be cremated in Canada itself, said relatives of the deceased.

The deceased’s brother Vinay was on a visit to their village, but had to rush back in wake of the incident.

Title: Gujarat FDCA to start checking milk in villages
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Gujarat Food and Drug Control Authority will embark on a state-wide drive to check the quality of milk at the ... Read More

GANDHINAGAR: The Gujarat Food and Drug Control Authority (FDCA) will embark on a state-wide drive to check the quality of milk at the village level before it is handed over to local co-operative societies. Action will be initiated against milk producers if samples of milk are found to be either unhygienic or adulterated, FDCA officials said.

In addition, FDCA will also launch a drive against unorganized dairies to check milk adulteration. “These dairies sell unpacked milk and they will be checked as well,” the official said.

The drive will be conducted in association with the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI).

H G Koshiya, commissioner, Gujarat FDCA said that while big milk processing plants like those of Amul have facilities to check milk according to FSSAI standards, there is no mechanism to check milk for adulteration or hygiene at the village level before milk producers deposit their milk with village co-operatives. “The state government has decided to start checking the quality of milk at source when farmers milk cows or buffaloes. Whether farmers draw milk in hygienic conditions or not or whether any adulteration is done will now be checked at the village level,” he said. The official added that a database of all milk producers will be sought from the major milk cooperatives.”

Title: CM inaugurates fifth edition of Kerala Literature Festival
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

CM Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurates Kerala Literature Festival in Kozhikode on Thursday

KOZHIKODE: It’s an era of intolerance and hatred. It started when the Sangh Parivar took dominance over the Indian politics, chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan said while opening the fifth edition of Kerala Literature Festival here on Thursday

There is a group that’s trying to lead the youth into the darkness, he said adding that “one thought that is being promoted widely now is that everything that was practised in the olden days was noble and they should be rejuvenated. By promoting such ideas, some people are trying to establish non-progressive attitude among the youths. The attempt is to attract the youths to ultra-nationalism and communalism by promoting such sentiments. If such attempts turn fruitful it would disintegrate our country.”

Meanwhile, the government has extended support to Kerala Literature Festival for setting up a permanent venue taking into account their contribution towards the society. “The young generation should be driven towards secularism, democracy and rational thinking. The Kerala Literature Festival is making the right intervention at the right time to drive the youth towards progressive thinking,” he said.

Dr Thani bin Ahmed Al Zeyoudi, minister of climate change and environment for the UAE, attended the inaugural session. Minister for tourism Kadakampally Surendran and others were also present for the inaugural session. In another session ‘National Anthem: The National Treasure,’ T M Krishna, musician and author, discussed the national anthem as a poetic masterpiece and national treasure.

KLF is being held at five different venues and the curtain will fall on Sunday.

Title: UP: Youth shot by lover’s family in Mau district
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

VARANASI: One Sodhan Nishad (24) was shot dead by his lover’s family members in Pakadi Bujurg village of Ghosi area in Mau district on Wednesday late night. He allegedly had gone to meet his lover when her family caught him.

The incident came to light on Thursday morning when the villagers noticed his body lying in a field behind the girl’s house. On getting information, SP Mau Anurag Arya reached there along with dog squad and forensic experts.

During initial investigation the police collected empty shells and other evidences of Nishad’s murder on the terrace of the girl’s home. The girl and her family is absconding. On the complaint of Nishad’s father Ghosi police have lodged a named FIR against the girl, her father Darbari and all other family members. Arya said that police teams were conducting raids at possible hideouts for early arrest of the accused.

According to reports, Nishad of Pakadi Bujurg village, worked as a carpenter in Mumbai. Two months ago he had returned for some construction work at his home. Sources claimed that he had an affair with Darbari’s daughter. On Wednesday night he had gone to Darbari’s home to meet the girl when her family caught him and killed him.

Title: Landowners anxious about valuation after NH project
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

National Highway-169, which connects Mangaluru, Moodbidri and Karakala, which will be widened

Mangaluru: The action committee of residents who are likely to lose their land due to widening of NH-169 (earlier NH-13), are apprehensive about the compensation they are supposed to receive.

Union ministry of road transport and highways has issued a public notice to residents of Mangaluru, Karkala and Moodbidri taluks, whose land will be acquired for widening of the national highway between Mangaluru and Moodbidri. Residents of Sanooru in Karkala, Beluvai, Padu Marnadu, Thodaru, Thenka Mijaru in Moodbidri and Badaga Edapadau, Badaga Ulipady, Moodu Perar, Kandavara, Mulooru, Thiruvailu and Kudupu in Mangaluru taluk, have been directed to appear with all documents pertaining to their land, before the special land acquisition officer. While residents of Karkala and Moodbidri have been asked to produce documents on January 22, land owners of Mangaluru taluk have been directed to visit on January 23.

However, Residents of 17 villages in Mangaluru and Moodbidri taluks led by Rashtriya Heddari 169 (13) Mangaluru-Moodbidri Rasthe Agalikarana Bumalakara Horatta Samiti have been questioning the compensation pattern. Samiti president and advocate Mariamma Thomas told TOI that a final notification for the land acquisition was made in 2017.

Hence, the compensation will be awarded as per the 2017 notification. However, the land value has been increased in the past three years, but the same has not been considered while calculating the compensation to be paid to land owners, Mariamma said.

“We will point out the technical errors in the compensation to be distributed to landowners at the meeting to be convened by the district administration and National Highways Authority of India on Monday. Those who are losing their land will be receiving compensation as per the rate fixed in 2017, and increase in the market value due to inflation has not been considered. Residents will be eligible to receive only the interest for the compensation,” she said, adding that the samiti will take a decision on the future course of action soon.

Title: Pune-based NGO in Nashik city to assess quality of air
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Nashik: Parisar, a Pune-based non-government organisation, is conducting a survey of five non-attainment smart cities of Maharashtra, including Nashik, and the findings are to be released once the study is over.

Apart from Nashik, other cities include Aurangabad, Nagpur, Pune and Solapur.

The NGO officials were here in Nashik on Thursday. They met the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) and smart city officials, and took information on the measures being taken to improve the air quality in the city.

The NGO said it has already conducted the study of other cities. “We are studying the air quality of five non-attainment cities of Maharashtra, which are also smart cities, to see what the smart city officials and municipal corporations are doing to improve air quality,” said Sharmila Deo, a senior official of the NGO.

“We have conducted the study of the other four cities. We will prepare a collective report of all the five cities in Maharashtra and release it thereafter. It will take a month to complete the process,” she said.

NMC officials said the Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) is an authority to check the air quality of the city and there are four air quality monitoring stations. The officials also talked about the action plan the civic body had prepared to tackle air pollution and measures being taken for the implementation of the action plan.

The officials said that Nashik had been included among 100 air polluted cities around two years ago. “We can’t comment on this as this is the jurisdiction of the pollution authority,” they said.

“But the quality of air in Nashik city is good. The city is also known for its good climate. Therefore, we are also studying the matter — through a private educational institute — to find out why the city was included among the list of 100 air-polluted cities in the country,” said NMC officials.

The NGO officials also met the smart city officials and held a discussion on the air quality.

Title: Kashmera Shah on rape attempt made on Arti Singh: Would have chased down the man and cut his d***
Content: Saumya Tandon of Bhabhi Ji Ghar Par Hain fame has finally rested all the speculations around her participation in the upcoming season of Bigg Boss. The actress shared a fun video where she can be seen reacting to the rumours and clearly denying all of them.

Title: AMU VC tries in vain to break deadlock
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Agra: In an attempt to break the deadlock, Aligarh Muslim University ( AMU ) vice-chancellor Tariq Mansoor on Thursday visited students at Bab-e-Syed gate where they have been protesting against CAA and NRC for 32 days.

However, the students, who have been demanding the resignation of the VC and the registrar holding them responsible for the alleged excesses by security forces on December 15, refused to relent.

Reiterating that he regrets the hardships and inconvenience faced by students due to the police action, Mansoor said, “The police entry was an aberration. They have no role in the working of the university. Law and order on campus will henceforth be maintained by the university authorities.” He once again clarified that he had given permission to police only to restore normalcy and not to enter the residential premises.

The VC also urged the students to cooperate with the visiting National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) team and the fact-finding committee headed by Justice V K Gupta.

Students’ leader Faizul Hassan, who is also a member of AMU coordination committee, said that the students are not satisfied by the explanation given by the VC.

Title: MGKV women security guards ‘thrashed’, VC orders filing of FIR
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Managers of affiliated colleges of MGKV trying to enter administrative building on Thursday

Varanasi: Agroup of managers of affiliated colleges of Mahatma Gandhi Kashi Vidyapeeth (MGKV) have been charged with misbehaving and beating women security guards of MGKV Proctorial Board after being stopped from entering the administrative building on Thursday. The managers were reportedly demanding withdrawal of fee hike.

Taking serious note of the incident, MGKV vice-chancellor Prof TN Singh has ordered lodging named FIR against the accused after identifying them through CCTV footage. He said the managers also staged demonstration without seeking any prior permission.

Reports said managers of about 10 affiliated colleges, along with their supporters reached the administrative building on Thursday afternoon. The VC said after they sought appointment, he allowed only five persons to meet him at 11am. But they reached the campus along with their supporters. When the women Proctorial Board personnel tried to stop them, they attacked and misbehaved with them. They also staged a demonstration demanding immediate withdrawal of fee hike, he added.

Talking to TOI, the VC said: “I had agreed to meet their five-member delegation. They were informed that fee hike had been made in view of the circular of the state government for universities to arrange funds from their own resources to meet expenses of increased wages of invigilators, examiners, installation of CCTV cameras in examination rooms, improving quality of printing of question papers and others.”

The decision of fee hike had been taken by the finance committee and cannot be changed by any individual, he added.

There are over 300 colleges affiliated with MGKV, but the managers of less than a dozen colleges are demanding withdrawal of fee hike, he said and added that the footage of misbehaviour and manhandling women security guards are being reviewed to identify the assailants and lodge a named FIR against them, he added.

Title: 70 aspirants from T, AP clear UPSC Mains
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: Close to 70 aspirants from Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are expected to have cleared the civil services main examination, results of which were declared by the Union Public Service Commission on January 14. “Due to the introduction of 10 per cent reservation for the economically weaker Sections (EWS), the cut-off mark for the general category seems to have been higher than the previous years,” said Gopalakrishna, director, Brain Tree.

Title: Booze parties end in tragedies, three killed in separate incidents
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: Three people, including an auto driver and two private financiers, were murdered in separate incidents in the city since Tuesday night. All the victims and the accused were in an inebriated condition at the time of the offence, police said.

In the first incident, Md Sarvar, 21, an auto driver, and three others, including main suspect Pavan, were consuming liquor near Banjara Lake in Banjara Hills on Tuesday night.

“An argument broke out between Sarvar and others. Sarvar tried to attack Pavan and others with a knife. Pavan snatched the weapon from Sarvar and stabbed him,” Banjara Hills inspector (detective) (DI) K Ravi Kumar said. Pavan and others fled the scene. Police launched a manhunt to nab the accused.

In another incident, a 32-year-old private financier, Yada Goud, was stabbed to death by his neighbour Asif, a DCM van driver, at an open ground in Gagillapur, Dundigal on Wednesday night. “In the past, Asif caused nuisance at the grocery store of Goud’s wife in drunken condition. Asif bore a grudge against Goud and decided to kill him. Asif invited Goud for a party on Wednesday night near their house,” inspector A Venkatesham said.

Around 8.30 pm, when Goud and Asif were consuming liquor in a ground near their houses, an argument broke out between them. “Asif stabbed Goud multiple times and killed him on the spot,” the inspector said. Police took Asif into custody on Thursday.

The third murder took place at KPHB Colony on Thursday. The victim, Jopseph Suman, 33, was a pawn broker from Kukatpally.

On Tuesday evening Suman left home to fly kites with a friend, Prashant. Later, Suman called his wife and said that he was with Prashant. As he did not return home, his wife called him on Wednesday night.

“Suman told his wife that he would return home after having dinner with Prashant. At 3.30am on Thursday, Suman’s brother Antony informed his wife that he was admitted to a hospital .

“Suman and Prashanth were heavily drunk and had an argument. Prashanth picked up a knife from the kitchen and stabbed Suman. Suman succumbed to injuries at Osmania Hospital,” KPHB Inspector S Laxmi Narayana said. Police took Prashanth into custody.

Title: JNUSU plans to go to court, continue stir
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh

NEW DELHI: JNU Students' Union has decided to continue the boycott of the registration process and to challenge in court the October 28 Inter-Hall Administration meeting that revised the hostel fees. It also said it would intensify efforts to oust the vice-chancellor.

In a council meeting on Thursday, the four central leaders and school councillors decided to expedite a legal challenge to the IHA manual. “We request the student community, therefore, especially those who haven’t registered, to continue to boycott the registration process,” a statement said.

About classes affected by the agitation, JNUSU said it would coordinate with JNU Teachers’ Association on parallel classes to clear the backlog. The union, however, did not give details of how this would be achieved. It also promised to undertake on priority all “manner and means of struggle” to see that students facing proctorial enquiry and facing suspension or eviction were not victimised and their registration was completed.

Title: Min pulls up rly staff over defunct detector
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: Union minister of state for home G Kishan Reddy on Thursday pulled up railway officials and Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel after he found the door frame metal detector at Secunderabad railway station to be defunct.

Kishan Reddy was at the Secunderabad station to catch a train to a municipality as part of BJP municipal elections campaign.

Kishan Reddy was on his way to Bellampalli, Narsapur, Godavarikhani and Ramagundam municipalities.

SCR principal chief security commissioner GM Eswara Rao told TOI, “The door frame metal detector is supposed to beep when a passenger walks in with a metal item. It was not working when minister Kishan Reddy came to the station due to a technical issue. We have replaced it. We have also asked for more door frame metal detectors.”

Secunderabad railway station handles around 1.25 lakh passengers during festive season.

“We will be deploying additional forces from Railway Protection Special Force (RPSF). Currently, the RPF is short-staffed. We have sought 780 new personnel for RPF and they are undergoing training. There will soon be greater security at the railway stations and platforms. To temporarily sort out the problem, we are roping in special forces,” said Eswara Rao.

A member of an anti-terror cop squad said, “Secunderabad was on Lashkar-e-Toiba’s hit list. During Sankranti, there is huge rush of passengers. RPF and Government Railway Police (GRP) personnel shall ensure the safety and security of passengers.”

Title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal dismisses talk about some candidates having criminal records
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Arvind Kejriwal

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that the sitting MLAs who had been denied tickets for the upcoming assembly polls were a part of the AAP family and would continue to be so.

Kejriwal dismissed the opposition’s allegations that some of the party candidates had a tainted background and stressed that AAP was committed to its 3Cs formula, according to which people with a criminal background, or those who were corrupt or of bad character would not be included in the party.

“We came into politics to make it clean. It was because of our clean politics that we were able to deliver so much (in the last five years). We will keep our commitment to 3Cs always,” Kejriwal said at a press conference.

On allegations from certain quarters that the party had “sold” tickets, Kejriwal said myriad charges were levelled by people when they were denied tickets. Badarpur and Seelmapur MLAs Narayan Dutt Sharma and Ishraq Khan have openly made their displeasure known after being snubbed.

While 46 of the 61 sitting MLAs have been given another chance, the remaining have been dropped after a series of qualitative and quantitative surveys conducted by the party and private agencies to assess their performance and winnability. Most of the dropped MLAs have maintained a stoic silence, but some have made no effort to hide their disappointment.

Asked if the party was talking to the dropped MLAs, Kejriwal said all parties would make efforts to poach them. “They are a part of our family and I hope they will remain so,” he replied to a query.

The AAP leadership has been trying to reach out to the “disappointed” MLAs and convince them that the party is with them. Three dropped MLAs, Ram Chander from Bawana, Sukhbir Singh Dalal from Mundka and Surinder Singh from Delhi Cantonment, made an appearance at the party office and joined the inauguration of Rajendra Nagar candidate Raghav Chadha’s office, a day after being denied tickets. It was projected as a sign of everything being fine in the party. AAP has stressed that the dropped MLAs will be given positions in the party and, after the election, in the government.

While some of the MLAs are said to be exploring all options, Seelampur MLA Ishraq Khan is reportedly likely to join Congress. A person close to the MLA stated that he was in touch with Congress functionaries and may contest the election on its ticket from Babarpur.

In the middle of a press conference organised by Khan on Wednesday, former Congress MLA from Seelampur, Mateen Ahmad, had dropped in and appreciated the work done by him.

Title: One in two Gujarat adults is obese or underweight
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Half of Gujarat ’s adult population is either overweight or underweight. What is distressing though is that the number of persons who are overweight has been rising consistently.Experts and nutritionists do not see this worrisome trend being arrested any time soon, saying the falling consumption of home-made food is one of the major contributors to obesity.A comparison of the NFHS-4 survey, commissioned in 2015-16, and the SFHS survey done in 2019, shows that there has been a 0.8 percentage point increase in the number of women who are overweight or obese.Similarly, the percentage of overweight or obese men has increased by 2.9 percentage points.Nutritionists and experts believe the increase in obesity among both men and women is growing at a much higher rate than what these surveys indicate.Health experts and nutritionists say that the problem of obesity is now increasing among teenagers as well. “I have a lot of teenagers coming in for weight loss. The trend of eating out and not cooking at home is dangerous. Almost all restaurants are full on weekends. This has directly affected the consumption of home-cooked food,” says Binaifer Lalkaka, a lifestyle management health coach.Nutritionist Arya Singh says that with increasingly both husband and wife working, it becomes difficult for the family to have home-cooked food, which reflects in the huge spurt in people ordering food online.“People realise the need to lose weight, but the majority perhaps do not know the right methods,” she said.

Title: ABVP posters slamming Left crop up on Delhi University’s North Campus
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

DUSU president Akshit Dahiya said, “On the DU campus, different student organisations have been coming togethe... Read More

NEW DELHI: Several hoardings with slogans like “Desh jalana bandh karo” (stop burning the country) and “Left attacks students/JNU” with the photos of ABVP activists injured in the JNU violence appeared near Law Faculty and Ramjas College on Delhi University’s North Campus on Thursday.

Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad-led Delhi University Students’ Union claimed it had put up the hoardings to expose the Left organisations. The hoardings also had photos of the protests against Citizenship Amendment Act and National Register of Citizens.

DUSU president Akshit Dahiya said, “On the DU campus, different student organisations have been coming together and spreading negativity on the campus.”

Objecting to the hoardings, National Students’ Union of India (NSUI)-Delhi president Akshay Lakra said, “It’s sad to see wastage of the students’ union budget by ABVP to spread the rightist propaganda. Despite having been exposed many times, ABVP still hasn’t accepted its defeat in its own propaganda.” .

Title: Gujarat University gives colleges a week to prepare electoral list
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Gujarat University

AHMEDABAD: Gujarat University (GU) has directed colleges under its jurisdiction to prepare electoral lists for the student senate elections within one week.

The GU is yet to announce the election.

A circular from the university states that the electoral roll should contain the address of the student. The list forwarded by the college principal will be final and will not be verified by the university.

The circular states that the committee formed under the Gujarat University Act will inquire into all disputes. The university made it clear that if a college send more names than it is scheduled to, the university will remove excess names from the bottom.

The university appealed to the students to cooperate with staff. In the past, several staffers have been attacked during elections and the university appealed to the students to cooperate with them.

Title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal dismisses talk about some candidates having criminal records
Content:
Arvind Kejriwal

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that the sitting MLAs who had been denied tickets for the upcoming assembly polls were a part of the AAP family and would continue to be so.Kejriwal dismissed the opposition’s allegations that some of the party candidates had a tainted background and stressed that AAP was committed to its 3Cs formula, according to which people with a criminal background, or those who were corrupt or of bad character would not be included in the party.“We came into politics to make it clean. It was because of our clean politics that we were able to deliver so much (in the last five years). We will keep our commitment to 3Cs always,” Kejriwal said at a press conference.On allegations from certain quarters that the party had “sold” tickets, Kejriwal said myriad charges were levelled by people when they were denied tickets. Badarpur and Seelmapur MLAs Narayan Dutt Sharma and Ishraq Khan have openly made their displeasure known after being snubbed.While 46 of the 61 sitting MLAs have been given another chance, the remaining have been dropped after a series of qualitative and quantitative surveys conducted by the party and private agencies to assess their performance and winnability. Most of the dropped MLAs have maintained a stoic silence, but some have made no effort to hide their disappointment.Asked if the party was talking to the dropped MLAs, Kejriwal said all parties would make efforts to poach them. “They are a part of our family and I hope they will remain so,” he replied to a query.The AAP leadership has been trying to reach out to the “disappointed” MLAs and convince them that the party is with them. Three dropped MLAs, Ram Chander from Bawana, Sukhbir Singh Dalal from Mundka and Surinder Singh from Delhi Cantonment, made an appearance at the party office and joined the inauguration of Rajendra Nagar candidate Raghav Chadha’s office, a day after being denied tickets. It was projected as a sign of everything being fine in the party. AAP has stressed that the dropped MLAs will be given positions in the party and, after the election, in the government.While some of the MLAs are said to be exploring all options, Seelampur MLA Ishraq Khan is reportedly likely to join Congress. A person close to the MLA stated that he was in touch with Congress functionaries and may contest the election on its ticket from Babarpur.In the middle of a press conference organised by Khan on Wednesday, former Congress MLA from Seelampur, Mateen Ahmad, had dropped in and appreciated the work done by him.

Title: Kerala: Man kills hitman he hired to kill his mother, arrested
Content:
Representational image

KOZHIKODE: The CB-CID, on Thursday, arrested a 53-year-old man in connection with the murder of a hitman who he had hired to murder his mother fours years ago.Birju, a native of West Manassery near Mukkom, was arrested two years after dismembered body parts of Ismayil Puthiyothu from Malappuram was recovered from the district.According to police, Birju murdered his mother Jayavalli,70, in March, 2016, with the help of Ismayil, a goon, to get hold of her property. Later, they hanged her in bedroom and presented it as suicide. Birju had offered Ismayil Rs 10 lakh for the crime. However, after the incident, Birju failed to keep his word following which Ismayil started threatening him. Later, Birju turned against Ismayil and strangled him to death at his residence in June, 2017.“He then dismembered the body parts using surgical blades and abandoned them in three different sacks. While the arms, legs and the head were dumped in a river, the torso was dumped along with slaughterhouse waste in Karassery,” Tomin J Thachankary, ADGP crime said.Police, with the help of DNA examination, had earlier confirmed that the dismembered body parts recovered from various parts of Kozhikode belonged to the same person. Later, experts cross matched the finger prints in police records with the finger prints of the deceased to confirm his identity. Ismayil was an accused in many thefts and burglary cases in Malappuram.Police turned their focus on Birju when a few of Ismayil’s friends, during probe, revealed that Ismayil had not received the quotation amount offered by a man from Mukkom. Following this, police collected details of all unnatural deaths reported in Mukkom and nearby areas.Residents raised suspicion over Jayavalli’s suicide during probe. The suspicion increased further when Birju and his family relocated to Neelagiri. Soon, police arrested Birju, who confessed to the crime.

Title: Father of soldier killed in J&K refuses to cremate body, demands CM’s visit
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Chandrabhan Chaurasia (file pic)

Gorakhpur: The mortal remains of soldier Chandrabhan Chaurasia (28), who was killed in an avalanche near the Line of Control in Kupwara district of Jammu and Kashmir on Monday, reached his native village Dumahi in Kushinagar district on Friday at around 5pm. Army and administration officers including DM Anil Kumar Singh and SP Vinod Kumar Mishra were also present there.

Chandrabhan’s father Rajvallabh has refused to cremate the body and has demanded chief minister Yogi Adityanath to visit the family. UP cabinet minister and Kushinagar district nodal in-charge Mukt Bihari Verma and the officials are trying to convince the family for last rites of the body.

Chandrabhan is survived by wife Pinki and two children Aryan (3) and Ayush (1).

Chaurasiae joined army in 2015 and was a part of a patrol from a forward post along the line of control. The patrol was hit by an avalanche on January 13 killing him and two other soldiers Naik Rameshwar Lal and Gunner Ranjit Singh. The Indian Army paid tributes to the three solfiers in a solemn ceremony at Badami Bagh Cantonment of Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir.

As the body reached the village, a huge number of people, including political leaders, reached there to pay tributes to the soldier. Kushinagar MP Vijay Dubey and MLA Ganga Singh Kushwaha were also present there.

Chandrabhan’s teacher, Ram Chandra Rai said, “He was a wonderful man and the entire village is sad on his death. The government should also extend helping hand to the grieving family.

Title: Govt plans drinking water projects in six districts with Rs 12,308 crore
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Amaravati: In a major initiative, the state government has cleared decks for taking up comprehensive drinking water projects in six districts with Rs.12,308 crore.

The projects have been planned to cater to the needs of water starving regions like Palnadu in Guntur and Uddanam in Srikakulam district.

The Palnadu water grid project will be taken up with Rs.2665 crore while Rs.700 crore would be spent on Uddanam area drinking water project.

“It is the fulfillment of yet another promise made before the general elections. Our leader Jagan has promised to take up the water project during his padayatra and cleared the permissions within seven months after coming into power,” said Gurazala legislator Kasu Mahesh Reddy.

He said that he had submitted the project report to Jagan during his padayatra in the constituency and got the promise. He said that the scheme would serve nearly 15 lakh people of seven assembly constituencies in Palnadu region.

Similarly, comprehensive drinking water projects in East Godavari would be taken up with Rs.3960 crore and West Godavari projects to get Rs.3670 crore.

The perennially drought hit Kanigiri region in Prakasam district would get Rs.833 crore and chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy’s hometown Pulivendula to get scheme with Rs.480 crore.

While water demand for rural areas has been calculated at 100 litres per day, it has been put at 135 litres per day for urban areas. Similarly, the state government has directed the AP Drinking Water Supply Corporation (APDWSC) managing director to pool up funds from loans from financial institutions including banks and Nabard to take up the projects.

The government directed the APWSC to launch the works immediately. Sources said that Kanigiri area project would be taken up with Asian Development Bank (ADB) funds.

The state government had in fact granted its in principle permission to take up comprehensive drinking water projects in all the 13 districts in October.

After the Detailed Project Reports (DPRs) on projects to be taken up in six districts, the state government granted its final nod. “We have been thirsting for water for decades. The proposals have been hanging in the balance for several years. Palnadu people will never forget chief minister YS Jagan for his gesture,” said Mahesh Reddy.

The projects have been planned to cater to the needs of water starving regions like Palnadu in Guntur and Uddanam in Srikakulam district.

Title: Dabhoi man murdered for asking his friend’s salary
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Accused on police custody

Vadodara: A resident of Dabhoi was murdered by five persons for asking for his friend’s salary from his employer on January 13. The five accused were arrested on Thursday after the deceased Hitesh Prajapati’s father lodged a complaint on Wednesday.

Prajapati (32) was attacked by the accused Balvant Vankar, Girish Parmar, Bhavin Parmar, Kanu Parmar and Shana Parmar on January 13 as they were enraged by his demands for his friend. Police said that Prajapati’s friend Dharmendra who works under the accused had not been paid salary for over a month. As Prajapati was asking them to pay the salary for quite some time, they got enraged and decided to teach him a lesson.

“The accused said that the deceased had nothing to do with the issue, yet he was trying to interfere which they did not like,” said a police official. On January 13, the accused beat up Prajapati on the outskirts of his native Kunvarpura village in Dabhoi taluka. After the attack, Prajapati went home and slept. But in the evening when his father tried to wake him up, he did not respond. Prajapati’s neighbour called GVK-EMRI 108 ambulance. The paramedical staff declared him dead. His father told cops that Prajapati had succumbed to internal injuries.

On Thursday, along with arresting the five accused, cops also seized the car in which they had arrived to attack Prajapati.

Prajapati was working in a small company at Por GIDC.

Title: MPCB to survey industrial effluents
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Nashik: The Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) headquarters has directed its Nashik regional office to undertake a survey of the Satpur and Ambad industrial estates to ascertain the quantum of industrial effluents generated in both the areas and how much is being discharged into different nullahs linked to the Godavari river without undergoing treatment.

The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) had told the MPCB that it would not construct underground sewer lines in these two industrial areas of the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC).

Top authorities of the NMC and MPCB recently conducted a meeting on the issue at Mumbai where the municipal corporation reiterated its stand that it would not be feasible for it to undertake construction of underground sewer lines.

The NMC also made it clear that it would not return the Sewerage Benefit Tax which is part of property tax being collected by MIDC from industrial units in both the estates. The MPCB had recently directed the NMC to return the tax amount it collected in the past if it is adamant on not constructing underground drainage lines in both the industrial areas.

“Instructions have been given by our head office to conduct survey of total effluent generated in both the industrial areas. The report is to be submitted to our head office after the completion of the survey. It will take at least a month to conduct the survey,” said sources from the regional office of MPCB.

“MIDC is supplying water to industrial units in both the said areas. The survey will include how much water is being supplied in each of the industrial units and how much effluents are being generated from the total water supply. Moreover, the survey will also list down the industries that have their own Effluent Treatment Plant (ETP) and how many do not have the effluent treatment system,” said MPCB sources.

Title: Three more lose lives in kite-related accidents
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bharat Vadodiya

Vadodara: The toll due to kite flying related incidents rose to five in central Gujarat with three more deaths reported from Vadodara district and Chhota Udepur.

The latest incident was reported from Manjalpur area on Thursday morning when a security guard was trying to pull an entangled kite from an electric distribution panel (DP). The deceased Arjun Melani (40) was trying to pull out the kite using an iron rod. Eye-witnesses told police people cautioned Melani not to try the misadventure, but he did not pay any heed. When the iron rod touched a live electric cable, Melani got a shock and he collapsed. The DP also tripped and there was a power outage in the area.

Locals took Melani to a nearby private hospital, but the doctors declared him dead on arrival. Melani was working as a security guard in a residential complex near the DP.

On Wednesday late evening, Bharat Vadodiya (27) died after his throat was slit by the deadly ‘manja’ in Savli taluka. Vadodiya was returning home on his bike from his farm when the incident took place. Vadodiya was being taken to a hospital in Vadodara city, but he succumbed on the way.

The other incident was reported from Chhota Udepur where a man died after falling off a speaker. The deceased Kiran Bariya was dancing to the DJ’s tune in the Rajputfaliya of Chhota Udepur town on Uttarayan. Bariya lost balance and fell on the terrace suffering head injuries. He was taken to a private hospital in Bodeli where he succumbed during treatment.

Title: Two succumb to burns in steel factory blast
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: Two migrant workers, who had suffered severe burns in a blast at a steel factory in Jeedimetla industrial area on Sunday night, succumbed to injuries while undergoing treatment on Wednesday.

“The mishap occurred at the furnace of Jayaraj Steel Company in Subhash Nagar, Jeedimetla. Hot metal leaked from the furnace and fell into the water surrounding it, triggering an explosion of steam,” ACP, Balanagar, K Purushotham said.

At that time, six workers were trying to fix the electrical problem of the crane at the factory. “As the workers were standing 20 feet above the furnace on the second floor, they directly came in contact with the steam and sustained burns,” the ACP said.

Mukhesh, 34, and Madhavendra, 35, both migrant workers from Bihar, succumbed on Wednesday. The others were out of danger, sub-inspector (SI) E Satyam said. Police booked a case against the management of the factory under Section 304-a, 337 and 336 of the IPC.

Title: Phones will not be allowed during TET, say officials
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: The education department of the Nashik zilla parishad has decided to prohibit the examinees and invigilators from carrying mobile phones inside the examination hall during the Maharashtra Teachers Eligibility Test (TET) on January 19.

“The candidates are supposed to take their seats 20 minutes before the commencement of the exam, else he or she will not be allowed into the hall,” ZP officials said on Thursday.

The ZP convened a meeting, headed by ZP education officer (primary) Vaishali Veer, on Tuesday to discuss the preparations for the test.

“To ensure transparency, everyone will have to be careful during the test. Carrying a mobile phone is strictly prohibited for candidates as well as invigilators. The candidates are not supposed to carry even water bottles,” the ZP officials said.

The test, conducted by the Maharashtra State Council of Examination, is mandatory for aspirants to teach from std I to VIII in government schools in the state.

The exam consists of two papers. The first paper qualifies a candidate to teach Class I to Class V (primary) whereas the second paper is for those who wish to teach Class VI to Class VIII (secondary). The eligibility to appear for paper I is DEd (Diploma in Education) while the eligibility to appear for paper II is BEd (Bachelors in Education).

A candidate possessing both BEd and DEd is eligible to appear for both the papers.

In Nashik district, a total of 12,679 candidates will appear for paper I from 34 centres, whereas 10,129 candidates will appear for paper II from 27 centres. The first paper will be from 10:30 am to 1 pm while the second paper from 2 pm to 4:30 pm.

At the meeting, the staff was apprised of how to maintain confidentiality of the examination material before and after the examination. The candidates will be given an OMR sheet to answer the multiple choice questions. Also, there will be four sets (A, B, C, D) of the question papers.

A candidate requires minimum 60% marks to be eligible for the test.

Title: Vice president Venkaiah Naidu dragged into Thiruvalluvar controversy
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Vice president Venkiah Naidu

CHENNAI: Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu on Thursday found himself in the midst of a controversy over attempts to ‘saffronise’ Tamil saint-poet Thiruvalluvar . But, even as his tweet created a stir, it was hurriedly deleted.

“Remembering great Tamil Poet, philosopher and Saint, Thiruvalluvar on his Jayanti today. #Thirukkural, authored by him provides guidance to mankind on how to lead a noble life,” Naidu said in his tweet. “Considered as one of the greatest classics in #Tamil #Literature on morality, values and ethics, the treatise on a variety of subjects, including governance remains relevant for all times. #Thiruvalluvar,” he further said in the tweet.

This tweet, from the official handle @VPSecretariat of the Vice President of India looked innocuous at first glance, especially as it came on January 16, which is observed in Tamil Nadu as Thiruvalluvar Day. But, it soon caused a stir as Thiruvalluvar was in a saffron robe as against the usual white, and brought back memories of a recent tweet of the Tamil Nadu unit of the BJP, showing Thiruvalluvar in a saffron robe, created quite a furore.

As if wanting to avoid any political fallout, the VP’s office quickly deleted the tweet. “The earlier tweet was posted by mistake by a staff of Vice President Secretariat and was deleted soon after it was noticed,” it said, in a fresh tweet. This time, Thiruvalluvar too was back in his usual white robe.

DMK MP from Dharmapuri S Senthil Kumar thanked Naidu for heeding the request and deleting the earlier tweet. “Thank you Vice-president Respected Venkiah Sir, Much respect and regards for deleting the Saffronised Thiruvalluvar picture and replacing with the Government official picture as requested,” the MP tweeted.

But, BJP’s Tamil Nadu unit was back with a tweet on Thiruvalluvar Day wishes. It carried a picture of Thiruvalluvar in a saffron robe. In a tweet, it even sought to link BJP’s election symbol ‘Lotus’ with Thirukkural. “One who bathes in a lotus pond will not seek another pond. Likewise, one who reads Thirukkural will not seek another book,” it said in a tweet, along with a picture of a saffronised Thiruvalluvar.

Later, it also sought to condemn a reported directive of the Malaysian government that asked Muslims not to partake in Pongal celebrations, by terming it a Hindu festival. Saying it was an attempt by Malaysia to separate Muslims from Tamils, the BJP tweet condemned the move.

However, there was a backlash soon after, with people questioning the party for poking its nose in the affairs of another country while seeking to create a division between the Hindu majority and the Muslim minorities at home. Some of them had even posted pictures of Muslim families in Malaysia celebrating Pongal.

The state BJP unit also sought to give a Hindu twist to 'jallikattu', a bull sport popular during the Pongal festival, by calling it a Hindu tradition.

Title: AMU faculty, retired teachers protest against CAA on campus
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Aligarh Muslim University

AGRA: A number of AMU faculty members and retired teachers took out a peaceful protest march against CAA and NRC on the campus on Thursday.

Shouting slogans, the protesters took out a rally from the staff club to Duck Point. They said, “We express our anguish, shock and strong condemnation on the passage of the discriminatory and anti-secular Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) that has linked citizenship to religion. It has been opined by the Supreme Court in a number of cases that secularism enshrined in the Preamble is the basic feature of the Constitution.”

“We appreciate the initiative taken by the students of Jamia Millia Islamia, Aligarh Muslim University , JNU and other universities against this unlawful Act. Their sacrifices will make history. The lack of far-sightedness of the AMU administration is clear,” they added.

They also strongly condemned the lathicharge, firing and brutality shown by the police against students in both AMU and JMI that left several injured.

The protesters said that the AMU administration has entirely failed to use the age-old system of pro-proctors, proctorial team, teachers and alumni to meet exigencies on the campus. “We consider the acts of AMU administration unnecessary and uncalled for. Students have full right to peacefully demonstrate against any injustice without hampering their studies and examinations. Therefore, we appeal to the students to attend classes, appear for examinations and remain non-violent in protests,” they added.

Title: Wage war against open sale of acid, says CM Nath
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhopal: A week after declaring Deepika Padukone-starrer ‘Chhapaak’ tax-free in the state,chief minister Kamal Nath on Thursday asked officials to wage a war against open sale of acid in MP. Nath said that cases of acid attacks can be curbed through exemplary punishment and public awareness.

“It is very important to curb the open sale of acid in the state. Instructions have been issued to run a campaign across the state,” tweeted Nath.

The chief minister had on January 9 declared Bollywood movie `Chhapaak', based on the story of an acid survivor, as tax-free in the state. The movie actress Deepika Padukone has already expressed her concern over the issue, saying it is very disturbing to find the ease with which shopkeepers are selling acid after asking casual questions like ‘why do you need it?’ Nath. in his tweet, said it is not just enough to declare the movie tax-free, but there is a need to create awareness about it.

Nath said, “There is a need to create awareness along with strict action to prevent such incidents. The culprits should be given severe punishment and we will ensure this.”

Nath also said that severe action must be taken to curb incidents of acid attacks on women. “We will fix responsibility in all such cases. The incidents of acid attack are a sign of barbarism and brutality. This needs to be stopped," he said.

According to latest data released by National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB), Madhya Pradesh is fourth among the 10 worst states in term of acid attacks from 2014 to 2018.

Title: Ray-tracing tech to brighten up product design
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Ahmedabad: Senior director and principal engineer for advanced rendering and visualisation at Intel, Jim Jeffers, will introduce design students to using high-fidelity ray-tracing technology for product design at the Ahmedabad Design Week, which has been organized by the Karnavati University on Friday.

“Ray tracing supported by a high-level of computing by Intel, produces a high degree of visual realism. The technology’s state of the art algorithm delves into the complex physics of light to produce the maximum realism,” says Jeffers.

He added that the technology generates an image by tracing the light path as pixels in an image plane and simulates the effects of its encounters with virtual objects. “During a live demonstration on Friday I will connect to Intel’s data centre in US to render a whole graphic visualisation. I want students to unleash their imagination through the power of ray tracing for designing automobiles, architecture and in product design. I will also show how the technology’s computational power can be unleashed for processing images of cloth, fluids, hair and more,” said Jeffers.

He said India holds immense potential for Intel’s ray-tracing technology. “I want to introduce Intel’s high-performance visual libraries like Embree and our microtools. We are now designing GPUs to take advantage of ray-tracing technologies. We see India taking the leadership in using these tools led by its design institutions,” says Jeffers.

On how ray-tracing differs from conventional 3D rendering, Jeffers says, “The ray tracing algorithm creates realistic effects by calculating reflections and shadows, which are difficult to simulate using other algorithms. The parallel computational independence makes ray-tracing more efficient than other technologies.”

Title: CPI hits out at ‘fickle’ Pawan
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Left parties expressed their dissatisfaction over Jana Sena chief Pawan Kalyan ’s decision to ally with BJP. CPI AP secretary demanded the Jana Sena chief explain the reasons for his decision. “Pawan Kalyan is not committed to fulfilling his promises. Pawan said he was impressed with the Left’s ideology and travelled with us in the 2019 general elections. He strongly opposed BJP, but the same person has now joined hands with BJP,” Ramakrishna said. TNN

Title: Delhi: How police nipped protest at Turkman Gate in the bud
Content:
PROTEST OUTSIDE THE TURKMAN GATE AGAINST CAA IN OLD DELHI ON THURSDAY. PHOTO BY RAJESH MEHTA

NEW DELHI: Chaos reigned at Turkman Gate on Thursday as protesters tried to block Asaf Ali Road and organise a sit-in protest against Citizenship Amendment Act. However, this time Delhi Police was well-prepared owing to intelligence inputs. The gathering was dispersed quickly in the early hours to prevent a Shaheen Bagh re-run. Though the protesters returned in the evening, police managed to contain them to the bylanes.Learning from their mistake at Shaheen Bagh — where they had presumed that the gathering would be small and isolated, but ended in a huge protest — police were more alert. When the handful of protesters tried to put up resistance, as video footage showed, they were evicted from the area and detained.The entire stretch of Asaf Ali Road around Turkman Gate was barricaded after 2am. The protesters were not allowed to squat or set up tents. A large group of women personnel were deployed to deal with women protesters. A warning was also issued to the speakers against inflammatory speeches.The leaders of the protesting groups were asked not to stop the flow of traffic. The day was also saved after an informal meeting with religious leaders of the area and the women protesters. Because of this, the agitation failed to gain momentum, unlike Shaheen Bagh and Khureji.Initially, police were taken aback when the protesters led by some residents of Shaheen Bagh and Jafrabad occupied the footpath outside Turkman Gate and started setting up plastic sheets and shamianas. They also got into a verbal spat with the policemen when asked to move away. However, they were soon convinced to limit the protest to the footpath with 50-60 people.The crowd started swelling when women and children from Shaheen Bagh, Jafrabad and Khureji were called to the spot through social media. By 6am, one carriageway of Asaf Ali Road was blocked.The arterial road remains busy with goods vehicles heading to the markets in the Walled City, especially after midnight. Anticipating the crowd to swell further, additional commissioner (central) Mandeep Singh Randhawa asked police to start checking vehicles carrying people and stop them from reaching Turkman Gate. The vehicles were diverted from Delhi Gate or Chaman Lal Marg.By daybreak, police issued an ultimatum to the organisers to shift the protest elsewhere before the peak hours began. While some left, a few dozen stayed back and had to be evicted forcefully.Around 7pm, the protesters again started gathering in the lanes behind Turkman Gate, but police blocked the entry and exit. Religious leaders were again roped in to convince the protesters to remain within the barricaded area.Meanwhile, videos of the incident, which went viral on social media, showed protesters being removed from the site trying to provoke the policemen into a confrontation. Police said efforts were being made to identify them. A probe has been initiated against a woman captured on camera misbehaving with policemen. The woman and her group have been spotted at different protest sites masquerading as DU, Jamia or JNU students. The SIT probing the anti-CAA riots has been asked to probe their background.

Title: Kerala: Road accidents claim over 4,300 lives in 2019
Content:
Representational image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Despite having stronger legal and enforcement interventions, accidental deaths on roads continue to go up for the consecutive second year, the data compiled by police reveals.As many as 52 more deaths due to road accidents were reported in 2019 when compared to 2018. The number of those grievously injured went up by 742. While the number of deaths were 4,355 in 2019, it was 4,303 in 2018, and 4,131 in 2017. Similarly, the number of those who were grievously injured in the accidents were 32,414 last year, when compared to 31,672 in 2018 and 29,733 in 2017.Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Ernakulam city, Ernakulam rural, Idukki, Palakkad, Kozhikode city, Kozhikode rural and Wayanad contributed to the increased number of deaths on the road last year when compared to 2018. Among these, Palakkad (increase of 37 deaths in 2019), Alappuzha (33) and Kozhikode city (21) tops the chart. At the same time, the accident numbers show a significant reduction in Thrissur rural (by 30), Kollam city (22), Kollam rural (17) and Thrissur city (16). The number of deaths in Kannur remained the same for both the years at 233. The number of those grievously injured too showed significant increase in the districts like Ernakulam rural (increase of 261), Kannur (193), Malappuram (134) and Kozhikode rural (104). At the same time, this number decreased significantly in Thiruvananthapuram city (reduced by 260), Ernakulam city (86), Idukki (63) and Kasargod (56).Police have been taking multiple measures to strengthen road safety rules with the help of technology. State police chief Loknath Behera had recently asked all police officials to strengthen enforcement on roads to ensure safety and discipline to reduce the road accidents by 25% in next three years.With courts insisting on following traffic rules, police have been asked to ensure total implementation of compulsory helmets for two-wheelers and seat belts for four-wheelers, action against drunken driving and drugs usage, lane discipline and unauthorized parking and unauthorised extension of shops on to roads.

Title: STF arrests eight for fuel theft from government tankers
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: Special Task Force’s ( STF ) Allahabad unit on Thursday busted an inter-district gang involved in stealing petrol and diesel from the tankers of government-run Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) and arrested eight of its members near Bajha Temple Road on Allahabad–Kaushambi highway.

Police also seized four IOCL tankers, a 220-litre oil drum, 12 drums of different capacity, equipment used in measuring oil, eight mobile phones, four Aadhaar cards, a Pan card, four driving licenses, one motorcycle and Rs 1.78 lakh cash from their possession.

The accused were identified as Sayedullah, Gulvez Ahmad, Sajid Ali, Rajendra Kumar Kesarwani, Arpit Kumar alias Pancham Lal, Indrapati Tripathi, Ram Avatar, Sheh Narayan and Shyam Tunni. Police said that while Sayedullah, Gulvez, Rajendra and Arpit were residents of Kaushambi, Indrapati was from Allahabad, Avatar from Ambedkarnagar, Sheh from Sultanpur and Shyam from Patna.

Indrapati, Ram Avatar, Sheh Narayan and Shyam Tunni were drivers of tankers.

Additional SP (STF) Neeraj Kumar Pandey said, “We received a tip-off that an inter-district gang involved in stealing oil from IOCL tankers. An STF team cordoned off the area and arrested eight men including four drivers.”

He also said that Sayedullah was the kinpin of the gang. “He told the police that the gang used to lure drivers of tankers with money, whenever they parked their vehicles near eateries on highway. Sayedullah and his aides used to offer the drivers a handsome amount for looking away while the gang did its job,” Pandey said.

The accused also told the police that the drivers used to help racketeers to break the seal on the fuel tank and drivers were paid Rs 50 and Rs 40 on each litre of stolen petrol and diesel respectively. Besides, they also used to adulterate the stolen fuel and used to sell at market prices in small towns and villages.

A case has been lodged in connection.

Title: Corporation invites bids for space in Thillai Nagar complex
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

The upcoming commercial complex of Trichy Corporation in Thillai Nagar

TRICHY: With 40% of the civil work completed for the three-floor commercial complex under smart cities mission at Thillai Nagar, the city corporation has invited bids from individual traders and retail outlets to hire the commercial space either partially or fully.

The civil work for the three-tier commercial complex in Thillai Nagar seventh cross that commenced early in 2019 is slated to be completed within this year. While the basement was earmarked for car parking, the ground floor and first floor of the complex will have commercial shops. The second floor was planned to accommodate office space units and a mini-meeting hall.
