The third floor will entirely house office space in the building equipped with lifts. Meanwhile, the civic body recently has informed that they are willing to rent the entire commercial complex to a single entity or partially by allotting each floor to interested bidders.

The corporation has said that Rs 53 per square feet will be collected as rent for occupying the commercial space as per the PWD guidelines. “With the construction work nearing half-way mark, if any bidders interested to hire the floors or the entire shopping complex, we are willing to carry out the modification work if needed,” a corporation official said.

If there is more than one bidder shown interest in occupying the entire complex or each floor, the successful bidder will be selected through auctioning. Interested traders or retail outlets franchises were requested to approach the K Abishekapuram zone officials at 0431-2772098.

Title: Former Kerala DGP to journalist: 'Who are you? Are you drunk?'
Content:
Ex-Kerala DGP TP Senkumar addresses media. (photo credit: ANI)

#WATCH Kerala: A journalist Kadavil Rasheed manhandled at a press conference in Trivandrum while former DGP TP Senk… https://t.co/XAmNg32Y7a — ANI (@ANI) 1579234125000

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Former DGP T P Senkumar ’s allegations against SNDP Yogam general secretary Vellappally Natesan at Thiruvananthapuram Press Club on Thursday took a different turn when he lost his cool and misbehaved with a journalist.Provoked by a query related to Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala that he regretted appointing Senkumar as the state police chief, the ex-DGP asked the journalist to reveal his identity and accused him of being drunk. “Who are you? Are you a journalist? I am supposed to receive questions only from journalists. Are you drunk? Come here and explain yourself,” Senkumar shouted. Meanwhile, people who had accompanied Senkumar for the news conference tried to push the journalist out of the conference hall, but were forced to abandon the idea after other journalists intervened.Kerala union of working journalists district committee, in a statement, condemned Senkumar’s behaviour and demanded an apology.

Title: Tamil writer speaking on CAA cut short at book fair
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Chennai: A section of litterateurs and some in the audience have accused the organisers of the Chennai Book Fair of asking writer Arumugam Tamilan to end his speech on Wednesday night for making references to the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC). The organisers, Booksellers and Publishers Association of South India (BAPASI), denied the charge and said he was cut short because he had exceeded the time limit.

BAPASI president R S Shanmugham said the police had given permission to keep the fair open only till 9 pm and Tamilan was still speaking around 9.05-9.10 pm. So he was asked to wrap up.

But this didn’t cut ice with critics. “I don’t know whether the organisers have prepared any list on what is to be spoken. The idea is to suppress those who question the establishment. This is a dangerous trend,” said Tamil poet Manushyaputhiran.

Book fairs are open platforms where all ideas are discussed without any censorship, he said. “If the organisers don’t want such talks, then they should prepare a list of what they want immediately. Otherwise, they should come up with an explanation for their misdeeds like why these people are prevented while expressing their ideas in the open. If we can’t talk about CAA and NRC, then we can’t talk about demonetization as well,” he said.

Filmmaker Amshan Kumar said such restrictions and interferences are unfair, particularly when it comes to a book fair where ideas are expressed freely. “It’s happening quite often, and I consider this a very dangerous one. Writers are meant to speak about the issues around them. They should never be stopped. What happened at the book fair was ridiculous,” said Amshan Kumar.

Young Tamil poet Sukritharani said such attacks are against the secular fabric of society. “I was not there when this incident took place. It’s unfortunate. I heard about it later and it’s unfortunate,” she said.

Title: I-T raids at Tollywood actor Rashmika Mandanna’s house in Karnataka
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Rashmika Mandana. (Image taken from actor's Facebook account/@RashmikaMandanna)

HYDERABAD: Income tax officials on Thursday conducted searches at the house of Tollywood actor Rashmika Mandanna in Virajpet in Kodagu district of Karnataka.

Officials from the I-T Bengaluru investigation unit started searches around 7.00am. Rashmika was not at home during the raid. Officials also searched Serenity Hall owned by Rahsmika’s father Madan. His office premises was also searched.

I-T sleuths are looking into the payments she received in the last two years for nine films and the amount she paid in taxes.

I-T sleuths from Hyderabad were involved in the searches. Rashmika’s manager said that the search would not yield results as she has paid her taxes.

Title: Congress offers cashback for each litre of water saved
Content:
Subhash Chopra

NEW DELHI: With AAP dispensation already giving free water and BJP promising to continue with the existing scheme if elected to power, Delhi Congress has gone a step ahead and announced “cashback” to consumers on each litre of free water saved.Delhi Congress chief Subhash Chopra on Thursday said if the party came to power, the residents would not only get 20,000 litres of free water a month, but also get 30 paise cashback for each litre saved by them. “The AAP government gave 20,000 litres of free water per month without any calculations. It never paid attention to water conservation and the scheme only benefited water mafia,” Chopra claimed.He added that water from abandoned empty houses was going to tanker mafia. “Our scheme will encourage people to save water. Even the Supreme Court has said that if water was not conserved, Delhi will head for a ‘water war’. We will do our bit to conserve it,” he said.The announcement came days after the party chief promised “relief” to the residents consuming up to 600 units of electricity and free power of 200 units to small traders and farmers for their tubewells. The party has also promised to double the amount of pension given to senior citizens, widows and differently abled.After being in power for 15 years, Congress could barely manage eight seats in 2013 polls, while it failed to get any seat in the 2015 election. To counter the sops offered by the AAP government, Congress is announcing ‘new freebies’, which will be the part of its manifesto. Addressing a joint press conference, Chopra and Congress chief spokesperson Mukesh Sharma claimed that the cashback plan would help the city save at least 25-30% of drinking water. “If a family saves 10,000 litres, it will get Rs 3,000. The money will be transferred directly into the bank accounts,” Sharma said, adding that individuals and no-profit orgnisations working in the field of water conservation should join hands with Congress.

Title: Congress offers cashback for each litre of water saved
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Subhash Chopra

NEW DELHI: With AAP dispensation already giving free water and BJP promising to continue with the existing scheme if elected to power, Delhi Congress has gone a step ahead and announced “cashback” to consumers on each litre of free water saved.

Delhi Congress chief Subhash Chopra on Thursday said if the party came to power, the residents would not only get 20,000 litres of free water a month, but also get 30 paise cashback for each litre saved by them. “The AAP government gave 20,000 litres of free water per month without any calculations. It never paid attention to water conservation and the scheme only benefited water mafia,” Chopra claimed.

He added that water from abandoned empty houses was going to tanker mafia. “Our scheme will encourage people to save water. Even the Supreme Court has said that if water was not conserved, Delhi will head for a ‘water war’. We will do our bit to conserve it,” he said.

The announcement came days after the party chief promised “relief” to the residents consuming up to 600 units of electricity and free power of 200 units to small traders and farmers for their tubewells. The party has also promised to double the amount of pension given to senior citizens, widows and differently abled.

After being in power for 15 years, Congress could barely manage eight seats in 2013 polls, while it failed to get any seat in the 2015 election. To counter the sops offered by the AAP government, Congress is announcing ‘new freebies’, which will be the part of its manifesto. Addressing a joint press conference, Chopra and Congress chief spokesperson Mukesh Sharma claimed that the cashback plan would help the city save at least 25-30% of drinking water. “If a family saves 10,000 litres, it will get Rs 3,000. The money will be transferred directly into the bank accounts,” Sharma said, adding that individuals and no-profit orgnisations working in the field of water conservation should join hands with Congress.

Title: Authorities explore ways to mind the decibels
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Indore: Already a Swachh pioneer, Indore may soon take drastic steps to curb noise pollution and win the ‘ silent city ’ tag too. District administration with the help of departments concerned will take appropriate steps to reduce air pollution of Indore.

District collector Lokesh Kumar Jatav, during a workshop of MP Pollution Control Board said that collective efforts are being taken to check noise and air pollution.

“In recent past, a ban on DJ music was enforced in procession of Anant Chaturdashi and it yielded good results. We will ensure a ban on noise pollution in different parts of the city that are declared as silent zones,” he said. In order to check air pollution, the administration will send a proposal to state government not to issue new permits of auto-rickshaws while public transport facilities will be extended to facilitate people, collector added.

“We have taken up 12 points concerning city traffic, to be discussed to find practical solutions of it through ‘Traffic Cabinet’ comprising senior officials from different departments. Suggestions from subject experts and locals will also be sought for better implementation of plans. The same will also be made public,” he said.

IMC commissioner Asheesh Singh said ongoing works of cleanliness has helped reduce pollution in city. “We will now double number of machines to make city dust-free,” Singh said.

The workshop was also addressed by senior officials of pollution control board and it was finally decided that collective efforts, with the help of locals, will be made to help Indore become ‘silent city of India’ in near future.

During the meet, subject experts, students, industrialists, police officials and people from all walks of life gave important suggestions to help achieving the goals.

Title: Mangaluru: Pedestrian run over by private bus
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

MANGALURU: A pedestrian was killed after he was run over by a private city bus on Thursday. The deceased is Sundar Salian , 75, a retired NMPT employee , and the accident reportedly took place when he was attempting to cross the road at Baikampady Junction, when a bus plying from Panambur to Surathkal ran over him.

The Traffic North Police have registered a case under IPC section 279 (Rash driving or riding on a public way) and section 304 (A) causing death by negligence. The bus has been seized.

Title: Two die in road accident
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: Two private employees died when their bike rammed into a bus in Thumkunta on Wednesday.

The victims were identified as Jagadeesh, 23, and Shireesh, 24, from Macha Bolarum. The duo were relatives.

The mishap occurred during the early hours of Wednesday when the duo was returning from a birthday party. “The victims were not wearing helmet. They went under the bus and died on the spot with critical injuries,” the inspector said. Police registered a case under Section 304-A of the IPC. TNN

Title: Puducherry CM V Narayanasamy challenges LG Kiran Bedi on graft charges against him, son
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Chief minister V Narayanaswamy

PUDUCHERRY: Chief minister V Narayanasamy challenged lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi to prove land grabbing charges levelled against him and his son by a Congress MLA N Danavelu , who was suspended from the party on Thursday, and declared that he will resign if the charges are proved.

Speaking to reporters on Thursday, he questioned whether Bedi will resign and quit public life if the charges against him and his son cannot be proved. Narayanasamy termed Bedi’s decision to issue a press statement on Danavelu’s baseless oral allegations of land grabbing without any concrete evidence against him and his son as derogatory. He declared that her action proved that she does not have any administrative abilities.

“When you receive a written complaint of corrupt practices with concrete evidence against someone, you must first review the complaint and ascertain whether there is any ground for the allegation and then refer the issue to the police or the CBI. She (Bedi) issued a press note based on Danavelu’s baseless open allegations without any evidence against me and my son. This reveals the animosity she has towards me. I am openly challenging Bedi to prove the charges and I will resign. Will she resign and quit public life if the charges cannot be proved?” Narayanasamy questioned.

He said anyone can level corruption charges against anybody, but they must produce concrete evidence to prove their charges. “People know Danavelu’s past and his activities before,” he said.

Narayanasamy lambasted Bedi charging that she does not have the ability or quality to serve as lieutenant governor. “She does not have any qualification to be a lieutenant governor. Chief minister is a constitutional authority. She insults chief minister and ministers to attain instant publicity,” he said.

He said he had served as the secretary of All India Congress Committee for 14 years, as a member of parliament for 23 years, Union minister of state for 10 years and is currently serving as the chief minister for the past three and half years and declared that he could not have been a part of Manmohan Singh-led cabinet in the UPA1 and UPA2 governments in the Centre if he was involved in corrupt practices.

“I served as Union minister with CBI under my direct purview. If I had indulged in corrupt practices, I would not have been a part of Manmohan Singh-led cabinet in the Centre and I would not have been in the good books of our leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi,” he said.

He accused All India NR Congress and BJP parties besides Danavelu of encouraging and instigating Bedi to act against the elected government.

Title: Aptitude test for SSC students across Nashik division
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: The Nashik division of Maharashtra Education Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has directed the authorities of all government schools in four districts of North Maharashtra to complete the aptitude test of Class X students by end of January and issue a marksheet for the same.

The divisional secretary of the department Nitin Upasani said the majority of the schools across Nashik, Dhule, Jalgaon and Nandurbar districts have already conducted the tests.

“My feedback is that the remaining schools involving about 6,000 students would complete the said test by January 18. It is a mandatory practice in all our schools to conduct such tests,” Upasani told TOI.

The practice of conducting an aptitude test for Class X students in all the government schools in the division is prevalent since 2016.

There are total 2,721 schools with state board in Nashik, Nandurbar, Dhule and Jalgaon districts. The number of students in these schools for Class X is 2,16,375.

“This test is arranged for regular students only. Repeaters are allowed to appear for the test. In Over 1.9 lakh students have already appeared for the test,” said Upasani.

The test helps students to find out what subject would they like to opt for their higher secondary studies.

The test generally consists of questions from logical and reasoning, languages, mathematics and science.

Title: Agra Municipal Corporation launches android based tax collection system
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

The revenue inspectors were provided smart hand-held devices

AGRA: To increase revenue recovery and bring transparency in collection of house tax, Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) administration on Thursday launched android based tax collection system.

The revenue inspectors were provided smart handheld devices. Connected to the civic body’s central server, these devices will allow revenue inspectors to issue receipt to the property owners. Besides, the central server will also send message of receiving payment on the customer’s registered mobile number.

According to Mayor Naveen Jain, the new tax collection system will leave no scope for any malpractices in the tax collection process. A hundred android based handheld devices have been provided to the AMC by Axis bank as part of the corporate social responsibility.

Mayor Naveen Jain said, “Digitalization of records of 3.10 lakh properties in the city’s 100 wards has been completed. The digital records have been uploaded on the AMC website. After paying tax, the property owners will be able to crosscheck it online. AMC is first in UP to implement the smart tax collection system.”

For the current financial year 2019-20, the municipal board has set a target of collecting Rs 60 crore house tax. So far, only Rs 26 crore has been collected. AMC officials hope that the android collection system will help in achieving the target by March 31.

According to AMC records, out of the 3.10 lakh properties registered with the civic body, only 10 percent property owners have no dues pending. Around 10,000 property owners have not paid any tax for the past five years. Recently, AMC administration has issued notices to these property owners to clear their outstanding dues.

Title: Kerala: Admission supervisory panel failed in fixing fee stated high court
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

KOCHI: Admission supervisory and fee regulatory committee (ASC) failed in fixing an appropriate fee for MBBS courses in self-financing colleges, the high court said in a judgment.

A division bench comprising Justice A M Shaffique and Justice T V Anilkumar considered 17 petitions filed by college managements, alleging that the ASC failed to consider the fee fixation afresh even though the high court had set aside the committee’s order last year and remanded the matter back for fresh consideration. Fee fixed for 2016-17, 2017-18, and 2018-19 were considered in last year’s judgment. Now, the ASC has confirmed the earlier view taken by it, which was already set aside by the high court, the managements alleged. The ASC ignored the documents submitted and fixed a fee that had no connection with the actual expenditure, the managements contended.

The court said a perusal of the ASC’s order does not reveal any application of mind. As per the 2019 judgment and Section 11 of Kerala Medical Education (Regulation and Control of Admission to Private Medical Educational Institutions) Act, the fee fixed should be reasonable and should consider various parameters such as location of the college, nature of the course, cost of land and building, administration and maintenance expenses, and reasonable surplus for growth and development. But no such consideration is found in the ASC’s order, the court said.

Finding that the ASC had failed to comply with the order to consider the matter afresh in its proper perspective, the court said there is no clarity in the committee’s order and there was re-determination of fee by the committee. When the Act itself gives an indication as to how the fee has to be determined, the committee is obliged to fix the fee in accordance with the statutory provisions, the court said. The committee had thoroughly failed in fixation of fee, the court said.

Title: First ‘Study in Gujarat’ roadshow held in Kuwait
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Gandhinagar: As part of its ‘Study in Gujarat’ campaign, the state government, in association with representatives of 19 universities of the state with Ganpat University as the lead partner, held its first overseas roadshow of the campaign in Kuwait on Thursday.

A number of educators, principals, teachers, parents, students, and representatives from universities in Kuwait were present during the roadshow which was also attended by the Indian ambassador in Kuwait, K Jeeva Sagar.

The Gujarat delegation was led by education minister Bhupendrasinh Chudasama, higher education principal secretary Anju Singh and representatives of 19 universities of the state.

Chudasama said, “Gujarat has some of the finest world class institutes with state-of-the-art infrastructure. Kuwait and Gujarat can show the world the true meaning of a knowledge-based economy.” Principal secretary Anju Sharma said, “The state accounts for 46 % of the emerging startups in India. There are 493 patents filed under the Student Startup and Innovation Policy. At present, there are more than 10,000 foreign students studying in universities and colleges of Gujarat.”

Title: India rising in world order, says PM
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Kozhikode: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that India’s position in the world order was rising and added that Indian thought has the potential to solve some of the most leading challenges faced by the planet.

Inaugurating the three-day international conclave on ‘Globalizing Indian Thought’ organized by the Indian Institute of Management-Kozhikode ( IIM-K ) through video conferencing on Thursday, Modi said that Indian way of conflict avoidance is not by brute force but by the power of dialogue.

“It would make everyone proud that being rooted to Indian systems and traditions, the country is surging ahead on the path of development. You can see it in the manner in which India has achieved remarkable financial inclusion and how we have rolled out the largest healthcare programme in the world. No wonder India’s position in the world order is rising. Indian thought has given a lot to the world and has the potential to contribute even more,” he added.

Elaborating on the various strands of Indian thought that has been the hallmark of country’s culture and contributed much to the world, Modi said that the ideas of compassion, harmony, justice, service and openness were central to Indian values.

“Our civilization has prospered when many could not. Why? Because one finds peace and harmony here,” Modi said.

Stating that many of the health practices which have now become popular worldwide, including yoga, have their roots in India, Modi called upon the IIM community to devote time to yoga.

He said that India’s belief in peace and harmony also included harmony with mother nature and environment and traces of that belief can be found in the leadership role performed by the country in forming the international solar alliance and efforts to increase use of renewable energy.

Highlighting the respect and importance accorded to women in Indian culture, Modi said that even while most Western countries took decades to give voting rights to women, the makers of the country’s Constitution ensured women had voting rights from the very first day.

Modi said that innovation came naturally for India as it had a culture of openness and respect for different opinions.

“The innovative zeal of Indians is drawing the world to India. We are a nation with a vibrant young population. Our demographic dividend makes us a magnet for investment,” he added.

He also digitally unveiled a statue of Swami Vivekananda in front of the MDC Complex at the function.

Spiritual leader Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, in his keynote address, said that scientific temper was embedded deeply in Indian thought. He said that India can give a sense of belongingness to the world through its culture, wisdom and rich traditional knowledge.

President of Indian Council of Cultural Relations (ICCR) and MP, Vinay Sahasrabuddhe and IIM-K director Debashis Chatterjee spoke. Grammy Award winner Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt staged a musical performance after the session.

Title: Kochi: Priest questions soft stand on CAA
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Fr Kuriakose Mundadanof

KOCHI: Fr Kuriakose Mundadan of the Ernakulam-Angamaly archdiocese has come out with a veiled attack against the stand taken by the Syro-Malabar Synod against Love Jihad while criticizing the Church for not having a formal stand on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ).

Fr Mundadan’s reaction was in his column ‘Varikalkidayil’ on the Sathyadeepam, a Church run weekly, set to hit stands on January 22. As per a clipping of the weekly, which completed printing the priest in the article titled, ‘Paurathva Bhedagathiyum Love Jihadum Kooticherkaamo? (Can Citizenship Amendment and Love Jihad be intertwined?)’, states that it is common sense to not make statements belittling any particular religion when the entire country is burning due to politics of religion.

“Since, the dangerous CAA would negatively affect the diversity and democracy of India, political parties and religions took a clear stand on it. But was the stand of the Catholic Church clear? This question is important as there was no clear stand on the issue from the Catholic Church in Kerala,” the article reads.

It states that unlike the strong worded opposition of Latin Catholic Church in Kerala and Archbishop Soosa Pakiam, the statement by the Syro Malabar Synod headed by Cardinal Alencherry, who is also KCBC president, was just an advice to the central government. The priest states, commenting on the Synod’s statement that the central government should resolve the confusions and apprehensions around CAA.

“Laity in the state is asking about the present state of the Catholic Church in Kerala which comes under Pope Francis who is known for his strong stand for secularism,” the priest writes.

The priest points out the lack of evidence in allegations of Love Jihad. “Has anyone taken the number of men and women who have converted to Christianity in the name of love?” he asks in the article. Fr Mundadan told TOI that priests have the right to express their opinion and the article was his take on the issue.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: With focus on Poorvanchali votes, Congress & RJD eye pact
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Sonia Gandhi (L); Tejashwi Yadav(R)

NEW DELHI: Congress is likely to enter into a pre-poll alliance with the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) for the Delhi assembly elections on February 8. RJD may take five-six seats while Congress will fight for the rest, a source said. The two parties already have a tie-up in Bihar and Jharkhand.

The central election committee of Congress was busy in a closed-door meeting till late Thursday evening to finalise its candidates and the announcement of the alliance is likely to be made on Friday.

Earlier in the day, RJD national spokesperson Manoj Jha met senior Congress functionaries and handed over the list of seats and candidates. He told a news agency that RJD was entering the fray to fulfil the role of a Poorvanchali party. “Our relations with Congress go a long way back. So, we started talks with them and the talks have been positive,” he said. Indicating that a deal may be sealed within the next 24 hours, Jha said while RJD had demanded seven — 10% — seats, it was “ready to contest on five-six seats”.

The seats chosen by RJD include Burari, Karawal Nagar and Timarpur in north-east Delhi, Kirari in north-west, and Uttam Nagar and Palam in west Delhi, all with a significant percentage of voters from Poorvanchal, a term that loosely refers to migrants from eastern Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

A senior Congress functionary claimed that the impact of the alliance would be felt in several other seats with Poorvanchali voters. The RJD candidates may also contest on the Congress’ election symbol, a source said. To woo the Poorvanchali voters, Congress recently appointed Kirti Azad as the chairman of its campaign committee.

In the recently held Jharkhand assembly elections, the two parties went into an alliance with Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and they have come to power. In the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, too, they had an alliance. In Bihar, RJD had contested on 20 of the 40 Lok Sabha seats while Congress got nine.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: With focus on Poorvanchali votes, Congress & RJD eye pact
Content:
Sonia Gandhi (L); Tejashwi Yadav(R)

NEW DELHI: Congress is likely to enter into a pre-poll alliance with the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) for the Delhi assembly elections on February 8. RJD may take five-six seats while Congress will fight for the rest, a source said. The two parties already have a tie-up in Bihar and Jharkhand.The central election committee of Congress was busy in a closed-door meeting till late Thursday evening to finalise its candidates and the announcement of the alliance is likely to be made on Friday.Earlier in the day, RJD national spokesperson Manoj Jha met senior Congress functionaries and handed over the list of seats and candidates. He told a news agency that RJD was entering the fray to fulfil the role of a Poorvanchali party. “Our relations with Congress go a long way back. So, we started talks with them and the talks have been positive,” he said. Indicating that a deal may be sealed within the next 24 hours, Jha said while RJD had demanded seven — 10% — seats, it was “ready to contest on five-six seats”.The seats chosen by RJD include Burari, Karawal Nagar and Timarpur in north-east Delhi, Kirari in north-west, and Uttam Nagar and Palam in west Delhi, all with a significant percentage of voters from Poorvanchal, a term that loosely refers to migrants from eastern Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.A senior Congress functionary claimed that the impact of the alliance would be felt in several other seats with Poorvanchali voters. The RJD candidates may also contest on the Congress’ election symbol, a source said. To woo the Poorvanchali voters, Congress recently appointed Kirti Azad as the chairman of its campaign committee.In the recently held Jharkhand assembly elections, the two parties went into an alliance with Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and they have come to power. In the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, too, they had an alliance. In Bihar, RJD had contested on 20 of the 40 Lok Sabha seats while Congress got nine.

Title: Inform if FCRA clearance obtained for CM V Narayanasamy’s Singapore tour
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

CM V Narayanswami

Puducherry: The Union home ministry has requested the Puducherry government to inform whether it had obtained the mandatory clearance from the Centre for the visit of chief minister V Narayanasamy and others to Singapore in November last year.

Deputy commandant (home) Ravi Ranjan in a letter to chief secretary Ashwani Kumar said the ministry has examined the Puducherry government's letter dated December 13 last year on the visit of Narayanasamy and others to Singapore.

"Government of Union Territory of Puducherry is requested to inform whether mandatory FCRA (The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act) clearance had been obtained or otherwise," Ranjan said.

He also advised the Puducherry government to adhere to the Centre's direction of intimating the ministry in advance on the foreign trips of the chief minister, his cabinet colleagues and other elected members through the lieutenant governor.

"Government of Union Territory of Puducherry is also advised to take action as per Cabinet Secretariat's O.M. dated May 6, 2015, in future, with prior intimation to this ministry through LG Puducherry," Ranjan said.

Lieutenant governor’s secretariat thanked the Centre for addressing the long-standing violation frequently committed (by the chief minister, ministers and elected members). Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi pointed out that there are two sets of rules for foreign travels – one for the public officials and the other for the elected members occupying responsible positions in the administration.

Bedi accused Narayanasamy, his cabinet colleague M O H F Shahjahan and DMK MLA R Siva of visiting Singapore in November last year without obtaining the mandatory clearance from the Centre. She said the anomaly was raised in the governors’ conference held recently and expressed gratitude that the issue was ‘addressed and settled with urgency for the larger public good’.

“The office of the Lt Governor thanks the GOI, MHA for settling this long-standing violation which was being frequently committed,” she said.

Bedi pointed out that the issue related to the Singapore visit of Narayanasamy and others has not been ‘finally settled as statutory clearance under FCRA was not obtained’ by the team led by the chief minister.

She insisted that members of the cabinet and others must obtain all prior clearances mandated before taking up foreign trips.

Bedi accused a minister of travelling frequently to a country without intimating the chief secretary and lieutenant governor’s secretariat and obtaining prior clearance from the Centre. She also accused a few others (ministers and elected members) of visiting ‘sensitive countries without any record with the administration’.

“All this now comes under due regulation and watch,” she said.

Narayanasamy had denied the charges and claimed that he and others obtained due clearance from the authorities concerned before visiting Singapore. He claimed that he informed the Prime Minister’s office about the visit and the Union external affairs ministry also accorded political clearance for the visit.

Title: Panel soon to review Chandrapur liquor ban; no loss of revenue, says activist
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

CHANDRAPUR: Close on the heels of excise department’s suggestion to lift liquor ban in Chandrapur district owing to “revenue loss”, state minister for relief and rehabilitation and Chandrapur guardian minister, Vijay Wadettiwar , on Thursday said that a committee will be soon formed to evaluate the success of prohibition. “Based on its report the state government would take a call on lifting prohibition in the district,” said Wadettiwar.

Wadettiwar, who was on his maiden visit to Chandrapur after becoming a cabinet minister, talked about the positive and negative impacts of liquor ban and said that time has come to evaluate its outcome.

The excise department’s suggestion had come up at a review meeting of various department called by deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar recently. Wadettiwar claimed he was not present at the meeting but stated that if it’s established that prohibition has proved successful in Chandrapur, “then there is no question of revoking the ban”.

Leader of anti-liquor activists, Paromita Goswami, termed the statements and developments as a “conspiracy to create an atmosphere against prohibition”. Addressing media on Thursday, she tore into claims of revenue loss due to prohibition and reasons being put forth to lift the ban.

“The claims of excise department officials about losing revenue of Rs200 crore per month or Rs2,400 crore per year due to prohibition in Chandrapur district is a blatant lie,” she said while claiming that the department’s total revenue target itself is between Rs15,000 and 17,000 crore.

Wadettiwar had in the past lashed out at the failure of liquor ban in Chandrapur and demanded it to be evaluated. While campaigning for assembly election, he had spoken need of projecting Tadoba as an international tourist destination. Liquor is one of the main attractions for tourists, he had said while stressing that national and international visitors need to be offered what they like when they come to Chandrapur.

Many people’s representatives have opposed the liquor ban. Chandrapur MP Balu Dhanorkar is a strong supporter of lifting the ban. During the Lok Sabha election campaign, his opponent BJP’s Hansraj Ahir termed its as fight between ‘Milkman Vs Liquor baron’.

Independent MLA from Chandrapur, Kishor Jorgewar, too has sought rethink on prohibition. His rival and former BJP MLA Nana Shamkule had registered his opposition to the study panel that had recommended liquor ban back in 2012-13.

Goswami claimed that Congress and NCP leaders have made lifting liquor ban their top priority since Loksabha election. “Soon after coming to power, they started taking steps to life the ban. They don’t talk about the outcome of liquor ban in Wardha and Gadchiroli districts, because those were implemented during their regime,” she said.

She declared that any move to lift prohibition will be strongly opposed. “I am not against the review committee. If it carries out fair and impartial evaluation, I am optimistic about a positive outcome,” she said.

She said that there is no revenue loss due to the ban. “Excise on liquor is taken at the source of production (liquor factory) and none of the liquor producers have claimed reduction in production due to prohibition in Chandrapur,” she said.

The activist also claimed that the loss is only Rs5 crore which was revenue from liquor licence renewal in the district, she claimed.

Title: Bhim Army’s Chandrashekhar Azad to visit Jama Masjid, cops on alert
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Chandrashekhar Azad

NEW DELHI: Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad , who has been externed from the city for the next four weeks by a court as a part of a bail agreement, will be visiting Jama Masjid on Friday. The same day, he will attend a media conference and then head to the Valmiki temple at RK Ashram Marg before leaving for his hometown in Saharanpur.

Azad had sought special permission from the court for the visits. Bhim Army media coordinator Kush said that Azad would be visiting the Jama Masjid between 11am and 12 noon. “If possible, he will also visit the Ravidass Temple in Govindpuri,” Kush added.

However, police sources said that Azad’s itiniary had not been shared with them till Thursday late night. A team of policemen would escort him and videograph all his movements until he reaches his hometown. He would not be allowed to address a crowd at any of these places.

Cops expect a large crowd to follow Azad during his visits and have made adequate arrangements.

Azad was earlier arrested from the Jama Masjid after a wild-goose chase through the day during which he kept hoodwinking the police. He was charged under sections of rioting and arson after a protest at the Delhi Gate suddenly turned violent after Azad’s speech at the Jama Masjid.

He was bailed out on Wednesday after he approached the court citing health issues.

Police sources said that keeping the bail conditions in mind, they would only allow Azad to visit the places he had mentioned in his documents submitted to the court.

He will not be allowed to meet and address even his supporters.

Title: Want to build tallest Lord Buddha statue in Nagpur: Nitin Raut
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Nitin Raut

NAGPUR: Guardian minister Nitin Raut on Thursday said that he wants to build the tallest statue of Lord Buddha in the city. This will attract international Buddhist tourists here, he feels.

Raut also announced that he would build a Buddhist-themed park near Futala. The project was proposed in 2003 during the tercentenary celebrations of the city, but never materialized.

The minister said that the city had a lot of tourism potential due to its proximity to tiger reserves and association with Dr BR Ambedkar. “If we develop Gorewada zoo and some places of interest related to Ambedkar and Buddha and combine it with wildlife tourism, Nagpur can become a big tourist hub. Most of the international tourists in India are from Buddhist countries,” he added, while addressing a ‘Meet the Press’ event at Patrakar Club.

He further said that Zero Mile would also be beautified to attract tourists. “In fact, I want to develop an Ambedkar corridor in the state. All the places which had some association with him would be linked,” he added.

Raut could not clearly explain the astronomical grid support charge (GSC) proposed by MSEDCL on solar rooftop consumers. Media persons pointed out to him that on one hand, the energy department was promoting solar energy, and on the other hand making it expensive for consumers. Raut said that he would comment on it after holding a meeting of discom officials on Friday.

The minister said that MSEDCL was installing solar agricultural pumps on a priority basis. “We have installed thousands of pumps, and many more would be supplied to farmers in the coming months. It is wrong to say that we are against solar power,” he asserted.

On the appointment of private experts by the previous government in the energy department, Raut said that they had been asked to resign, failing which their services would be terminated. “My department will see a lot of cleansing in the coming days,” he added.

On failing to curb crime rate in the city, Raut said that minister of state for home Satej Patil had convened a meeting of city police officers and told them to take concrete steps to reduce crime, otherwise they would have to face the music.

Title: In new VC RR Tewari’s first decision, breather for student netas
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

New directions

ALLAHABAD: In his first administrative decision after taking over, Allahabad University’s (AU) new officiating VC RR Tewari granted relief to 12 students leaders who had been suspended or rusticated during the tenure of his predecessor RL Hangloo. On Thursday, Tewari ordered that the suspended students can appear for their examinations and complete the course.

The list of suspended students included former AU Students Union president Rohit Mishra

The errant students were either suspended, blacklisted or rusticated from the university over their alleged involvement in various protests Hangloo or the university administration.

“These 12 students can now enter the campus and appear in their exams,” said AU chief proctor Ram Sevak Dubey.

In another important decision, the VC appointed Shailendra Mishra from the anthropology department as the new public relations officer of AU.

Ravi Singh, one of the senior-most class C employees of AU, was again appointed as the personal assistant to the VC. Singh was also Hangloo’s PA and the AU registrar, but was later transferred to the office of dean of arts and commerce— a move which was considered to be far below his capability and seniority. Singh took charge on Thursday.

Tewari also said that AU would function for five days a week, albeit teachers who feel that they have to take extra classes to complete the syllbus are free to teach on Saturdays and Sundays as well.

“The offices would remain open for five days only, but because of the delay due to recent disturbances, the head of the departments would ensure that the syllabi is completed in the spring semester (January-June 2020) within time. Teachers can take classes on Saturdays and Sundays as well,” said Tewari.

Title: 2 thieves held with stolen jewellery
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Agra: Kasganj district police on Thursday arrested two men allegedly involved in a theft that occurred nearly five months.

Identified as Asif and Id Mohammad, the accused were caught along with stolen jewellery worth Rs 2.5 lakh and a mobile phone.

According to police, the accused broke into a house in Durga Colony on August 17 last year and made away with valuables worth Rs 3 lakh.

Title: Nod from local police must for organising parties: SP Arti Singh
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Nashik: The Nashik rural police have made it mandatory for owners of all hotels, dhabas, farmhouses etc. operating under its jurisdiction to seek prior permission for renting their premises for functions where music systems would be used and liquor will be served.

“I have told the owners of all commercial establishments that police would take legal action against them if they fail to get NOCs from the local police for renting their premises for such events,” Nashik rural SP Arti Singh said.

“There is no need to get a nod from local police if the premises are being used for ceremonies like marriages or small private gatherings where music system would not be used or liquor will not be served,” she added. The decision comes in wake of the recent incident at a farm house where two DJs were allegedly assaulted during a birthday party. The duo are undergoing treatment at the Nashik civil hospital. tnn

Title: Uttarakhand's first 100 percentile holder in CAT felicitated
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

DEHRADUN: Brigadier Subhash Panwar, station commandant Clementon and Director General (L&O) Ashok Kumar on Thursday felicitated the toppers of Common Admission Test (CAT). Several CAT toppers, including Divyansh Gupta, who claims to be the first person to score 100 percentile from the hill state was felicitated during the event.

Talking to TOI, Divyansh Gupta, who is overwhelmed to become state’s first CAT applicant to get 100 percentile, said that the examination is not over yet as the main task to clear the interview round is yet to come. “These days, the top B-schools focus on the all-round performance of the student and not just the CAT marks. Hence, there are chances that even a 100 percentile may not get the top B-school,” said Divyansh.

Title: Secunderabad: Union minister of state for home G Kishan Reddy pulls up railway staff over defunct detector
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Union minister G Kishan Reddy inspects the door frame metal detector at Secunderabad Railway Station on Thursd... Read More

HYDERABAD: Union minister of state for home G Kishan Reddy on Thursday pulled up railway officials and Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel after he found the door frame metal detector at Secunderabad railway station to be defunct.

Kishan Reddy was at the Secunderabad station to catch a train to a municipality as part of BJP municipal elections campaign .

Kishan Reddy was on his way to Bellampalli, Narsapur, Godavarikhani and Ramagundam municipalities.

SCR principal chief security commissioner GM Eswara Rao told TOI, “The door frame metal detector is supposed to beep when a passenger walks in with a metal item. It was not working when minister Kishan Reddy came to the station due to a technical issue. We have replaced it. We have also asked for more door frame metal detectors.”

Secunderabad railway station handles around 1.25 lakh passengers during festive season.

“We will be deploying additional forces from Railway Protection Special Force (RPSF). Currently, the RPF is short-staffed. We have sought 780 new personnel for RPF and they are undergoing training. There will soon be greater security at the railway stations and platforms. To temporarily sort out the problem, we are roping in special forces,” said Eswara Rao.

A member of an anti-terror cop squad said, “Secunderabad was on Lashkar-e-Toiba’s hit list. During Sankranti , there is huge rush of passengers. RPF and Government Railway Police (GRP) personnel shall ensure the safety and security of passengers.”

Title: Kerala: Abused girl’s kin held for killing Pocso accused
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

Title: Two flights cancelled, four delayed
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Indore: Flight movement to and from city was affected on Thursday with two flights being cancelled and four getting delayed by up to four hours due to bad weather. GoAir’s morning flight from Bangalore to Indore was announced cancelled for Thursday, Indore-Delhi flight of the same airline was also announced cancelled for Friday.

GoAir’s morning flight on Kolkata-Indore route was delayed by four and a half hours. The flight was scheduled to arrive Indore at 6.45am but landed after a delay of 4 hour and 38 minutes at 11.23pm. This in turn also delayed return of the flight from Indore by 4 hour and 19 minutes. The same aircraft was scheduled to take off from Indore at 7.15am, departed at 11.48am. TruJet’s Ahmedabad-Indore was also late by one hour and 24 minutes. Indigo’s Hyderabad-Indore flight and Air-Asia’s Delhi-Indore flight were also delayed by more than half an hour.

Indore airport officials said that bad weather condition at connecting airports affected flight operations. “There was no delay at Indore and arrival and departure of some of the flights was affected owing to cascading delays at connecting airports,” said airport director Aryama Sanyal. TNN

Title: Another Swachh leap, bots to clean manholes of Indore
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Indore: The future is here. Manholes of Swachh Indore will now be cleaned by robots. After Hyderabad, now Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC) is planning to introduce robotic manhole cleaning machine to eliminate human intervention in cleaning of manholes in city.

Corporation officials said that 10 robotic de-silting machines will be deployed in one of wards in city on trial.

“We are in talks with a Kerala-based firm that has developed this robotic machine for cleaning manholes. The agency has proposed to deploy around 10 robotic cleaning machines in city on trial. If found feasible, the initiative would be implemented across city,” IMC commissioner Asheesh Singh told TOI.

He said that though IMC already have super sucker machines for cleaning sewer lines and chambers, sometimes they require manual intervention as these machines are not that equipped to perform the work.

“Deploying these robotic machines can be a helpful solution to do away with manual intervention,” said Singh.

The commissioner said that they are in talks with a private group to fund this project under corporate social responsibility. “We have proposed the firm to bear 90 per cent cost of this project and remaining 10 per cent would be borne by IMC,” he said.

This robotic machine, estimated cost of which is around Rs30lakh, collects, lifts and shifts waste from a manhole, doing away with the need of manual intervention in cleaning of sewer lines and blockages in manholes.

Officials associated with the firm said that this robotic de-silting machine is equipped with four CCTVs to monitor cleaning work.

It comes with two units including a stationary unit attached with a user interface at the top and a robotic device at the bottom that goes inside manhole and performs the cleaning work. “The entire operation can be controlled and monitored from control panel, and the operator does not have to go inside the manhole,” said Rashid K, an official with the firm while speaking to TOI.

“This machine can also detect toxic gases like hydrogen sulfide, ammonia, methane, sulfur dioxide for safety of the operator,” he added.

There are over 1.77 lakh manholes in city that are maintained by IMC.

Title: Advocates boycott work following Bar Council’s call
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: On a call given by the Bar Council of Uttar Pradesh, lawyers belonging to Allahabad High Court and other courts abstained from judicial work on Thursday. The Council had given the call in protest against the recent attacks and murder of lawyers in the state.

Earlier, on January 12, the Council had passed a resolution condemning these attacks and murder of lawyers. The Council had asked the Bar associations throughout the state to protest against killings of lawyers by abstaining from work on Thursday.

Subsequently, on January 13, office-bearers of High Court Bar Association (HCBA), Allahabad in its meeting unanimously decided to abstained from judicial work on Thursday and asked for implementation of laws for security of lawyers in Uttar Pradesh.

President of HCBA, Rakesh Pande, condemned recent attacks on lawyers in the state, terming the incidents as “disappointing and condemnable”. The state government must seriously consider passing of appropriate laws to ensure the security of lawyers in Uttar Pradesh, he said.

Apart from HCBA, other Bar associations of various districts and tribunals also abstained from judicial work on Thursday on a call given by the Council.

Title: Kerala CM answerable, say Shuhaib and Fazal
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Thwaha Fazal and Allan Shuhaib, who were arrested for alleged Maoist links, being brought to produce before th... Read More

KOCHI: Allan Shuhaib and Thwaha Fazal , the youths from Kozhikode who were arrested for alleged Maoist links, were produced at NIA court in Kochi on Thursday and remanded in judicial custody.

The duo told reporters at the court premises that they were not Maoists but active CPM workers and demanded chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan to present evidence for their alleged link with Maoist groups.

The youths were arrested under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) on November 1, 2019.

“We are members of the CPM. We are not Maoists. We used to campaign for the party, seeking votes. We were booth agents during the last election. The chief minister should reveal where we had planted the bombs or who we killed,” Alan and Thwaha shouted at reporters while coming out from the NIA court.

The case pertains to the Kerala police registering a case against three youths who were found under suspicious circumstances in the Peruman Perummal area of Kozhikode around 6.45pm on November 1. One among them ran away when police approached them. Police later claimed that they recovered posters and leaflets having links with Maoist groups from the accused persons.

NIA re-registered the FIR and took over the probe on December 18, 2019. It was re-registered under Section 20 (any person who is a member of a terrorist gang or a terrorist organisation), Section 38 (offence related to membership of a terrorist organisation) and Section 39 (offence related to support given to a terrorist organisation) of UAPA.

On Thursday, they were brought from the jail in Kozhikode where they had been lodged since their arrest and produced before the NIA court in Kochi.

Meanwhile, NIA filed a petition seeking seven days of custody of the accused persons from January 20 onwards which was opposed by the counsels for both the accused. The court which decided to hear of custody petition and the objection raised by counsels of accused on Friday, remanded the accused to the high-security prison in Thrissur.

Thwaha filed a petition seeking dental treatment, including permission to undergo a root-canal procedure.

NIA prosecutor submitted before the court that the treatment should be provided in the presence of a police officer and the court ordered to provide the necessary treatment at Thrissur Medical College.

Title: Nagpur: Pardi flyover may miss even extended deadline
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

NAGPUR: Work on the project started in May 2016 and many works are still incomplete. Mayor Sandip Joshi , who held a meeting to review its progress on Thursday, said people were troubled by the chaotic traffic and increasing accidents at the site. The meeting was convened following a request from east Nagpur MLA Krishna Khopde.

Khopde, deputy mayor Manisha Kothe, municipal commissioner Abhijit Bangar, corporators Abhay Gotekar, Rajkumar Solekar, NHAI’s deputy general manager Samay Nikose were among those present.

Municipal commissioner too expressed concern over slow progress of work. He pointed out NMC had completed the land acquisition and had extended all support for expediting the work. He said NHAI had done nothing for flyover’s speedy completion. It had not even penalized the contractor carrying out the work, Bangar said.

Nikose responded that the NHAI had set new extended March 2020 deadline for the contractor to complete the work. Bangar asked how would the work be done in two months given its current status.

Even construction of roads beneath the flyover was going on at a snail’s pace, Solekar told TOI. He drew attention towards incomplete road work between HB Estate and Octroi naka on Pardi road. As a result, many accidents happen there, he said. Joshi told TOI that an extended meeting with all concerned officials from NHAI, NMC and traffic police on Pardi flyover construction will be convened soon.

Meanwhile, NMC’s electricity department is framing a policy to curb the menace of TV cables criss-crossing the streets and being fastened to street lights. Deputy mayor Kothe on Thursday held a meeting and directed NMC’s legal and electrical departments to frame a policy that should restrict cable operators from misusing street light poles. Kothe also directed the electrical department to hold a meeting of cable operators in the city to end the menace.

Title: NMC wants pet lovers to keep only two canines
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Rotary Bangalore IT corridor organizers of Pet-a-thon , Dog lovers participate with their pets at Cubbon Park ... Read More

NAGPUR: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) is bringing in a policy wherein a pet lover cannot keep more than two dogs, said mayor Sandip Joshi.

He was replying to the residents of Vijay Cooperative Housing Society, Sonegaon, who told him how a resident was feeding almost 15 dogs at her house in their locality. The residents were speaking to him during the first day of mayor’s Janta Darbar that kicked off from Laxmi Nagar zone.

Joshi’s first Janta Darbar received more than 60 complaints. He directed assistant municipal commissioner (Laxmi Nagar zone) Raju Bhivgade to address all grievances at the earliest. Most of the complaints pertained to irregular sweeping of roads, choking of sewer lines, encroachments, bad roads, stray cattle and dog menace etc.

Residents told the mayor that they cannot venture out any time during the day due to stray dog menace. Despite complaints to the NMC’s veterinary department and even to local corporator Lahukumar Baheti, no action was taken. “Now, a woman feeds almost 15 stray dogs and they chase every resident in the locality,” they claimed.

Joshi told them that the NMC is framing a policy which will restrict any pet lover not to keep more than two dogs. He said soon, a proposal in this regard will be tabled before the general body meeting and will be implemented.

Bajaj Nagar residents also pointed out about dog excrement on pavements, especially in front of entrance gates of many houses and public grounds and parks. They also stressed the need to restart penalizing dog owners who fail to clean the poop of their canines. Residents also expressed concern over cattle straying in playground and roads.

Despite the mandatory rule of having dog licence by paying just Rs200 per annum, only 121 citizens have licences to keep canines. The NMC even used to penalize pet owners for dog excrement on pavements or roads. But due to casual approach of the NMC’s veterinary department, the move is not being implemented.

Venkatesh Nagar residents exposed NMC’s failure to address accumulation of water and garbage in Sanchayani premises near Khamla Square. “Despite high court’s directive and contempt, the NMC has done nothing,” said Satish Vaidya, a resident of Venkatesh Nagar, adding that the entire premises has become a breeding ground for mosquitoes due to accumulation of water and garbage.

Joshi said the NMC had prepared an estimate to fill the basement and ground floor of the building. For the purpose, it needed around Rs 3.50 crore. “So, we have decided to fill it with the help of public participation,” he said.

To a complaint from residents, Joshi threatened MSEDCL’s Congress Nagar division to sit on a hunger strike in front of their office if they failed to cover meter board at Rambagh Complex Apartment Association in Ramkrishna Nagar, Khamla. January 24 is the deadline to address the issue, he said.

Devakar Varshe, a resident of Sneh Nagar, pointed out about the substandard work while constructing community hall in a playground in their locality. “Constructed a couple of years ago with funds sanctioned by former CM Devendra Fadnavis, walls and ceiling of the hall developed cracks,” he claimed. Joshi asked Bhivgade to visit the spot and submit a report.

Title: Congress suspends MLA Danavelu for anti-party activities
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

PUDUCHERRY: Puducherry Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) has suspended MLA N Danavelu from the party for anti-party activities, PPCC president A Namassivayam said. Danavelu had levelled corruption charges against chief minister V Narayanasamy, his son and health minister Malladi Krishna Rao.

Speaking to reporters in the presence of Narayanasamy at the party office on Thursday, Namassivayam said the local unit brought the anti-party activities of Danavelu to the notice of All India Congress Committee, which issued an instruction to suspend anyone including ministers or elected members or party cadres indulging in anti-party activities.

“We have suspended MLA Danavelu from the party based on the instructions of the AICC. We will issue a show-cause notice to him seeking his explanation within seven days. A disciplinary committee formed by the party high command will take a final call after reviewing the reply furnished by Danavelu,” Namassivayam said.

Namassivayam pointed out that Narayanasamy and Congress leaders reached out to Danavelu on several occasions to discuss the issues raised by him. “Chief minister invited him and held discussions on several occasions. But he continues to indulge in anti-party activities. He is not participating in the party affairs for the past two and half years. He does not respond to phone calls or letters from the party office. The issues concerning the party must be discussed within the party, but he went to the media making wild allegations,” said PPCC president.

Namassivayam accused Danavelu of approaching an independent MLA from Mahe and attempting to broker a deal to topple the Congress government with the help of opposition parties. He said the opposition All India NR Congress (AINRC) and the BJP have been instigating Danavelu to act against the Congress government.

Danavelu told media that neither PPCC president nor the chief minister can suspend him from the party.

"Puducherry Congress leaders do not have the right to initiate disciplinary action against me. Only Sonia Gandhi or Rahu Gandhi can initiate action against me. I have raised serious corruption charges but neither the chief minister nor the ministers invited me for any discussion. Chief minister and ministers deny the charges and claim that the charges are false. They are wrong. They are attempting to misguide. I will expose their corrupt practices," said Danavelu.

Meanwhile, AIADMK legislative party leader A Anbalagan demanded the Congress government to convene the assembly to prove its majority in the House by holding trust vote. He insisted Narayanasamy take moral responsibility after he and his son were charged with corrupt practices by an elected member and resign.

In the 30-member assembly, the ruling Congress has 14 (after the suspension of Danavelu) The party has the support of its ally DMK (three) and an independent candidate. On the opposition side, AINRC has seven and AIADMK four. There are three BJP leaders nominated as members to the legislative assembly.

Title: Gujarat: 50 drones to aid wild ass count
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

AHMEDABAD: More than 50 drones will keep an eye on the wild ass population in the state. After a successful experiment, the forest department has decided to use the technology for the Wild Ass census next month.

The wild ass census will cover an area of more than 5,500 sq km, including 4,000 sq km of the Little Rann of Kutch. The census will be cover Kutch, Patan, Morbi, Banaskantha, Surendranagar and Ahmedabad districts.

The December 2014 census had returned a count of 4,451 animals, a 413 increase from 2009, when 4,038 wild asses had been counted.

Senior officials in Gandhinagar said the department decided to carry out an experiment and a drone was sent into the Little Rann of Kutch.

On spotting a herd of wild ass, the drone was lowered to about 100m. “We realised that there were four such groups in various fields and the drone was further lowered for a clear picture. At a height of 50m, we noticed movement and could a call to all the animals then flocked to the main held. Finally, all the 99 wild asses grouped together. Officials in the field took several videos and still photographs. It emerged that all the animals could easily be counted using such photographs.”

“After this experiment, the department decided to use drones for the census this year, especially in areas unreachable by humans,” said principal chief conservator of forests (wildlife) Shyamal Tikadar. Another forest official said the census will employ two methods, the first will be drones and the second the conventional method, where wildlife experts will count wild asses.

The first census of wild asses was conducted in 1940, when 3,500 wild asses were found. By 1960, this figure fell to just 362. The species was then classified as ‘highly endangered’. In 1973 and 1976, the Rann of Kutch and adjoining districts were taken up as the area for conservation of the wild ass. He said the forest department began conducting the census since 1976.

The census will adopt the block counting method. About 20 zones and 100-odd sub-zones will be formed in an area covering the entire wild ass range.
