PSI Chavda of 2017 batch had been deputed at the bus depot police chowky for the past six months. Chavda was immediately detained in A-division police station and the revolver was sent for forensic examination.

“In his statement, Chavda claimed that his revolver went off accidentally while he was cleaning it. The bullet pierced through Gohel’s right eye and went through his skull and got lodged in the window of the police station,” said N K Jadeja, inspector with Rajkot A division police station. “Chavda has been suspended and booked for culpable homicide, not amounting to murder,” added Jadeja.

Meanwhile, Gohel’s family members refused to claim his body, demanding Chavda to be booked for murder. After assurance from the police that stern action would be taken against the cop, Gohel’s family members accepted his body.

Gohel, who lived in Vrundavan Society on Ankurnagar Main Road, ran a spa in Malaviyanagar Chowk.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Police constable found hanging from tree in Shamli
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: A UP police constable, who joined the state police force nine years ago, allegedly committed suicide late night on Wednesday in Shamli district. His body was found hanging from a tree in Shamli’s Police Lines by another on-duty constable.

The deceased constable – Harendra – allegedly committed suicide over a family discord. However, a probe has been set up and the reason behind his death is being investigated. When informed, his Meerut-based family went into a state of shock.

According to sources, a security guard patrolling Police Lines late night on Wednesday, found the body hanging from a tree. He alerted his superiors, who rushed to the spot and sent the body for postmortem, after identifying him as constable Harendra of village Laluhera in Meerut, and posted in Shamli district.

According to Shamli SP Veenit Jaiswal, “Based on information we have received, he was taken to the district hospital where he was declared brought dead. His family was informed and his body sent for postmortem.” He added, “It appears that a family dispute was behind the suicide.”

In a similar incident in September 2018, the body of woman constable Anita Singh (25) was found hanging from the ceiling fan of her house in Muzaffarnagar. Police sources said Anita was posted in the City Kotwali police station and was living in a rented house in Saket Colony.

Title: Coimbatore: Farmers worried over water release to Uppar Dam from Parambikulam Aliyar Project
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Farmers in the first zone of irrigation of Parambikulam Aliyar Project fear that the move would eat into their... Read More

COIMBATORE: Farmers in the first zone of irrigation of Parambikulam Aliyar Project (PAP), which includes Coimbatore and Tirupur, have raised concerns as water meant for the region has been opened for Uppar Dam . This would result in insufficient water for crops in their zone, they said.

Farmers from the first zone said they have sown crops such as groundnut and shallots which were now ready to receive water. At this juncture, the state, which had promised four rounds of water to be released for the first zone, has now released water to Uppar Dam, they said. This would eat into their share of water, farmers said.

S Paramasivam, a representative of Tamil Nadu Farmers Association from Tirupur, said around 1lakh acres of land have been cultivated in the first zone. This includes areas such as Pollachi, Kinathukkadavu, Udumalapet, Madathukkulam, Kangeyam and Palladam. Around 25,000 farmers, most of whom are small and marginal, cultivate in this region, he said.

“Groundnut has been sown. Shallots have sprouted. At this juncture the state has let water to Uppar Dam. This would mean there would be no sufficient water for this region,” he said.

Paramasivam said there was enough water only for the first PAP zone and the state had announced four rounds of water would be opened from January 27. “They had said only surplus water would be given to Uppar Dam. But now they are giving them water meant for this region,” he said.

When contacted, a senior official attached to the Parambikulam Aliyar Project said they had given water to Uppar Dam after farmers from that region had represented to the state. They have so far been given around 210mcft of water to Uppar Dam. “Farmers in PAP zone one would be given 7,600mcft water as announced. They would get sufficient water,” the official added.

While the farmers had called for a protest on Friday at the Pollachi PAP office, the water opened from Tirumoorthy Dam to Uppar Dam was stopped on Thursday evening. So the farmers said they have called off the protest.

Title: ‘Statutory inquiry will reveal reason behind the accident’
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

East Coast Railways spokesperson Jyoti Prakash Mishra talks to Ashok Pradhan about Thursday’s accident and more .

n What caused the train to derail?

An inquiry has been ordered. The Commissioner of Railway Safety will probe into it. The inquiry will start on Saturday. Any member of public who has any information relating to the accident can share the details with the inquiry authorities. The Commissioner of Railway Safety is an autonomous organization under the administrative control of the ministry of civil aviation.

n Any preliminary findings given that it’s a case of a running train hitting a stationary train?

The statutory inquiry will unravel the exact reasons. But as immediate response, pending the inquiry, the Indian Railways suspended four personnel: the train driver, assistant driver, the station master of Nergundi besides the goods train guard. This move is meant to ensure free and fair inquiry and fixing of responsibility. The probe will find answer to all questions. It would be improper to jump into any conclusion before that.

n What is the extent of damage and train services affected?

Eight coaches and the engine were derailed. The injured were immediately shifted to SCB Medical College and Hospital. Locals played good Samaritans in reaching out to the affected people and in shifting them. Five trains were diverted. Repair of the damaged track was done on a war-footing. The running of trains has normalised on the route.

n The latest incident seems recurrence of a similar mishap on Sept 29, 2016 near Cuttack?

Every accident has its own reasons. It would be unfair to compare any two incidents. In 2016, a passenger train (Bhubaneswar-Bhadrak DMU) had hit a stationary goods train near Cuttack. That incident took place around 4 pm. This incident has happened in the morning.

n Are you indicating at the visibility problem due to fog this time?

I am not indicating to anything. Only thing is, two incidents can’t be compared. Let the probe find it out. I can’t either indicate or ignore anything. That’s not possible without proper inquiry by the appropriate authorities.

n Of late, there seems to too many incidents within East Coast Railway area starting with a major mishap on January 22, 2017 near Rayagada...

The year 2019 was largely incident free. There was an incident of burning of some train coaches (Puri-Hatia Tapaswni Express) in Puri station in March last year when the train was empty. It was the handiwork of miscreants, not an accident. A robust safety drive is in force. We will further revisit and strengthen wherever there is scope. Safety is of paramount importance to the railways. For every single incident, small or big, responsibility is fixed, caused identified and corrective measures taken.

n There are also many incidents of fire in premium trains. Can you tell us about the precautions undertaken?

There were some cases of fire, not just in ECoR but in other parts. After technical inputs regarding the same, it has been corrected. There is no fire incident in recent months. The railways is alert.

Title: Cesu suspends power supply to 1545 consumers
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhubaneswar: On the first day of its power supply suspension drive, the Central Electricity Supply Utility ( Cesu ) on Thursday snapped connection to 1,545 consumers. It also collected arrears of Rs 5.38 crore from around 14,000 consumers.

According to its announcement, the company started the drive against defaulting commercial establishments in the morning in its 247 sections under 20 distribution divisions. Around 13,411 commercial consumers were covered by 533 special disconnection squads, said a Cesu source.

“This does not include online payments which will be known on Friday. We have also received complaints from around 3,971 consumers on bill revision. As many as 2,346 consumers have availed instalment facilities for paying arrears,” said Cesu CEO Arun Bothra in a press statement.

He said the company has advised all its field units to keep the collection counters open from early morning to late evening for allowing the consumers to pay their arrears. Commercial consumers of Saheed Nagar and Baramunda have cleared their arrears in full on the first day of drive itself, he added.

Bothra said Cesu has decided to conduct its disconnection drive in a phased manner. The company will target defaulting commercial and high value customers only in the first phase. “The second phase of disconnection drive will focus on affluent and high value domestic consumers keeping in view huge outstanding arrears. In the third phase, all other consumers will be covered. It will specially focus on consumers who have not paid electricity dues for years together,” he added.

People in Dhenkanal district opposed the move of the Cesu. The locals said the company should not take this extreme step when the students are preparing for their upcoming examinations. Some villagers of Gurujang in Khurda district had argued with the Cesu officials while the electricians were trying to disconnect electricity supply to a betel shop. “The shop has arrears of Rs 21,000. The owner has given this shop to me to run. The company had given notice four days ago and snapped the power supply today,” said Susant Das, the shopkeeper.

Title: Red sanders worth Rs 5cr seized from Mundra port
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Seized logs that were concealed in sanitaryware consignment

Ahmedabad: A team from Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI), Gujarat zonal unit seized red sanders logs weighing 9.64 tonnes, worth approximately Rs 4.82 crore from a trailer marked for export as sanitaryware products, from Mundra port in Kutch , DRI officials said on Thursday.

“The consignment was marked as ‘sanitaryware’ and having its origin from Morbi. Upon search of the container, still loaded on a trailer, it was found that there were 160 pieces of sanitaryware along with the logs of red sanders. The trailer, container and sanitaryware have also been seized on Tuesday along with the logs,” said a DRI official.

The officials added that one person was apprehended in connection with the seizure but refused to divulge name of the suspect. “All we can mention is, the person has been apprehended earlier in similar cases where his modus operandi was the same. He would export red sanders illegally from Mundra port using forged identities each time,” said an official.

DRI officials said that red sanders, locally known as rakta chandan is a species protected under Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of wild fauna and flora (CITES), 1973, and Wild life (Protection) Act, 1972.

“Red sanders are in huge demand in east Asian nations including China and Japan due to the wood’s cultural importance — it’s used for making furniture, musical instruments and medicines. It’s considered auspicious by many and is also used to make luxury goods. Districts in Andhra Pradesh including Cuddapah, Chittoor, Anantapur, Kurnool, Prakasam and Nellore,” said an investigator. “It’s generally smuggled through air route where it first reaches Singapore, Malaysia or Dubai from where it’s re-routed to China or Japan.”

Officials said that further probe to identify the supply channel and source of red sanders is on.

Title: Sikh bizman, wife fear for safety
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The wife of city-based businessman Parvinder Pal Singh, who was assaulted by local youths in Laxmisagar area, alleged that some people visited their house late on Wednesday night, leaving them scared. The visitors included Bhubaneswar Central MLA Ananta Narayan Jena and Khurda deputy superintendent of police (DSP) Anup Kanungo among others. Ananta, however, said he went to the house to express solidarity with the family and to give them assurance about their safety.

“It was about 1.30 am. We were sleeping. Suddenly there was loud banging on the door. We got so scared we did not open the door. They kept on banging for a long time,” said Kamaljit, wife of Parvinder. “If they had come to show their sympathy they could have come in the evening. What was the point of coming after midnight?” she asked. At the time of the incident the couple were there along with their three children.

She said the people again visited their house on Wednesday morning and said they are with the family. “We came to know that those who assaulted my husband got bail on Wednesday night. How can we trust them?” she asked.

Parvinder also expressed surprise as the accused got bail so easily. “I was assaulted in front of the police. They hit me with a big stone. I am alive today by god’s grace. It was a clear case of attempt to murder. We feel there is no justice in this land,” Parvinder said.

Dubbing his visit as a courtesy call, the Bhubaneswar Central legislator said, “It was a courtesy call as he is a resident of my constituency and it is my duty to stand with the family in difficult time.”

The incident took a political turn when opposition Congress and BJP criticised the state government and the police for favouring the accused. BJP leader Jagannath Pradhan lodged a complaint at Laxmisagar police station against the MLA and the DSP, alleging that both visited Parvinder’s house late on Wednesday night to threaten the family.

Title: Forces that are for Goa must unite against BJP in ZP polls says GFP
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Panaji: With the Zilla Panchayat elections being announced, Goa Forward Party called for all anti-BJP forces, including the Congress party to unite and take on the BJP in the state. While publicly reaching out to the Congress party, GFP president Vijai Sardesai said that the party’s leadership would meet and chalk out the strategy for the ZP polls, which will be fought on party lines.

“We will meet tomorrow and take a proper decision. I am talking about not dividing the anti-BJP vote. We have to do business with the Congress,” said Sardesai. He was speaking at the inauguration of the Dr. Jack de Sequeira square at Merces junction.

GFP had recently joined hands with the Congress, MGP and independent MLA Rohan Khaunte while moving an adjournment motion calling for a discussion on diversion of water from river Mhadei in the state legislative assembly. This is the second overture being made by GFP towards the Congress even through the former remains a member of the NDA alliance at the Centre.

Congress party said that it would be happy to align with a trusted partner which have not joined hands with BJP. “We want a trusted alliance. We do not want to align with anyone who in interested in opportunistic politics, those who have not helped BJP to come to power,” said state Congress president Girish Chodankar.

Chodankar made it clear that the door remained closed for GFP at this moment, the exact opposite of what Sardesai wants.

“Most Goans want the opposition to be united. We are not going to be cannibalistic by creating confusion and allowing the BJP to win. Everybody who is opposed to this anti-people government should be brought under one umbrella but the responsibility for this lies with the Congress because it is the principal opposition party,” Sardesai said.

GFP appears to be in two minds about contesting the ZP elections on party lines with party insiders still worried about a backlash from voters. GFP, which won three seats in the 2017 state assembly elections on an anti-BJP plank, quickly chose to support the BJP government, a move seen as betrayal by many of the voters.

“Politicization of the local self-government bodies should be avoided, but the question is whether this view still stands,” said Sardesai when asked whether the party was keen on contesting the ZP elections on party lines.

Title: Man shot at by members of sand mafia
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Rajkot: Suspecting him to be an government informer , some persons involved in illegal sand mining opened fire at a man in Thala village of Dhrangadhra taluka in Surendranagar district on Wednesday evening. According to police, Hitubha Zala received a bullet injury in his arm.

“Zala had purportedly informed the state mines and minerals department about a dumper loaded with illegally excavated sand, leading to its seizure on Wednesday,” said an official from Dhrangadhra police station.

The official said that illegal excavation of sand is rampant from the riverbed of Falku which flows through Thala village. “We have booked unidentified assailants for the crime,” the official added.

Title: CM’s annual discretionary fund gets Rs 150 crore hike
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhopal: State cabinet on Thursday increased the chief minister’s annual discretionary fund to Rs150 crore from the existing Rs 100 crore. Council of ministers met at the state assembly building on Thursday morning and took several important decisions under the leadership of chief minister Kamal Nath.

The CM discretionary fund has been increased with retrospective effect from the financial year of 2017-18.

Th state cabinet also discussed the SC/ST reservation Bill that has been passed by the Lok Sabha and the Rajya Sabha and is to be ratified by the MP Assembly. The two-day special session of state assembly began on Thursday and the cabinet discussed the Bill and decided it should be passed without any hitch.

In another decision, cabinet approved setting-up of an Urban Development Institute in Bhopal. The institute will address all aspects of urban development and impart knowledge and training for experts in the field.

Cabinet also gave nod to continue with the Chief Minister’s Urban Infrastructure Development Scheme. To implement the third phase under the scheme, cabinet sanctioned Rs 536 crore through the next four years. Urban civic bodies will be given 20% grant while remaining 80% will be financed through loans. Madhya Pradesh Urban Development Company will acquire loans from various financial, government, nationalized-scheduled-private banks and HUDCO and give it to the urban civic bodies.

Government decided that a cabinet committee will act on the recommendations of the inquiry committee set-up after the firing incident in Bhind district in January 6, 2012.

Council of ministers approved setting-up of a 300 to 400 bedded civil hospital in Balaghat and Bhind, 100-bedded hospital in Khajrana in Indore city and Nayagaon in Jabalpur. A 30-bedded community health centre has been approved for Nsalkheda, Susner, Badnawar, Sardarpur and Harai. The 50-bedded civil hospital of Sonkatch will be upgraded. Cabinet also approved 470 posts and construction of infrastructures for health services in urban areas.

In yet another decision, council of ministers approved 1156 posts for 116 urban primary health centres and four urban community health centres proposed under the national health mission.

Besides, cabinet also agreed on construction and maintenance of 12 roads under PPP model. Government fixed transport permit fee at Rs 57 per ton for minerals including limestone, dolomite, fireclay, manganese, copper, rock phosphate and Rs 33 per cubic metre as transport fee for granite, marble and gravel.

Briefing reporters law minister PC Sharma said the cabinet also discussed the loss to beetle crops by the unprecedented winter and hailstorm in the state and said the farmers would be compensated for lossess if any.

Title: Sena MP takes back ‘Indira met don Lala’ remark after row
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

MUMBAI: With an angry Congress exerting pressure, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday withdrew his statements made a day before that former PM Indira Gandhi had met gangster Karim Lala at Pydhonie.

“I am taking back my words if someone feels hurt by my statements,” the Sena MP told media on Thursday after Congress ministers Balasaheb Thorat and Ashok Chavan lashed out. “Raut should avoid making such irresponsible and irrelevant statements and respect our leaders… We have spoken to the CM,” said Thorat. Going a step further, Chavan said his party is “ready to pay whatever price required”, but will not tolerate comments against the late PM.

Later, Sena scion Aaditya Thackeray sought to put a lid on the row, saying Sena founder Bal Thackeray had immense respect for Indira Gandhi and Raut’s statement was taken out of context.

Title: Western Maha on edge over Sena MP Raut’s comments
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

CLEARED SKHER

Kolhapur: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut ’s demand that Udayanraje Bhosale should provide evidence of being a descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj evoked sharp reactions in parts of western Maharashtra; with Satara observing total bandh on Thursday.

Satara city wore a deserted look with markets, shops, educational institutions staying closed for the day. Heavy police bandobast was seen at all entry points of Satara and in the city. The bandh crippled daily life in Satara as all transport activities, petrol pumps and shops remaining closed.

Supporters of former MP Udayanraje Bhosale, who is the 13th descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, moved around the city. BJP workers gathered at Moti chowk in the morning. They carried placards slamming Raut and NCP legislator Jitendra Avhad and demanded unconditional apology from them.

BJP activists and supporters of Udayanraje also held demonstrations in Sangli, Solapur and Ahmednagar districts.

In the meantime, Sambhaji Bhide of Shivpratishthan Hindustan has given a call for a bandh in Sangli on Friday. Talking to the media, Bhide condemned Raut and urged chief minister Uddhav Thackeray to take action against him.

Bhide warned that similar bandh would be observed all over Maharashtra if action is not taken against Raut and he does not withdraw his statement.

BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam has demanded registration of offence against Raut. In a letter to the home minister, Kadam has said that Raut’s statement has hurt sentiments of the people of Maharashtra.

Raut has also upset workers of Congress and NCP with his statements on former prime minister Indira Gandhi and deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar. Raut allegedly said Gandhi used to meet underworld don Karim Lala and described Pawar as stepney (the spare tire in a car).

NCP workers, however, were not open in their rebellion considering the current political setup. A top NCP leader said on the condition of anonymity that Raut’s remarks on Pawar were humiliating.

This is the second time that Raut has targetted Bhosale. Earlier, he had asked the descendants of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj to clarify their stand on the controversial book by a BJP member. After furore, the book has now been withdrawn.

Title: Congress hopes for revival in Kolhapur
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Kolhapur: The district has emerged as an oasis for Congress with chief minister Uddhav Thackeray finally respecting the request of local Congress functionaries to appoint minister for state for home Satej Patil guardian minister of Kolhapur .

Patil, who is also president of Kolhapur district Congress, is credited for party’s performance in the 2019 assembly elections. He was appointed president few days ahead of the assembly polls following Prakash Awade’s resignation.

Now, Congress workers believe that it was Patil’s leadership that rejuvenated the party in the district as it went on to win four seats in 2019 whereas in 2014 it has even failed to open the account.

This time around Congress emerged as the strongest party in the district with all other parties suffered defeat. Of the seven seats, Sena managed to win only one seat while BJP was unable to win a single seat. NCP managed to retain its two seats in the election.

Performance of the grand old party in Kolhapur assumes significance as it failed to improve in other western Maharashtra district, including Pune, Satara, Sangli and Solapur where it has senior functionaries like Prithviraj Chavan, Sushilkumar Shinde and Vishwajeet Kadam.

Earlier, Kolhapur district witnessed severe battle for the post of guardian minister between NCP’s Hasan Mushrif and Patil as both parties were looking for expanding their party base.

Sources in Congress said that Patil’s appointment is significant in view of the election to Kolhapur Municipal Corporation later this year.

Title: ACB books man for false complaint
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Kolhapur: The anti-corruption bureau ( ACB ) booked a man for allegedly registering a false complaint against a forest official stating that he had demanded Rs 2,000 from complainant.

Adinath Budhwant, deputy superintendent of police, ACB, Kolhapur , said, “The complainant had on September 12, 2019, lodged an online complaint with the forest department stating that the trees are being cut illegally in the forest area of Bandiwade village in Panhala taluka. On September 18, 2019, he lodged a complaint with the ACB stating that the forest official on duty had demanded bribe of Rs 2,000 for taking action on his complaint.”

The police said that they sent a government panch with the complainant to meet the forest official at a hotel in Panhala. The voice recorded during the meeting confirmed that someone demanded bribe from him. “Based on this, we set up a trap and the complainant met the forest official and gave him Rs 1,000. However, he did not accept the money and returned it. We immediately rushed to the spot and nabbed the forest official. However, during investigation, we found that the voice recorded in hotel was different than the voice of the forest official. When we checked the CCTV footage of hotel, we found the complainant met his friend and not the forest official,” the officer said.

Title: Safety audit of 45 major bridges in final phase: PWD
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Kolhapur: Safety audit of 45 major bridges that were submerged during the recent floods in Kolhapur and Sangli districts is in the final stage and a report will soon be submitted to the government.

Almost all major and minor bridges — including those on Pune-Bangalore National Highway, Kolhapur-Ratnagiri Road, Kolhapur-Sangli Road, Kolhapur-Gaganbawada and Kolhapur-Radhanagari road — were submerged in floodwater last year.

There are 479 bridges in Kolhapur district while in Sangli the number is 452. The bridges have been built over Panchganga and Warna rivers. After floodwater receded, a primary safety audit of was conducted and they were open for traffic after confirming that they are safe.

According to a public works department (PWD) official, the department did not have adequate instruments and machines to test the safety of these bridges.

“The heavy flow of water, wooden logs, branches of trees and other material that was flowing in the rivers during flood might have damaged the bridges. Thus, safety audit was a must. Apart from this, there was a possibility that the impact of landslide, rise of water level above the bridge, soil erosion during floods might have impacted the strength of the bridges” the official said.

“We then decided to conduct safety audit of major bridges from Kolhapur and Sangli district that have maximum traffic load and are important for communication. We called a team of expert teachers and students from IIT-Chennai and requested them to conduct the safety audit of 45 bridges using standard equipment,” he added.

The audit is in the final phase now. “The team is now checking the strength of the bridges using ROV (Remotely Operated Vehicle), laser beams, video cameras and other instruments. The team will submit us report in details after completing the work,” the official said.

“Based on the report we will take up the repair work of the damaged part of the bridges if any is found during the audit. We will implement all suggestions that the team will make in its report,” he said.

BOX

Type of bridges Kolhapur & Sangli

Long bridges 4 1

Large bridges 53 64

Small bridges 422 387

Title: Kolhapur: 14 held for trespassing forest
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The forest department has arrested 14 people for allegedly trespassing the forest area near Desaiwadi village on Chandgad-Jambre road in Chandgad taluka of Kolhapur district. They have been booked under several sections of Wildlife Protection Act, 1972.

“We had come to know that hunting activities pick up during the winter season. We had also received information that there is trend in some villages of hunting on or after Sankranti festival. We had increased patrolling in the forest area during Sankranti festival,” said a forest official.

A team of the forest officials patrolling on Chandgad-Jambre road spotted a vehicle suspiciously halting at Desaiwadi village on the night of January 14. When the team asked the 14 occupants to step out, the team found 14 dogs and spears. They allegedly confessed that they were planning to enter the forest area for hunting.

“We arrested them on the spot and seized the material they were carrying with them for hunting. We are checking if they were involved in any other hunting cases,” he said.

Title: You build Ambedkar statue but ignore sick and poor: Bombay high court
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bombay high court

MUMBAI: Referring to the plight of patients at the twin Wadia hospitals in Parel due to freeze of grants, the Bombay high court on Thursday slammed the state government, saying it has money to build Dr B R Ambedkar’s statue, but not to spend on the poor and middle class who cannot afford treatment at ‘star’ hospitals.

The comment came a day after the state cabinet raised the cost of the Ambedkar memorial project at Dadar’s Indu Mills by Rs 300 crore, taking it to Rs 1,070 crore, to account for a 100ft increase in the icon’s statue. “For that (statue), money is there, but the same people Ambedkar represented all his life can die. They need medical aid or statues?” asked the bench of Justices Satyaranjan Dharmadhikari and Riyaz Chagla while hearing a public interest litigation to release grants by the state and BMC to the Nowrosjee Wadia Maternity Hospital and Bai Jerbai Wadia Hospital for Children. While the state and BMC share 50% of the grant to the maternity hospital, BMC funds 85% of the grant to the children’s hospital.

Advocate Girish Godbole, for the state government, said the finance department has sanctioned Rs 24 crore from the contingent fund and it will be given in lumpsum within three weeks.

“This is an eyewash. This, to materialize, will take months. Tomorrow this amount should be released,” said Justice Dharmadhikari, adding that otherwise, right from the state chief secretary to the deputy secretary, “we will parade them here (in court). You want that?”

Godbole also said the government will scrutinise if the maternity hospital’s other claims are genuine and added that in “the administration some are drawing salary from the two establishments”. He also said “amounts claimed are inflated”. The judges questioned what officials of the public health department, when it was part of the trust, were doing. Senior advocate Rafiq Dada, for the hospitals, said all accounts are audited. “They (officials) used to come to meet you (Wadia) for a cup of tea,” said Justice Dharmadhikari.

Dada said salaries are not paid. He said there are 300 critical beds and a total of 800 beds in both hospitals. “Critical patients are not being admitted. It is very distressing.” The judges said they thought that “when there are new faces as political bosses, all this would stop”. They said non-release of grants led to the trustees taking measures to refuse admissions and discharge patients. “This is disgusting. Why should anybody who is not part of the dispute suffer? In the commercial capital, (the) poor strata of society is refused admission at a charitable hospital in which the state is a partner,” Justice Dharmadhikari said.

The judges then observed that the government is competing to build a statue of Ambedkar which is taller that of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel. They questioned if by looking at the statues, hunger, physical ailments and other miseries would be removed. They didn’t spare CM Uddhav Thackeray, who on Wednesday launched the first girder of the Mumbai Trans-Harbour Link. “You have time to inaugurate schemes…time to go and inaugurate a bridge which is yet to be built. We are thankful to the CM for finding time to meet them (all stakeholders),” Justice Dharmadhikari said, also asking whether the court should acknowledge it in the order.

The judges said that in Uttar Pradesh, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat, there are reports of children being underfed and dying. “This should be the scenario in Maharashtra? That too in the commercial capital of India?” Justice Dharmadhikari asked.

BMC’s advocate Suresh Pakale said its balance payment is over Rs 14 crore towards the children’s hospital, and it will release it. But Dada said the BMC owes it “more than Rs 100 crore.” On Friday, the state government will inform when the amount will be disbursed. “Common man you can take for a ride. Not us,” said Justice Dharmadhikari.

Title: Kolhapur: Man gets life term for killing friend
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The district and sessions court convicted a 30-year-old man for killing his friend in July 2015.

The court, presided over by district and sessions judge-4 PM Nagalkar, sentenced the convict — identified as Rohan Baburao Katale, a resident of Mohite colony, Kolhapur — sent him to life imprisonment under section 302 of the Indian Penal Code.

According to prosecution, in July 2015, the victim — Abhijeet Baburao Rawal (25), a resident of Gangavesh — had helped Katale to get job a cook’s job in a city-based hotel.

After joining, Katale borrowed Rs 7,000 from one of Rawal’s friend and went missing. Rawal’s friends after finding Katale, brought him to Rawal on July 7, 2015. When Rawal asked Katale about the money, the latter hit the former on his head with a wooden stick and fled the spot.

Rawal was taken to Chhatrapati Pramila Raje (CPR) civil hospital where hospital authorities declared him brought dead. A case was registered against Katale with Laxmipuri police station.

“A total of 18 witnesses were examined and based on the available evidence and statements the court awarded life sentence to Katale. The court also slapped a fine of Rs 5,000 and simple imprisonment of six months if he fails to pay the fine,” public prosecutor Manjusha Patil said.

Title: Ganjam admin to help boy suffering from rare skin disease
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Berhampur: The Ganjam district administration has stepped in for treatment to a 10-year-old boy of Gothagaon in Sheragada block, 50 km from here. He is suffering from a rare skin disease from his birth.

Jagannath, son of Prabhakar Pradhan, a farmer, has dry and dark patches in the skin. He is dubbed as ‘human snake’ as his skin is full of scales. The skin disorder, ichthyosis, is a genetic disease, said a doctor.

District collector Vijay Amruta Kulange, went to his home late on Wednesday and discussed with his parents about the ailment and sanctioned Rs 10,000 from the district Red Cross fund for initial treatment. Earlier they had provided Rs 5,000.

“We have advised his parents to take him to All India Institute of Medical Science (AIIMS), Bhubaneswar, for his better treatment. A team of doctors will coordinate to refer him to AIIMS,” he said. If necessary, he will be treated in a private hospital. The expenses will be provided from the chief minister’s relief fund, he said.

Chief district medical officer (CDMO) B K Panigrahy said he is undergoing treatment in the City Hospital here and his condition is stable.

Ichthyosis is a chronic skin disease that is characterised by thick, dry and rough patches on the skin. Experts said this type of skin disease affects less than one in three lakh people. Ichthyosis is hereditary but there are also acquired forms of the disorder, said an expert.

Sushama Pradhan, mother of Jagannath, said he feels pain frequently. “We apply moisturiser, oil and other medicines four to five times a day, but in vain,” she said. He studies in Class III in a local school. “But he is reluctant to go to the school as he is booed as human snake by others,” she said.

“We got him treated in different hospitals, including MKCG Medical College and Hospital here. But the disease is yet to be cured,” said his father.

Jagannath is his youngest son while other two sons aged 12 and 14 are doing fine. His six children — two sons and four daughters — had died earlier due to the rare skin disease, family sources said. “While one of my daughters, suffering from this disease, lived four years, other five children died within a year,” said Sushama.

Title: Bengaluru: Where timepieces are a treat to watch
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

The India International Watch and Clock Fair was inaugurated at Gayatri Vihar on Thursday

BENGALURU: Time, it appears, is out of the joint at India International Watch and Clock Fair under way in Bengaluru. But that is not only because the hands of thousands of clocks and watches show different hours, but also due to the mindboggling varieties on display.

From German-made grandfather clocks to smartwatches, from a watch with sparkling diamond petals resembling a flower to chameleon-like collections, from those with British-era stamps and coins as dials to ones with pure gold dials and straps, the fair showcases over 50,000 styles and designs from over 100 brands.

The event is happening at a time when the watch industry itself is at the crossroads. With Apple, which isn’t a watch company, is leading the world in watch sales, the core companies in the sector have been discussing opportunities of growth in the new scenario.

“All answers lie in the fundamental proposition that people don’t buy products just because they are good. They buy brands they believe in. So we need to build brands, nurture and grow them... India has the capability to build every component of a watch. While cost of labour is growing in other countries, we see an opportunity to build a watch manufacturing or a global service centre,” said Johnson Verghese, managing director, Fossil India.

The four-day event kicked off at Gayatri Vihar, Palace Grounds on Thursday. It’s open from 10am to 7pm. Held every two years, the ‘festival of time’ has come back to Bengaluru for the second time after a gap of 12 years.

At Jaipur Watch Company’s stall, the most prized possessions are models that are hand-engraved. “Earlier, such engravings were seen only on swords and weapons of maharajas. When I happened to meet some artisans who could do that in Udaipur, I took their help to customise the same for watches,” said Gaurav Mehta, founder of Jaipur Watch Company. These watches take nearly four months to make.

Gaurav’s customers include celebrities and star hotels. For Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he made a customised watch with the leader’s face engraved on it. The accessory was gifted to the PM by a politician. Among Gaurav’s collections are also pure gold watches worth Rs 3.5 lakh. The most expensive one is the sparkling flower watch, which has diamond-studded petals that move like real flowers around the dial. While the watch with real diamonds cost Rs 12.5 lakh, the one on display, with American diamonds, is worth Rs 4.5 lakh.

Grandfather clocks imported from Germany and cuckoo clocks from Korea are other major attractions. “While there was a trend of returning to mechanical watches, I wanted to do the same with clocks. I decided to get into the business of grandfather clocks from German company Hermle,” said Sanjan B Hasija of Skylark Trading Co.

On display are clocks ranging from Rs 25,000-Rs 5 lakh.

Title: NDA to fight assembly polls under Bihar CM NitishKumar: Ami​t Shah
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Amit Shah

VAISHALI GARH: Union home minister Ami t Shah here on Thursday said the NDA would fight the coming assembly election in Bihar under the leadership of chief minister Nitish Kumar.

Shah’s categorical statement, made in his first public speech in the state since last year’s Lok Sabha polls, is set to put at rest speculation about who would lead the NDA in the Bihar election. This comes close on the heels of a section of BJP leaders dropping hints about a change of leadership in the NDA, despite Shah’s earlier statement projecting Nitish as the ruling alliance’s CM face.

Speaking at well-attended pro-CAA rally, first by any top BJP leader in the state, Shah said, “BJP aur JD(U) ka gathbandhan atoot hai. The NDA government at the Centre is under PM Narendra Modi, while the state is under CM Nitish Kumar ji).”

The BJP national president, in a scathing attack on RJD, said, “The era of lantern (RJD’s poll symbol) is over. Humne pradesh ko lalten yug see LED yug mein laya hai.” Without naming RJD chief Lalu Prasad, he added, “Wo jail mein sapna dekh rahen hain. Unka apna CM banane ka sapna pura nahi hoga.”

Shah was generous in his praise for Nitish and gave the CM all credit for transforming the state from “jungle raj” to “janta raj”. He said Bihar’s growth rate was a meagre 3% when it was under RJD rule. “Now in 2020, the state’s growth rate is 11%,” he added.

Shah said the NDA government in the state would now work for providing piped drinking water to every household in the next five years. He added, “Electricity and gas connections have already been given to all households.”

Referring to the CAA, the home minister said, “I am overwhelmed by the response from Bihar. I have addressed a series of meetings, but Bihar is where I have got the maximum support on the CAA.” He added, “The CAA is all about giving citizenship to all those Hindus, Jains, Christians and Sikhs who faced religious persecution in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan.”

Shah said Muslims in the country need not worry about losing their citizenship. “Rumours are being spread and people are being misled on the issue,” he remarked, adding, “Opposition parties are doing this to people, especially Muslims, for political gains.” “Mat (vote) ke lalach mein mati (wisdom) kho diye hain,” he said.

The home minister accused 'tukde tukde gang' (opposition leaders) of “toeing the line” of Pakistan PM Imran Khan by “orchestrating violence” in the first three-four days of the passing of the CAA by Parliament. He warned, “Those who shout slogans like Bharat tere tukde honge will be taught a lesson."

Accusing Congress of adopting double standards on the CAA, Shah said the Congress in Rajasthan promised citizenship to such people in its election manifesto. “Jab wo bole toh thik aur hum bole to galat. Ye kahan ka nyay hai?” he asked.

In his 25-minute speech, Shah targeted Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, Arvind Kejriwal, Mamta Banerjee and Lalu Prasad for their “vote bank politics”. Holding Congress responsible for the plight of hundreds of refugees, he said the Indian government at the time of Partition did not take care of the rights of the lakhs of people who willingly stayed back in East and West Pakistan.

“While the number of minorities in Pakistan decreased, the population of minorities in India increased manifold,” Shah said, adding, “India never talked of Hindu Rashtra because of which all sects and religions flourished here.”

On the issue of building a temple at Ayodhya, Shah said a “sky-touching temple of Ram Lala” will be built there in the next four months. He highlighted the NDA government’s success in settling the issues of Article 370 and 35A in Jammu & Kashmir.

Title: Bengaluru: With killer’s help, woman homeguard seeks revenge against cop
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

BENGALURU: A murder convict and a woman homeguard who hatched a plan to extort money from a woman sub-inspector from Vidyaranyapura police station landed behind bars on Wednesday.

Ramu alias Chool Ramu, 35, called the woman cop on January 7 night and abused her, saying they had her nude pictures. He demanded she pay him Rs 1 lakh, failing which he would defame her. The SI rebuked the caller and filed a complaint.

During investigation, it was revealed that the phone call was made by Ramu, a history-sheeter and murder convict who had been released after seven years in jail.

Sleuths discovered that the SIM card was registered in homeguard Puttamma’s name. They took the duo into custody and questioned them. It turned out that Puttamma, 32, was the one who made Ramu call the woman sub-inspector.

Police said Puttamma was upset with the SI because the latter would burden her with work. She used Ramu, who she had met four years ago when she was deputed in Parappana Agrahara prison, where he was serving a murder term.

Sleuths suspect Puttamma, who is married, had a relationship with Ramu after he came out of prison.

Title: May support BJP if assembly gets Jack’s statue: Vijai
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Panaji: Goa Forward Party (GFP) on Thursday challenged the 10 MLAs who switched over from the Congress to the BJP to convince the state government to install a life-size statue of Dr Jack de Sequeira in the state legislative assembly complex.

GFP president Vijai Sardesai, who inaugurated the Dr Jack de Sequeira Square at Merces junction, said that he was willing to support the BJP government if the statue was installed in the complex. “We failed to put up the statue of Dr Jack de Sequeira in the assembly, which we wanted to do. Now, the 10 MLAs who have gone to the BJP (from the Congress) we pray that they do it at least,” Sardesai said.

The former deputy chief minister said that when GFP was part of the state government, Panaji MLA Atanasio Monserrate was in favour of the statue being put up in the assembly complex.

“These 10 MLAs should prove me wrong. If they do that then we may even think of supporting the present government,” said Sardesai.

Sardesai made the statement in the presence of St Cruz MLA Tony Fernandes who is one of the MLAs to switch over from the Congress to the BJP. “Dr Jack de Sequeira fought to protect Goa’s identity. I will propose to our government to beautify the roads around this square,” was all that Fernandes said.

The square at Merces has been built on land provided by the government when Saligao MLA Jayesh Salgaonkar was a minister. The site has been developed by the Merces Konkani Kala Kendre.

Sardesai also slammed the government headed by chief minister Pramod Sawant by stating that the BJP government was trying to rewrite history in the state.

“If not for the opinion poll, the chief minister would have been a chairman of a zilla parishad, nothing more. People are trying to rewrite history. Today you cannot say that Nehru did not do anything for Goa. It is Jawaharlal Nehru who laid the path for the Opinion Poll, which is Independent India’s only referendum. Just because those who run the country like it, you cannot criticise Nehru,” he said.

Title: CM lays foundation stone of Puri development projects
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhubaneswar: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik on Thursday laid foundation stone of the heritage and infrastructure projects in Puri during his visit to the pilgrim town. He also offered prayers at the Jagannath Temple and reviewed the heritage corridor project.

“I am always happy to visit Shree Jagannath Mandir and pray for welfare of people of our state. You will see the projects surrounding the temple will be very beautiful,” Naveen told reporters after visiting the shrine.

Though the chief minister visits the 12th century shrine every year on January 1, this year he could not visit as he was mourning the death of his brother-in-law Sonny Mehta.

Projects for which foundation stones were laid include the Shree Setu project, Jagannath Ballav Pilgrim Centre, multi-level car parking and redevelopment of municipal market complex under the Abadha scheme. Foundation was also laid for three other projects which will not be part of the Abadha scheme. The Shree Setu Project is a 2.3-km link that will connect the NH-316 with the Grand Road through a trumpet bridge bypassing the town. The link, which will ease congestion and facilitate smooth vehicular movement within the city, will be developed at a cost of Rs 380 crore. The Jagannath Ballav Pilgrim Centre will be set up with an investment of Rs 190 crore over 5.5 acres. It will have facilities like multi-level parking for 1,000 cars, tourist amenities, commercial space, meditation centre and multi-modal hub.

Naveen also laid foundation stone of renovation of municipal market complex into a modern market complex along Grand Road. As many as 550 vending outlets and parking space for 100 cars will be developed with an investment Rs 50 crore. A multi-level parking for 500 cars and 350 vending outlets will also come up at Jail Road at a cost of Rs 96 crore.

All these four projects are part of the Puri World Heritage Project that aims to transform Puri into a world-class heritage city. Construction for these projects would start very soon. All these Abadha projects are targeted to be completed by end of the 2022, said a senior works department official.

Projects outside Abadha include seafront vending zone with an investment of Rs 12 crore, redevelopment of Swargadwara at a cost of Rs 5 crore and centralised kitchen for midday meal and Aahar by spending Rs 10 crore. Naveen also reviewed the heritage corridor project around the temple and on the Grand Road where works secretary Krishan Kumar and 5T secretary VK Pandian briefed him about the status.

Title: Review problems faced by flood-affected people: Rajendra Patil
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Kolhapur: The district administration will be reviewing the problems faced by the flood-affected people from Shirol taluka within 15 days. This comes after Rajendra Patil, the public health and family minister directed the district collector to address their. issues.

As many as 43 delegations of villages from the taluka met Patil and put forward their grievances.

Patil had convened the meeting, of the villagers from Shirol taluka who were affected by August floods , in the office of Shirol Tehsildar. The people’s representatives which included Hatkanangle MP Dhairyasheel Mane and the government officials including district collector Daulat Desai, sub divisional office Vikas Kharat and others were present.

“The delegation of 43 villages met Patil during the meeting and raised issues like the delay in compensation, irregularities in the disbursement of funds, encroachment of land reserved for cattle grazing. They also demanded resurvey of losses faced by retail businessmen and shop owners, damaged houses and other properties,” said a senior officer.

Addressing the gathering, Patil said, “We have noted all the issues and have asked the concerned officers attached with district collectorate to look into them and address them within two weeks. The concerned officials will submit the detailed report about the action taken on these demands.”

“We will ensure that everyone who has lost their property or has damaged some material during the floods will receive compensation from the government,” he said.

The women agitating against micro finance companies were also present during the meeting.

Raising their issue, MP Mane said, “We have taken up the issue with the state government and expect that there would be a decision related to the change in the policy regarding the micro finance companies.”

Title: Towns in Koraput under CCTV surveillance
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Koraput: The Koraput district police have started installing high resolution CCTV cameras in urban areas of the district as part of the measures to strengthen security and check crimes.

While police have installed at least 35 CCTV cameras in Kotpad, situated along Odisha-Chhattisgarh border on Thursday, work is on for installation of 92 CCTV cameras at Jeypore and 62 CCTV cameras at Semiliguda and Sunabeda.

“Kotpad being the border town of the district and coming under the corridor of ganja smugglers, CCTV cameras were first installed at the town on a priority basis and installation of CCTV cameras in other towns of the district is in full swing,” said SP (Koraput) Mukesh Kumar Bhamoo.

According to the SP, the cameras are installed at all important locations of the towns and the installation of cameras in all urban bodies of the district is expected to be completed by January 26.

“It will help arrest crime as the towns’ key areas will be under 24x7 surveillance,” the SP said.

While latest technology and high-resolution motorised zoom facility CCTV cameras have been put to use, a control room has been set up at the town police station concerned from where officials would monitor the areas under CCTV surveillance.

Selected officials can see the live footage of the CCTV cameras in their mobile phones, the SP said.

Police is hopeful that the CCTV cameras would bring down the crime graph, especially snatching, motorcycle theft, ganja smuggling and rash driving as the technology would cut response time.

Meanwhile, locals have hailed police for installing the CCTV cameras in the urban areas of the district.

“Presence of CCTV cameras across the towns will give a sense of security to residents even in the dead of the night. However, their proper maintenance is to be ensured,” said Sashi Bhusan Patnaik, adviser, Chamber of Commerce, Jeypore.

Title: Nigerian held with Rs 5.4 lakh drugs in Siolim
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Panaji: Goa police’s crime branch arrested a Nigerian national for possession of narcotic substances worth Rs 5.4 lakh at Siolim on Thursday.

Police said they received a tip-off that a Nigerian national would deliver drugs to a prospective customer in Siolim. Accordingly, they constituted a team and the suspect was put under surveillance. The team then laid a trap and as the Nigerian approached the spot he was arrested with narcotic substances.

He had 48.3g of cocaine and some LSD papers worth Rs 5.4 lakh in his scooter.

Title: Kolkata Municipal Corporation plans ‘total overhaul’ to salvage 145-year-old New Market
Content:
Shopkeepers reportedly live in constant fear as chunks of ceiling at New Market have collapsed several times i... Read More

KOLKATA: The KMC plans to overhaul the century-old New Market , large parts of which have been showing signs of decay over the past few years, to give it a fresh lease of life.But before work starts, the civic authorities will conduct a detailed study of the Grade-I heritage market to ascertain the current condition of the structure. The civic body will float a tender to appoint an agency to carry out the survey. It was also weighing the option of roping in the best structural engineers to conduct the structural stability test of New Market before going in for “total restoration” of the structure, said senior KMC market department official.The KMC, however, has a challenge before they can start restoration: the illegal occupants of the market will have to be evicted. “Large portions of the ceiling of the market have been made vulnerable owing to the construction of make-shift structures on the terrace. We need to evict the occupants and raze the makeshift structures to make the building structurally safe,” said a KMC market department official, adding effective steps were being planned to remove the people from New Market’s roof, which they have turned into their homes.The frequent incidents of concrete chunks falling off the ceiling in different parts of the 145-year-old market over the past five years has apparently nudged the civic top brass to take the initiative to restore the crumbling structure from further decay. “New Market is an inseparable part of the city’s rich history,” said a KMC market department official. “Sadly, many parts of the building have developed major cracks. Concrete is falling off the ceiling at regular intervals. It’s time we conducted a detailed study of the structure and came up with a solution to save the historic market from collapsing.”A KMC buildings department official conceded that large parts of New Market were crying out for urgent repairs. Pointing out that the condition was especially poor in the flower range, meat range, fish range, vegetable range and Golghar , the official expressed apprehension that if a comprehensive repair work was not taken up soon, it might “cost them dear”. “Though we have taken up temporary repair work from time to time, we need to chalk out a comprehensive restoration policy for the heritage market to make it structurally safe. Any further delay in this direction will cost us dearly,” the KMC building department official said. S S Hogg Market Traders’ Association president Ashok Gupta on Thursday said the traders had been demanding a comprehensive repair work for the market structure for a long time.

Title: Expert committee recommended closure of AFT unit, says Bedi
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Puducherry: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi said a one-member expert committee constituted by the council of ministers recommended the closure of Anglo-French Textiles (AFT) mill in view of mounting liabilities.

Bedi, in a statement, pointed out that the board of directors of the AFT mill also accepted the recommendation and resolved to close the mill. She said the council of ministers, however, decided to introduce voluntary retirement scheme instead of closing the mill. She was of the view that the decision of the board of directors to close the mill will be ‘appropriate’ considering its financial situation.

The lieutenant governor said she referred the issue to the Union government as there was a difference of opinion with the council of ministers in April 2019.

She told the Centre that the mill management had been asked to file a notice for closure as per the Industrial Dispute Act pending its final decision. “The final decision of the Union government in the matter of closure is expected shortly,” she said.

Meanwhile, the AFT managing director on Tuesday filed a notice seeking the government’s permission to close the mill under Section 25-O of the Industrial Disputes Act.

Now, the government represented by the labour department will hold a detailed inquiry eliciting the views of the management, workers and other stakeholders, including bankers, who provided loans to the mill.

Bedi said the labour department will study the reasons for closure keeping in mind the interest of the general public and other relevant factors and submit a report to the government.

She said she has approved the release of grant-in-aid to the mill to pay lay-off compensation to the workers on January 9.

Title: Kolkata: Clothes burnt as fire breaks out in stall
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Workers try to salvage clothes from the fire in a New Market stall

KOLKATA: A fire broke out at a stall in the G Block of New Market on Thursday. Around 11.45am, the stall owner selling hosiery products noticed the fire. He raised an alarm to draw the attention of other traders. They applied fire extinguishers to douse the flames before alerting the fire officials.

A New Market trader said the fire destroyed some hosiery garments in the stall.

Two fire tenders from Mirza Ghalib Street rushed to the spot and brought the fire under control around 12.45pm. Cops cordoned off the area for some time before normalcy was restored in the market.

Title: MGP seeks CBI probe into road tax cut
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Panaji: The Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party ( MGP ) on Thursday demanded an inquiry either by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) or a commission headed by a retired judge on the 50% road tax exemption given by the government for buying new vehicles sans finance department’s approval.

Speaking to reporters on the tax cut decision, former transport minister Ramkrishna Dhavalikar said he disputes the fact that the transport department had the approval of the finance department.

“Even if there was a cabinet approval, we will stand by our demand of an inquiry into the tax cut issue,” Dhavalikar said.

He questioned the rationale behind a cut in road tax when the automobile companies had come out with schemes to sell outdated models. “What was the reason for the state to reduce the tax and cause Rs 48 crore loss,” he questioned.

The former transport minister alleged that the decision was taken to benefit someone.

Title: Haji Mastan ‘pucca Congressi’, many netas met him, says ‘son’
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

MUMBAI: Wading into the controversy Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut stoked with his comment that former PM Indira Gandhi had met gangster Karim Lala, another mafia don Haji Mastan’s adopted son Sundar Shekhar said on Thursday many Congress members like Murli Deora and Sushilkumar Shinde would meet his ‘baba’.

“Baba was a pucca Congressi. I remember senior Congress leaders like Vasantdada Patil , Murli Deora and Sushilkumar Shinde meeting him,” said Shekhar. He wondered why Raut had changed his statement on Thursday. “Small leaders would meet Haji Mastan at a hotel in central Mumbai while big leaders would meet at a five-star hotel in south Mumbai.” At times, he would go to Delhi too, he said.

Though Shekhar claimed Haji Mastan had raised him, Mastan’s family had earlier denied he was adopted by Mastan.

Shekhar added that till 1984, Haji Mastan or Mastan Mirza was in Congress. “But after Indira Gandhi’s death in October 1984, baba left Congress and along with Joginder Kaware founded Dalit Muslim Suraksha Mahasangh in 1985,” he said. “I remember Ramdas Athavale (RPI leader) would stand outside the room while baba and Kaware held meetings,” he recalled. “Both Muslims and Dalits ditched him and he changed his party’s name to Bharatiya Minorities Suraksha Mahasangh.”

Title: Voters to decide fate of zilla panchayats on March 15
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Panaji: Elections to the North and South Goa zilla panchayats (ZP) will be held on March 15.

The polls, which will involve all 50 ZP constituencies — 25 each in North and South Goa — will be held on party lines. TOI was the first to report that the ZP elections would be held on party lines.

A detailed notification of the schedule for the election process will be issued in February, state election commissioner R K Srivastava told TOI. He also said the commission has begun preparing the electoral roll.

Political observers said the ZP polls will determine the strength of each political party. “It is akin to a mid-term poll to test the waters. The results will show who stands where,” a political observer said.

While BJP and Congress have already declared that they will contest the elections on party lines, GFP president Vijai Sardesai said GFP functionaries would meet by the end of the week to decide on whether to contest the ZP elections on party lines or to support independent candidates. GFP is represented by three MLAs.

MGP president Deepak Dhavalikar said the party has decided to contest the ZP polls independently. MGP has favoured elections on party lines in a bid to ascertain its political clout in the state.

In 2015, then chief minister Laxmikant Parsekar had decided to conduct ZP elections along party lines. The Goa Panchayat Raj Act was accordingly amended in March that year. The provision, however, was not extended to village panchayat elections.

Title: Rajasthan: Provide free coaching, private colleges told
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Reresentative image

JAIPUR: To expand the facility of free coaching to the students of private colleges of the state, Rajasthan higher education department has issued directions to private colleges to run free coaching classes to help them prepare for competitive examinations.

Government colleges in the state are already running such coaching classes since last year for the students under the programme ‘Pratiyogita Dakshata’. The government now wants private colleges affiliated with it to run similar classes.

Commissioner of college education Pradeep Borad said that they are hopeful that students will be benefitted by this. “We want the participation of the private organisations in this programme as well. They have to start the classes from this session and there are colleges who have already begun the session. It will have an impact in the coming days as students won’t have to pay high fees to the private coaching classes,” said Borad.

There are many types of coaching classes going on and to decide which type of coaching will be provided to the students will depend on the majority. “Most of the students are interested in RAS and UPSC coaching but if the majority of the students are interested in Patwari or REET exam than that coaching will be given. Students will be given an option to choose the types of coaching they would want to choose” said Borad.

There are more than 400 private colleges in the state getting affiliation and NOC from the government which makes it mandatory for them to run such classes. The administrative control of private colleges is in the hands of the government.

Title: CA results: Lone city boy secures place among top 20
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Top performers from the city celebrate after the results on Thursday

JAIPUR: Results of Chartered Accountant ( CA )-final were announced on Thursday and just one student from the city was able to make it to the all India top-20 list, while last year, the all India topper was from Jaipur. Sarvesh Kabra, a Jaipurite secured rank 11 in all of India, securing a place in the top-20 list.

The results were announced by Institute of Chartered Accountants of India for the exam conducted in November 2019. Due to the change in pattern of the exam last year, the result is divided into old and new syllabus.

Sarvesh secured the rank in the new syllabus and no student of old syllabus was able to make it to the top-20. Abhinav Sekhri, a student of old syllabus, secured all India rank 22.

In the new syllabus, five students were able to make it to the top 100, but in old syllabus, only two students secured ranks within top 100. Sarvesh Kabra, the 23-year-old recent graduate, was delighted when his results were declared and said that he has an ambition to become a businessman.

As per the data given, in old syllabus 2,159 students appeared and 642 students were able to pass. Whereas in the new syllabus, 1,232 students appeared and 398 students were able to pass the exam.

Title: Karnataka 2nd PUC exam 2020 results to be declared after CET
Content: BENGALURU: No mobile phones will be allowed in II PU examination centres this year. A meeting convened by primary and secondary education minister S Suresh Kumar on Thursday decided to declare the results only after the Common Entrance Test.As reported by TOI earlier, a 40-page answer sheet will be given to students instead of the earlier 24 to avoid the risk of additional sheets getting missed.Officials said 2,46,772 students will be take the theory exam to be held in 1,016 centres and practicals in 1,014 centres. Practical exams will be held from January 25 to February 10. The minister directed the authorities to send the related list of students and answer scripts to respective centres as early as possible. Marks of practical exams will be sent online.The final admission tickets will be released on January 17; the draft was out on December 26. Officials said 35,156 have registered for evaluation of answer sheets.A mini-control unit will be set up at the deputy commissioner’s office of each district centre in addition to the central control unit. Four new service centres will be opened to facilitate information of students’ attendance, irregularities at exam centres, details of supply of answer scripts and question papers.

Title: Kolkata: School students, anganwadi workers march against CAA
Content:
The rally was held from Garden Reach to Park Street

KOLKATA: Hundreds of girls and women from all walks of life—from those belonging to the minority community, students from south Kolkata schools to anganwadi helpers from Garden Reach—walked together in the city to protest against the new Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ) on Thursday.Insha Mehboob, a Class-XI student at Metiabruz High School, joined the march, which started from Garden Reach, not too far from her home. “We have been living here all of our lives. We will not show our documents to prove our citizenship. We are all Indians. I, and so many others, do not accept this new citizenship law,” said Mehboob. The rally ended at Park Street.Most of the participants learnt about the rally through social media. Alima Firdaus, a Padmapukur resident and a student at Rani Birla Girl’s College, said religion could not be the basis of a law, but the government had done exactly that, offering citizenship, based on religious identity. “India is a diverse country, where people of many religions live. No one among them should be separated because of religion. Our rights are being taken away and therefore, we must protest,” Firdaus said.

Title: Karnataka to revamp portal to improve ease-of-biz ranking
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

BENGALURU: With Bengaluru being one of the four Indian cities included in the World Bank list for conducting a global ease-of-doing-business survey, the state government is on a mission to revamp Karnataka Udyog Mitra, its single-window clearance portal for project approvals.

“We want to streamline KUM and make it more integrated. Currently, it has only 10 departments. We have added 38 in the new portal and this number may go up in time,” said an official from the industries and commerce department. he revamped portal is likely to be launched by March.

The new portal is expected to speed up the process of getting clearances and approvals, especially no-objection certificates, which have been described by many as the biggest pain-point in starting a business here.

The new portal will be linked to DigiLocker app, through which an applicant will receive updates on the status of applications with each department, including notifications on scheduled inspections and visits. The portal will also be linked with the Karnataka Sakala Act website, which will send reports to the respective department’s commissioner if work is pending beyond the stipulated period.

“The line department’s responses and further requirements will be sent to the applicant through DigiLocker app. If line departments need additional documents, they can source them from the app. These features will be implemented under phase 1 of the revamp project,” an official said.

Over the past two weeks, coordination meetings have been held with over 10 departments including BBMP, BWSSB, KSPCB, fire and emergency services, Bescom, factories, boilers and industrial safety department and health department.

Karnataka’s score in the statewise ease-of-doing-business report, released by the department of industrial policy and promotion, has risen from 48.5 in 2015 to 88.4 in 2017 and 96.4 in 2017 and 98.6 in 2018.

Title: Ryots allow transport of ore in Mayem
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bicholim: Ore transportation finally started through Mayem village after Bicholim deputy collector Sachin Desai intervened in the matter and assured farmers that their long-pending compensation issue would be resolved. Desai assured them that he would arrange a special meeting on January 21 to hold talks.

Farmers from Mayem had threatened to stop transportation of e-auctioned ore through the village. They demanded that the mining company compensate them first for the losses they have suffered due to mining silt entering fields. Late Wednesday evening, a special meeting was called in the Bicholim deputy collector’s office which was attended by Bicholim mamlatdar Pravinjay Pandit, Bicholim police, Mayem sarpanch, panch members and a farmers’ delegation. Farmers Sakharam Pednekar and Yeshwant Karbotkar told the deputy collector that the mining company has not paid any compensation till date. Pednekar said that the company is unwilling to pay Rs 60 lakh that has been sanctioned to 110 farmers.

Desai also assured to rejuvenate farming in Mayem area by desilting all rivulets and farms. After this, the farmers were ready to withdraw their agitation temporarily and ore transportation began from Thursday. Pednekar said they have withdrawn the agitation temporarily.

Title: Kolkata: Teen researches online, donates liver to save father
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: A 19-year-old youth on Thursday donated a portion of his liver to save the life of his father. Ranjit Kundu (44), who runs a hardware shop in Basirhat, has been suffering from a serious liver disease for more than three years.

Ranjit was taken to different cities, including Delhi and Bangalore, for treatment. Everywhere, he was told that a liver transplant was the only way he could be saved. But in the absence of any donor, Ranjit’s condition kept deteriorating. “Abhjit Chowdhury, a doctor at SSKM Hospital , said liver transplant was the only option to save his life,” said the patient’s younger brother, Jayanta.

Given the situation, Ranjit’s son, Pratim, a first-year undergraduate student, started reading up on the internet about liver transplant and came to know about organ donation .

As a donor could not be found in spite of their best efforts, Pratim decided to donate a part of his liver. Doctors were told about it and the surgery was carried out at SSKM Hospital’s School of Digestive and Liver Diseases (SDLD). Doctors at SDLD said the surgery was successful and both the recipient and the donor would remain in the post-operative intensive care unit.

Jayanta added, “My nephew had been very concerned about his father’s health. He said he would donate a part of his liver to save his father as we did not come by any donor.” Pratim’s family initially tried to deter him because of his young age, but he told them that his life would be meaningless if he could not save his father.

“Considering the donor’s age, the recipient has got a good quality liver. So, we expect a good outcome. This was our first liver transplant for 2020,” said SDLD head, GK Dhali.

Title: Private air ambulance firm makes a pitch to Karnataka govt
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Photo used for representational purpose

BENGALURU: A private helicopter emergency medical services firm on Thursday said it has offered to run air ambulance services in Karnataka and sought the state government’s partnership.

The firm, International Critical-Care Air Transfer Team, conducted a mock drill which saw dummy accident victims being transported from Mandya to Jakkur aerodrome. Co-founder Shalini Nilshad said: “We are thinking of making it a free service by tying up with the Karnataka government . Air ambulance teams attending to accident victims are often seen in the US, UK and other European countries.”

While she did not elaborate on how the company plans to fund the project, Shalini, however, said designated landing strips will be identified and created along highways in Karnataka, which could be used for choppers to land in case of accidents.

Deputy chief minister CN Ashwath Narayan, who was present at Jakkur where the helicopter from Mandya landed, did not comment on ICATT’s proposal . Financial viability and sustainability have been the pain points of such projects in the past.

“Over the years, several air ambulance providers have shut shop. This business will be successful only when people can afford it. In other countries, these services are covered under insurance,” said Sanjay Mishra, MD of Air Rescuers Worldwide.

Title: SC reserves verdict on firm’s plea to use mined iron ore
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

The Supreme Court on Thursday reserved its judgment in a plea by a mining company seeking the court’s nod to commercially use and transport iron ore that was extracted prior to March 15, 2018 and lies unused in its mines in Goa.

Mining in the state came to a halt on March 15, 2018, after the apex court quashed the second renewal of the mining leases of 88 companies.

“The Supreme Court has reserved its judgment on transportation of ore that was extracted prior to the mining ban and is lying inside and outside leased areas. Arguments concluded on Thursday. If permitted by the Supreme Court, it will provide temporary relief to mining affected areas. The judgment is likely to be passed soon,” the chief minister’s office announced.

A bench comprising Chief Justice S A Bobde and justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant reserved its order after hearing arguments from senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi, appearing for Chowgule and Company Pvt Ltd, and lawyer Prashant Bhushan who has been representing the NGO, Goa Foundation .

The mining company is aggrieved by an order of the high court and has been seeking a nod from the apex court to permit it to commercially use and transport mined iron ore. The plea has been vehemently opposed by Goa Foundation, which alleged that the apex court in 2014 had held that the mining leases of various companies were illegal after 2007.

“The mined iron ore is illegal and is state property which needed to be confiscated,” Bhushan argued, adding that later in 2018, a bench headed by Justice Madan B Lokur also quashed the renewal of mining leases of over 80 companies.

Rohatgi said the company was empowered to conduct its mining business for six months after the closure of mining at the direction of the apex court. He asked that the mining firm be allowed to commercially use iron ore that had already been mined.

Title: Safety inspection of Jaipur Metro tunnel likely in March
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

The length of entire Metro corridor Phase 1A and 1B is 12.07km

JAIPUR: The commissioner of metro rail safety is likely to conduct safety inspection of Jaipur Metro , Phase IB corridor in March .

As finishing work of the underground corridor is expected to be completed next month, the Jaipur Metro Rail Corporation (JMRC) is planning to invite CMRS in February.

A senior JMRC official said, “We are already conducting internal trials. We will invite the CMRS by the end of February. During the inspection, the commissioner will check track parameters, tunnels and the stations, calibration of the trains and firefighting system among others,” he said.
