Title: Old, defunct CCTVs fail to keep an eye on crime
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhopal: The CCTV cameras installed by various agencies between 2009 and 2014 for surveillance in the city are hardly any help to police as they are not only obsolete but most of them have become defunct also.

Installed in phases from 2009 to 2014, the technology and specifications of these cameras have become outdated and provide poor results. About half of the cameras remain out-of-order most of the time.

Police scan CCTV footages after any major loot, accident or theft incidents to identity suspects. However, there was no help from these cameras in past one year and police relied on private CCTV cameras installed by people on their premises to find any clue during investigation.

Unlike the much-advanced CCTV cameras installed under the Integrated Traffic Management System (ITMS) under the Smart City project, gathering footage on any crime incident from these surveillance cameras is a tedious job as cops have to manually search for footages staring at the screen for hours together.

On January 3, two scooterists snatched a mobile phone from a Delhi-based trainee chartered accountant (CA) while he was talking over phone outside his hotel in MP Nagar Zone I. He ran after the robbers till Thaddaram Complex trisection, but they sped away towards Jyoti Square. The CCTV cameras at Thaddaram Complex trisection and Jyoti Square failed to give any clue to MP Nagar police when they scanned the footages.

SHO MP Nagar Manish Rai said the footages were grainy and provided no help at all.

Similarly, police struggled to get any help from surveillance CCTV cameras while investigating the abduction of 3-year-old Varun Meena in Kolar and the loot bid with a jeweller’s driver in Kotwali area last year. In many hit-and-run accidents, cops struggled to find the accused driver due to lack of good cameras.

Senior police officers wishing anonymity said the project to install 10,000 new CCTV cameras across the state is withheld due to shortage of funds.

Cops maintained that the number of cameras is not adequate to cover various left out vital parts of the city and at least 3-4 times more cameras are needed. City police have already sent a proposal to PHQ seeking installation of at least 1,000 more CCTV cameras, but no action has been taken so far.

Police officers maintained that it was the private cameras that provided help in all the major crime cases cracked by the police during the past one year. Under ‘Bhopal Eye’ app initiative, police are now encouraging people to install CCTVs on their premises and provide the live feed to police by linking it with police on the app.

Police have marked strategic locations across the city and identified private buildings where people are being asked to install good quality night vision cameras on their premises so that police may get help in case of any criminal activity.

To encourage people for CCTV installation, police are holding meetings with members of various organisations like nursing homes associations, religious institutions, schools/colleges, petrol pumps, jewellers, covered campus colonies societies, coaching institutes and banks. Police plan to get live feed from at least 5,000 cameras through public participation under the ‘Bhopal Eye’ campaign.

DIG Irshad Wali admitted that the quality of surveillance CCTV cameras is poor. The proposal to increase the number of CCTV cameras in the city has been sent to PHQ, he said, adding, police are making people aware to install good quality night vision cameras on their premises for their own safety. It’s a win-win situation for people and police, if they share the live feed with police. He said that as of now police have got live feed of around 500 CCTV cameras under Bhopal Eye initiative.

GFX-

260 CCTV cameras installed under ITMS at 22 locations

1,050 CCTV cameras installed under police surveillance at 214 locations

Title: Patna: 12 booked in milk trader murder case
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Police have launched a manhunt to arrest 12 people who were named in an FIR in connection with the murder of a milk trader , Manish Kumar (20), who was beaten to death at Gosaipur diara village under the Akilpur police station area in western Patna on Wednesday night. The victim was a resident of Kasimchak village under the same police station area.

Police said one Chunnu Kumar of Sultanpur village under the Danapur police station area was named as the main accused in the FIR lodged by victim’s father Vishwanath Rai with Akilpur police station on Thursday.

SHO (incharge) of Akilpur police station Deo Kumar Prasad said multiple injury marks were found on the head and the body of Manish. “Manish and Chunnu had a fight at least two months back over a monetary dispute,” he said, adding Manish had lent money to Chunnu which the latter failed to pay back.

Prasad said Manish was on way to riverine belt from Akilpur to collect milk when he was intercepted by more than six people. “He was riding a bike when several people armed with rods and sticks attacked him. They fled the spot after committing the crime. Manish was taken to a hospital where the doctors declared him brought arrival,” the SHO said, adding raids were on to arrest the accused.

Title: Karnataka cabinet expansion only after Yediyurappa’s Davos visit
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

BS Yediyurappa (File Photo)

BENGALURU: Chief minister BS Yediyurappa is likely to induct new ministers into his cabinet only after he returns from Davos, Switzerland, on January 25.

Yediyurappa will leave for Davos on January 19 to participate in the World Economic Forum’s 50th annual meet.

Sources say Yediyurappa is keen on expanding his cabinet before he leaves for Davos and is still trying to secure the green signal from BJP national president Amit Shah. However, Shah has cold-shouldered Yediyurappa’s several requests for a meeting to discuss the issue.

Shah is scheduled to visit Karnataka on January 18 to participate in a pro-Citizenship (Amendment) Act rally in Hubballi and the CM plans to corner him there. But, given the time constraint, Yediyurappa is likely to put off the exercise till he returns from Davos even if Shah extends approval.

“Even if Shah gives the green signal, Yediyurappa will have less than 24 hours to expand his cabinet,” a source said. “It is highly unlikely he will rush through the process of inducting ministers. Also, his presence is required to douse disgruntlement which is bound to arise once the new ministers are sworn in.”

The CM and the party high command are on different pages as far as cabinet expansion is concerned. While Yediyurappa is hell-bent on keeping his promise of inducting all the newly elected MLAs, who switched from Congress and JD(S) to the BJP, Shah is keen on sharing vacant berths equally between loyal MLAs and the new entrants. There are 16 cabinet berths vacant.

Shah, sources said, is of the opinion that giving 12 berths to the turncoats will lead to heartburn among loyalists and it will impact the party’s prospects in the next election. “Moreover, he is of the opinion that none of the turncoats have mass appeal, nor do they have any administrative experience. This, he thinks, will impact governance,” said a source.

This has resulted in a deadlock and the issue has dragged on for a month now.

Title: Vehicle lands in Sal river, 3 youths escape unhurt
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Colva: Three occupants escaped unhurt after the vehicle in which they were travelling landed in the Sal river early Thursday morning.

Margao police personnel, who were conducting checks of vehicles as part of their night patrolling duties on a small bridge connecting Margao to Benaulim, rushed to assist the youths.

Constables Suraj Velip, Hiresh Bhuttewadkar and home guard Divakar threw a rope into the water and pulled out the trio who had clambered onto the bonnet of the sinking vehicle.

As no third party was involved in the incident, no case has been registered by the police.

In his statement to the police, the vehicle driver said that he was attending a party at a popular establishment in Benaulim. At around 2am, he left the party along with two female friends in order to proceed home.

Police said that as the driver was proceeding to Margao, he lost control of the vehicle, rammed into a partly damaged retaining wall and landed into the river.

A family member later arranged for a crane to haul the vehicle.

Title: Soldier from Nagaur killed in Jammu and Kashmir avalanche
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: An Army jawan from Nagaur was killed in J&K after getting trapped in an avalanche caused by heavy snowfall in the valley on January 13. The Army launched a search and rescue operation but he could not be saved. His remains were found under the snow and will be brought to his village in Kuchaman city in Nagaur district by Friday. Four other jawans were also killed in the same accident.

Naik Rameshwar Lal (29) had joined the Army in 2009. He hailed from Kuchaman city in district Nagaur and is survived by his wife along with two children. He had been married for 12 years. The deceased jawan was commissioned into the Jat Regiment of the Indian Army and a neighbour of his told TOI, “Rameshwar was supposed to come on leave on January 18 and the entire village is devastated that now only his mortal remains will arrive. His brother who works abroad also arrived on Wednesday as soon as the family was informed of his death.” While Rameshwar lost his parents few years back, he has two brothers one of who works in Dubai while the other works in his native village itself. His funeral is likely to be held on Friday morning after his mortal remains reach Jodhpur through flight following which they be brought to his village by road.

CM Ashok Gehlot took to Twitter to offer his condolences. “Salutes to Rajasthan’s braveheart, Army jawan Naik Rameshwar Lal, a resident of Kuchaman City, Nagaur, who attained martyrdom in the line of duty in Kashmir. We stand with his family in this most difficult time.” Deputy CM Sachin Pilot also condoled his death.

Cabinet minister for soldier welfare department Pratap Singh Khachariyawas wrote on social media that he respected the jawan’s sacrifice and prayed for strength for his family.

Title: Rera orders Salcete builder to refund buyer, pay interest
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: The Goa Real Estate Regulatory Authority ( Rera ) has ordered a Salcete-based real estate entity to pay Rs 25 lakh to a complainant with 10% interest per annum from June 2016.

Acting on a complaint by Clifford D’Mello in July 2018, Rera member Pramod Kamat passed the order asking the respondent company to refund the deposit amount with interest.

The complainant had booked a flat at Pedda, Varca, with built-up area of 56.3 sqm in a project by the builder in April 2016 by paying an advance of Rs 25 lakh.

The project did not start even two years after the payment was made.

Since the project did not start, the complainant requested the builder to refund his money with interest. The builder was not willing to refund the advance. He gave false assurances whenever the complainant sent messages on his cellphone, the order read.

He also produced receipts of the payments made to the builder more than two years ago.

A notice was issued to the builder. During the hearing held in June 2016, the respondent agreed to refund the deposit with interest but he did not do so even after the complainant followed up with a reminder.

Rera then issued a showcause notice as to why a penalty should not be levied. It directed the respondent to remain present in the office.

The respondent sought a month’s time and the next date of the hearing was fixed. He turned volte-face and came up with a case that the complainant was an investor and not a home buyer, and that no relief could be granted to the complainant by this authority as all his claims were barred by the law of limitation.

Rera held that the complainant was not an investor but a bona fide intended purchaser, and that the respondent was duty-bound to refund him.

The complainant had booked a flat at Pedda, Varca, in a project by the builder in April 2016 by paying an advance of Rs 25 lakh. The project had not started even two years after the payment was made

This story is from January 17, 2020

Title: Chennai: Congress free to leave alliance said Durai Murugan
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Durai Murugan

CHENNAI: The Congress-DMK ties took a further beating on Wednesday after DMK treasurer S Durai Murugan said the Congress was welcome to quit the alliance and that the ally’s exit would in no way affect his party’s prospects in elections ahead. While, this is the first time, a senior DMK functionary has asked its electoral partner to exit the alliance if it so desired, the Congress has maintained a studious silence. The Tamil Nadu Congress Committee chief K S Alagiri has refused to react beyond his earlier statement that the alliance with DMK was on.

A recent statement by Alagiri that DMK had “not adhered to coalition dharma” had upset the DMK leadership. Congress councillors had indulged in cross-voting in the recent rural local body elections, leading to DMK losing a district panchayat chairmanship. This had upset the DMK leadership, provoking it to boycott the CAA meeting convened by AICC president Sonia Gandhi on Monday.

In the AIADMK alliance too, all is not well. On Thursday, senior minister D Jayakumar remarked rather cryptically, "anything is possible in politics." This was in reply to a question from reporters in Chennai about the possibility of Congress switching to the AIADMK alliance.

On Pongal day, Durai Murugan told reporters in Vellore, “If they want to quit, let them do so. How are we concerned? It is no loss for us.” He further added, “Congress does not have a vote bank to make a dent in our party’s prospects. Do they have votes to make an impact?” asked Durai Murugan sarcastically.

On former Union minister T R Baalu saying only time will tell about whether the DMK-Congress alliance will continue, Durai Murugan said, “Baalu said only time will tell. But I have answered the question.” Sivaganga MP and former Union minister P Chidambaram’s son Karti Chidambaram, joined issue, taking to Twitter to ask why Durai Murugan did not say this during the Vellore Lok Sabha election which his son Kathir Anand won with a slender margin of 8000 votes. “Why didn’t this wisdom dawn before the Vellore parliamentary byelection?” tweeted Karti.

Meanwhile on Thursday, Virudhunagar MP Manickam Tagore said the DMK-Congress alliance was the best for the Lok Sabha elections in Tamil Nadu. “What Alagiri said was only regarding the rural local body elections. Our party cadres are upset that they did not get a chance to become even a deputy chief in district panchayat unions,” Tagore told TOI. He said Alagiri had only expressed his concern about the allotment of posts in the local body elections. “Stalin has not spoken anything. But, when DMK leaders criticise the Congress party, I have a suspicion that they do not have Stalin’s interests at heart and don’t want him to become a CM of TN,” he said.

IUML leader and DMK ally K M Khader Moideen attempted to cool tempers by stating, “What Stalin says is important. Has he said anything?” The former Vellore MP said there was only one leader for the DMK and that only his views mattered.

Title: Thane murder suspect arrested in Nashik
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: The central crime branch of Nashik police successfully tracked down and arrested a suspect accused of killing a man inside a medical shop in Kalwa of Thane district.

Commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare-Patil on Thursday said ground work and human intelligence were two important factors that helped them catch the suspect — identified as Sarfaraj Ansari (29), a resident of Jharkhand. A case against Ansari was also registered at Nashik Road police station in 2017.

The suspect is accused of killing Premsingh Kishorsing Rajpurohit (26), a relative of shopowner. The suspect broke into the shop to steal at midnight of December 27, 2017, only to find the victim inside the shop.

As Rajpurohit tried to stop Ansari, the latter pulled out a gun and shot two rounds one of which hit the former.

“Our men had no information other than the two photographs in which Ansari was seen with two women. We had no clue about the whereabouts of the women or the suspect. But assistant sub-inspector Dattatray Kadnoor and constable Gangadhar Kedar identified the women and interrogated them that led us to the suspect,” Nangre-Patil said.

“It was established that the suspect came to Nashik and then went to Jharkhand. We were waiting for his return and had also sent teams to the track him down,” a police officer said.

The police then got to know that the suspect was coming to Nashik and accordingly a trap was laid at Nilgiri Baug.

“We nabbed him on Thursday morning. The suspect will now be handed over to the Thane police when they come here for his custody,” another senior police officer said. Commissioner of police has announced a cash reward of Rs 25,000 to every policeman involved in cracking the case.

“It is not known if the women are involved in the crime. We have seized a country-made pistol, three rounds, cash and valuable, including motorcycle, amounting to Rs 64,390 from Ansari. Further interrogation will be carried out by the Thane police,” the officer said, adding that the suspect has been remanded in police custody till January 18.

Title: 700 girls yet to get financial aid under Kanya Vivah Yojana
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Indore: Over 700 girls, who got married under ‘Mukhya Mantri Kanya Vivah Evam Nikah Yojana' in this financial year are still awaiting financial aid they are entitled to under the scheme. The amount adds up to around Rs3.5 crore.

As per social justice department data, 1083 girls have tied the knot under Mukhya Mantri Kanya Vivah Evam Nikah Yojana in current fiscal and are entitled to Rs51,000 each (Organizers of these mass marriage ceremonies too are entitled to Rs3,000 per couple for making required arrangements).

“In current financial year, we have distributed payment to 356 girls. For payment to remaining 727 girls, grant from state government is awaited. We have written to senior officials on various occasions to release the same,” social justice department joint director, Suchita Tirkey Beck said.

The main reason behind the delay is additional financial burden being borne by government, said a senior administrative official on condition of anonymity. After Congress came to power in state, it increased the aid amount from Rs28,000, to Rs51,000, as it had promised in its poll manifesto. The increase in amount has led to increase in number of eligible girls solemnizing their marriage under the scheme to avail the benefit. All this has resulted in additional financial burden on state government. At present, over Rs100 crore is yet to be distributed among over 20,000 eligible girls across the state, the official said.

This delay in payment has started a political blame game between the BJP and Congress.

“Congress has come to power by making false promises including waiving off agriculture loans in 10 days of making the government, else chief minister would be changed. Also, Kamal Nath increased payment under Kanyadan and Nikah Yojana but hundreds of beneficiaries are waiting for payment,” BJP city president Gopikrishna Nema told TOI.

He said that Congress government has shut many schemes of Shivraj Singh Chouhan government and on the same lines they have released a ‘calendar’ (fixed nine days for Hindu marriages and nine for Muslims) to discourage mass marriages under the said scheme.

“In 15-years of BJP regime, many ‘already married’ couples availed benefits of the scheme by participating in mass marriage ceremonies sponsored by the then government, resulting in huge corruption. I have lodged a complaint that marriages performed under the scheme in this financial year be verified,” MPCC secretary Sanjay Bakliwal told TOI.

He said that by releasing the calendar, government would be able to check such corruption as apart from verification by the concerned departments, the beneficiaries would have to submit an affidavit too.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Dolphin found dead with harpoon wound in Hastinapur Wildlife Sanctuary
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

The post-mortem examination report stated that the death was caused due to the harpoon attack, which spoke vo... Read More

MEERUT: The carcass of an adult freshwater dolphin, bearing deep harpoon wounds, was found on the banks of the Ganga River inside protected Hastinapur Wildlife Sanctuary near here, reducing the count of the mammal to 35 in the region. The killing of the mammal prompted the Uttar Pradesh’s forest department to register an FIR and launch a crackdown against illegal fishing on the Ganga stretch which has been earmarked as Ramsar site for the conservation of dolphins.

The mammal’s carcass was found near Jalalpur Jora village in Hastinapur division. It comes days before state’s chief minister Yogi Adityanath is scheduled to visit Hastinapur sanctuary.

The authorities claimed the body “seemed a bit old and the mammal could have been attacked somewhere else.” The post-mortem examination report stated that the death was caused due to the harpoon attack, which spoke volumes about the security of the national aquatic animal in the region.

Divisional forest officer (DFO) of Meerut division Aditi Sharma said, “Hastinapur sanctuary is divided into five districts and it is not clear where the dolphin was killed. The post-mortem report revealed that the harpoon had hit the spine of the mammal killing it instantly. Since dolphin is not used for human consumption, the hunters/poachers didn’t take it away and the carcass reached Hastinapur river bank. We are in the process of filing an FIR against the unknown poacher.”

Meanwhile, neighbouring Bijnor’s DFO M Semmaran has launched a drive against illegal fishing in the region under his jurisdiction. “Apart from this drive, we have also launched awareness campaign among villagers about the dolphins. We have also arrested three persons involved in illegal fishing along with their nets,” he said.

UP’s forest department and WWF India are working on a project for conservation of freshwater dolphins, and the stakeholders were upbeat with the recent census held in October last year, which showed three healthy calves adding to the population of 33 this year. In all 36 dolphins were counted in the census.

Hastinapur Wildlife Sanctuary is a 2,073 square-km of stretch along the Ganga and comprises regions of five West UP districts, Bijnor, Meerut, Hapur, Amroha and Muzaffarnagar. Ramsar Site is from Garh Mukteshwar to Narora in Bulandshahr.

Meerut’s DFO Sharma said, “The initiative to conserve dolphins at the Ramsar Site had begun in 2015 with 30 dolphins. In the last census, the number had risen to 36 and most of them were spotted in Hastinapur Wildlife Sanctuary. Considering the fact that this mammal gives birth only once in a couple of years, the rise in its population was quite encouraging and three calves also show the favourable habitat for them. But this death is unfortunate and a thorough investigation is underway.”

Ramsar sites are considered to be of national importance for conserving biological diversity.

Title: Mumbai Temperature: Max temp at 10-year low of 25°C
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: At 25.3 degree Celsius, Mumbaikars woke up on Thursday to the lowest maximum temperature for the month of January in at least a decade . The last time Mumbai had experienced such a low day-time temperature for the month was 26 degrees on January 12, 2014.Weathermen said minimum temperatures in the city are expected to dip too.India Meteorological Department’s Santacruz observatory recorded a maximum temperature of 25.3 degrees, which was 5.6 degrees below normal, and IMD’s Colaba observatory 26 degrees, 4.1 degrees below normal.Hashtags such as #mumbaiwinter and #mumbaicold trended on social media. @batataa_vada tweeted: “Please step out of your offices for a stroll guys. This lovely weather won’t stay for long #mumbaiwinter.” Another tweet by @rtvnyk compared Mumbai’s weather to the hill station of Mahabaleshwar.Minimum temperatures were on the lower side as well. IMD Santacruz recorded 15.4 degrees, 1.9 degrees below normal, and Colaba 17.6 degrees, 1.8 degrees below normal.On Wednesday, night temperatures ranged between 12 and 15 degrees, with Goregaon recording 14 degrees, Kandivli 15 and Panvel 12.Friday is expected to be as cold and windy.There has been a gradual dip in temperatures, especially since the beginning of the week, in sharp contrast to the previous weekend when maximum temperatures soared to 33.8 degrees and minimum rose over 20 degrees.K S Hosalikar, deputy director-general (western region), IMD, said,“Night temperatures are likely to dip further. Lowering of day-time temperatures with winds has made Mumbai cold and dry.” Relative humidity in Santacruz was 46% and Colaba 58%.

Title: Rajasthan: Press Council takes note of CM Ashok Gehlot comment on advertisements
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: The Press Council of India (PCI) has taken suo motu cognisance of a comment by chief minister Ashok Gehlot that if the media does not carry government news it will not get advertisements .

Gehlot made the remark light-heartedly while ending a press conference last month. The PCI has now issued notice to the state chief secretary and sought a reply on the CM’s “disconcerting” remark.

Gehlot’s remark has invited criticism from BJP state president Satish Poonia as well. In a press conference held on December 16 last year, Gehlot allegedly said that "vigyapan chahte ho toh hamari khabar dikhao" (if you want advertisements, publish or telecast our news).

"Such statement is contrary to the values of democracy and affects the reliability and freedom of media. A notice for reply has been issued to the chief secretary of Rajasthan in this regard," the PCI said in a release.

Poonia said Gehlot should stop threatening the media to hide his failures and should instead start concentrating on his state's affairs which have turned worse in the last 13 months of the Congress government.

Poonia said that the media, described as the "fourth pillar of democracy" has been bringing out both success and failure stories of the state government. Gehlot is the first chief minister of the state to have received such a notice which gives an impression that the media faces threat under his tenure. This also raises a question mark on the person who claims himself as a follower of Gandhian philosophy, he added.

He also said that Rajasthan has joined the list of states which top the crime rankings, while Gehlot, despite being the home minister, is unable to control the crime rate.

Similarly, Gehlot has also dismissed death of over 100 children in the state as a minor issue. Besides, farmers have suffered huge losses from a locust attack on their crops, for which the Chief Minister has not announced any compensation, he said.

Title: Nagpur University to bestow highest no. of degrees in last 5 years in 107th convocation
Content:
In a record of last five years, Nagpur University would be conferring highest number of degrees in the 107th ... Read More

NAGPUR: In a record of last five years, Nagpur University would be conferring highest number of degrees in the 107th convocation on Saturday, where its alumnus and now Chief Justice of India Sharad Bobde, had consented to be the chief guest.NU would be bestowing a total of 64,993 degrees at the function to be held at Suresh Bhat Sabhagruh from 10.30am, which included 746 PhDs, 13,037 undergraduates, 50,936 postgraduates and one DLitt to be conferred on Shrihari Chava from the commerce and management faculty.All though many legal luminaries were part of NU’s convocation ceremonies in the past, no CJI had ever visited it. “Former attorney General MC Settalvad was the chief guest in 1955 convocation, Justice MN Venkatchaliah had occupied main chair in 1980, and justice MN Chandurkar had also graced the occasion once. But this time, we’re lucky to have the CJI as our alumnus, who will be delivering the keynote address,” NU media coordinator Shyam Dhond informed.Terming CJI’s presence as a proud moment for the entire university, vice chancellor SP Kane said his elevation to the top post should be added to the NU achievements during inspection by NAAC and other agencies. “Unfortunately, such achievements isn’t counted while awarding the grades. Many of our alumni have achieved great heights and are occupying prominent positions globally,” said Kane, who was flanked by pro-VC Vinayak Deshpande, registrar Neeraj Khaty, finance officer Raju Hiwse, Board of examination and evaluation director Prafulla Sable and four deans.Like the 106th convocation, this time too, NU has drastically scaled down the number of medals, it used to award till 105th ceremony. This time, it would be awarding just 185 medals and prizes, of which 158 are gold, nine silver and 18 prizes. In 105th event, over 457 medals and prizes were awarded that included 312 gold, 43 silver and 102 prizes.Ayushi Khandelwal, who cleared MBA from Dr Ambedkar Institute of Management Studies and Research, will be getting highest number of gold medals (7), followed by Sayali Bhave (LLB-5 years) of NU’s Dr Ambedkar Law College and Sakharam Mandpe (MA Ambedkar Thoughts) from NU’s Ambedkar Thought Department with six gold medals each. Madhuri Ghugguskar from NU’s Postgraduate Education Department has won five gold medals for topping the MEd exams.Kane informed that after the convocation, NU plans to shift some of its offices to the new premises near its campus. He informed that at existing premises in front of Maharajbagh square, they had decided to use the backside of its administrative building for convocation in future. “The old offices earlier housing printing press would be demolished and cement flooring would be extended till the end. A dome shaped cover would be placed at the top. Same venue used to have host the convocation in the past. The old premises of College Section would be refurbished and would be used as a guesthouse for the NU employees and other guests.”Informing on suspended professor Shoma Sen, who is in Pune police’s custody in connection with her alleged involvement in Koregaon-Bhima violence, the VC said NU can’t go ahead with its internal inquiry, unless Pune cops officially provide them list of offences under which she was arrested. “They told us that probe was underway and therefore they can’t handover such sensitive details to anyone,” he said.

Title: Now, conservancy workers celebrate ‘sanitary Pongal’
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Trichy: City Wide Inclusive Sanitation (CWIS) Trichy celebrated “sanitary Pongal” with sanitary workers to spread awareness on the importance of personal and public hygiene in Ganesapuram locality under Ponmalai zone of Trichy corporation on Wednesday.

CWIS is a global project for which Trichy was selected as one of the four towns and cities across the nation to improve the existing sanitary infrastructure. Ganesapuram was once an open defecation-prone locality which eradicated it through public participation and behavioural change. CWIS said Ganesapuram was selected for the sanitary Pongal to recognise the remarkable turnaround. With 75% of the residents here being sanitary workers, the objective of the celebration was to encourage the workers to pursue the best sanitary practices. As many of the sanitary workers were found reluctant to use safety gear while on duty, messages promoting its importance in safeguarding lives were conveyed at the celebrations. Competitions such as running race, Uri adi (pot breaking contest) and kolam contest were organised, each incorporating a sanitation aspect.

“In running race, participants have to wash their hands properly before the event started,” organiser Sugantha Priscilla, senior specialist, Indian Institute for Human Settlements (IIHS) said. In Uri Adi, sanitary awareness messages were placed inside the pot which the participant had to read out aloud after breaking it with a stick.

Title: Work to find Dabholkar murder weapon nearly over: CBI
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: CBI told the Bombay high court on Thursday that the search to retrieve a weapon allegedly used to kill rationalist Narendra Dabholkar which was thrown into the Thane creek , is nearing completion.

Additional solicitor general Anil Singh sought at least 15 days to complete the dredging operation, being conducted by a foreign agency, from a bench of Justices Satyaranjan Dharmadhikari and Riyaz Chagla. The high court is monitoring the CBI probe into Dabholkar’s case and that by the state police’s special investigation team into the killing of CPI leader Govind Pansare .

Additional solicitor general Anil Singh submitted CBI’s probe report. It stated that the dredging work is nearing completion. “The area of the creek is mostly covered, except for a small part which is affected by high tide and low tide,” said Singh.

The judges also remarked they are “anxious” that the SIT has not been able to make headway to find the absconding accused in the Pansare murder case.

The high court observations came after perusing SIT’s probe progress report submitted by senior advocate Ashok Mundargi.

The judges noted the report states that a team is camping in Bangalore to “ascertain whether a commonality is there” in the killings of Pansare and journalist-activist Gauri Lankesh.

It also informed teams have been dispatched to Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Goa to launch a search for the absconding accused. The court will take an update in both the cases on February 13.

Dabholkar was shot dead on August 20, 2013, by unidentified motorcycle-borne assailants in Pune while on his morning walk. He was 68. Pansare and his wife were shot at on February 16, 2015, in Kolhapur during their morning walk. While his wife survived, the veteran CPI leader died four days later.

Title: Isolate Pak to counter terror, says CDS Rawat
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

NEW DELHI: Listing diplomatic isolation of Pakistan and keeping it under pressure of blacklisting by FATF as measures to tackle Pak-based terror, Chief of Defence Staff Bipin Rawat on Thursday called for strong and concerted global action against states sponsoring terrorism .

In an address at the Raisina Dialogue, Gen Rawat said there is a need to take a hard-line approach in dealing with terrorism, the way the US went after terror groups after the 9/11 terror attacks.

“As long as there are states which sponsor terrorism, we will have to live with the menace. We need to take the bull by its horns. We have to bring an end to terrorism and that can only happen the way Americans started after 9/11,” he said.

Gen Rawat suggested that India should start counter-radicalisation programmes by targeting the “right” persons. “We have to address the ideology of radicalisation,” he further said.

Title: It’s business as usual for some meat stalls despite Thiruvalluvar Day ban
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Trichy: Despite the ban imposed by Trichy Corporation against functioning of meat stalls and the sale of meat in the city on account of Thiruvalluvar Day on Thursday, a few meat stalls here did function and business went on as usual. Though the civic body officials are entitled to seize the meat and initiate actions against meat stalls that defy the ban, sanitary department of the civic body did not take any action.

As per G.O. 45 dated January 23, 1980, of the Rural Development and Local Administration Department, the state government has ordered the closure of meat stalls and slaughterhouses on three days annually-Thiruvalluvar day, Vallalar day and Mahavir Jayanti.

Following the guidelines, Trichy Corporation, a few days back had issued notices to around 400 meat and poultry stalls in the city prohibiting them from doing business. However, at least 5-10 shops in Ponmalai zone of Trichy Corporation located in Ponmalaipatti were kept open.

“Notifying about the ban on sale of meat during Thiruvalluvar day through newspapers and letting the meat stalls function as usual is a useless exercise,” KC Neelamegam, a resident of Ponmalaipatti said.

With the two abattoirs of Trichy Corporation located at Gandhi Market and G Corner remaining shut on Thursday, the sale of meat in mutton stalls have also raised questions about where the goats were slaughtered and whether those premises were hygienic. While meat stalls in Karumandapam, Gandhi market and Cantonment were found closed, locals said that those in Ponmalaipatti violated the ban on Thursday.

“We were not aware of the functioning of shops. Action will be taken against the meat stalls that defied the ban,” an official with Ponmalai zone of Trichy Corporation said.

Title: Rising veggie, grain prices pushing inflation to highest in five years
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhopal: With the rate of inflation touching 7%, its highest level in the last five years, prices of almost all the essential commodities have gone up burning a deep hole in the pockets of people, especially the middle class. The Goods and Services Tax (GST) has added to their woes.

Market experts said coarse cereals and pulses have been driving food inflation since the beginning of 2019. While onion prices set the markets ablaze, spiralling prices of other vegetables, like tomato, have only made life miserable for consumers.

For the past many weeks, onion was beyond the reach of the aam aadmi. “Last month, it was sold at a rate of Rs 120 a kg in Bhopal. Good quality onion is still being sold at Rs 50 a kg. For some time, even potato price had shot up, but onion, garlic and ginger are the real cause for veggie inflation,” ,” said Rashmi Inamdar, a housewife in Bhopal.

Ashish Jain, a grain merchant, said: “Rs 10 hike in per kg of wheat is a huge increase. This commodity has affected all and sundry.”

State general secretary of Akhil Bharatiya Udhyog Vyapar Mandal Navneet Agrawal said, “A lot of elements related to inflation are controlled by the government, but it seems to be least interested in controlling the inflation.”

Agarwal said the government should have anticipated loss of onion crops through its huge network of officials and should have placed import orders accordingly. "It delayed the process,” he said.

In the past four months, prices of wheat, edible oil, moong, LPG cylinder and several other fast moving consumer goods (FMCG) have gone up.

RK Gupta, state president of the LPG dealers' association, said: “The domestic LPG cylinder, which was available at a rate of Rs 581 in August last year, is being sold at Rs 781 this month. Similarly, the LPG cylinder used for commercial purpose went up to Rs 1246.50 in January this year from Rs 1,011 in August last year.”

Besides, there has also been an increase of 5% to 6% in cost of medicines which are not in the list of drug price control order. Most of the manufacturers are taking advantage of this, sources said. Lalit Jain, a wholesaler of medicines, said: "There is also an increase of 3% to 4% in the price of drugs to fight against cancer.”

Jain, also president of Bhopal Chamber of Commerce and Industries, said it has been observed that the GST is also responsible for the inflation. “I am not saying that it is the only element responsible for inflation, but definitely it is responsible for it.”

Title: Madurai: Retrial ordered for man convicted for wife’s death
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Setting aside the conviction and sentence awarded to a person in a dowry death case, Madras high court has remitted the case back to the trial court saying it had convicted him without giving an opportunity to defend himself. Appellant Gnanavel and the deceased Gomathi were married in 2006. The prosecution case is that during the marriage her parents promised to give 15 sovereigns gold jewellery as dowry but gave only 11 sovereigns. On one occasion, Gomathi had gone to her parents’ house and informed them that she was being tortured by her husband for the four sovereigns.

On April 7, 2007, there was a quarrel between the couple and the neighbours pacified them. Later in the day, Gnanavel strangled his wife to death using a rope. Oomatchikulam police registered a case and arrested him. The Madurai mahila court in an order on October 20, 2014 convicted and sentenced him to undergo 10 years imprisonment under section 304B (dowry death) of IPC. The appellant filed an appeal before HC Madurai bench in 2014 challenging the order. On perusal of the submissions made on either side, Justice M Nirmal Kumar observed that the brother, father of Gomathi and a villager have categorically stated about the appellant subjecting her to cruelty and harassment.

The judge observed that the RDO who conducted an inquiry had in his reports confirmed the unnatural death and gave a categorical finding that there was demand for dowry, harassment and cruelty leading to the death of the woman. The judge said the VAO and panchayat president have also stated about the confession. Considering all these facts the trial court had convicted the appellant under IPC section 304B, without extending him any opportunity to defend himself. Hence the judge said it was necessary to give the appellant that opportunity in the interest of justice.

Title: 2 finished projects take Trichy up 3 spots in smart cities ranking
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Trichy: Trichy corporation has slightly improved its position in the recent ranking of Tamil Nadu’s smart cities compared to November. With two smart city projects completed, it has now been placed at the eighth position, up three spots from the eleventh and last position it found itself in among the city corporations selected for the programme two months ago.

The smart cities mission was introduced by the ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) in 2015 to improve the urban infrastructure of cities and set a benchmark for it. Till January 2018, 11 cities from the state were selected for the initiative based on the innovative project ideas proposed by the urban local bodies. At the latest review meeting held on January 10 at Chennai, the performance and ranking of smart cities based on the execution and completion of projects were discussed. Since the urban local body here had completed two projects — World War memorial beautification and green space development — in December, Trichy was able to scale the rankings to 8 this month. The city has 13 smart city mission projects in the execution stage.

“But Trichy is dragging its feet in expediting the major smart city projects such as biomining. Poor planning by the authorities is costing the city valuable time,” Subash Chandran, a resident of Woraiyur said. As cities like Madurai, Erode and Tiruppur have completed only one smart city project each, they were placed after Trichy in the ranking. Coimbatore, Chennai and Thoothukudi have secured the first three spots followed by Salem, Tirunelveli, Thanjavur and Vellore. Official sources in Trichy corporation blamed legal hurdles for the delay in the execution of Chathiram bus stand redevelopment and multi-level car parking (MLCP) projects. “Chennai and Coimbatore cities were selected for smart cities mission in 2016 itself, but Trichy was selected for the scheme only in 2017,” an official source added. However, though Thoothukudi corporation was also selected along with Trichy in 2017, it has found a place among the top three.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: Why toxic air may not let contenders breathe easy
Content:
Pollution has acquired a social dimension of its own (File photo)

NEW DELHI: In 2015, when the assembly elections neared, very few voters in Delhi were aware of how severe the problem of air pollution had become. At the time, the city only had seven air monitoring stations and the now easily recognised benchmark, CPCB’s Air Quality Index , or AQI, was yet to be launched. Five years later, pollution has acquired a social dimension of its own — so much so that it has become an election issue.Since 2015, Delhi has added 31 more air quality monitoring stations, an indication that the problem is regarded with the seriousness it deserves. Last month, the United Residents Joint Action (URJA), an umbrella body of residents’ welfare associations, released a nine-point People’s Manifesto on Clean Air 2020, signifying that RWAs are becoming vocal about the urgency in finding solutions to the capital’s bad air. The three prominent political parties in the fray, namely the Aam Aadmi Party, Congress and BJP, have agreed to incorporate points from URJA’s manifesto in their own.Atul Goyal, president, URJA, disclosed that its manifesto was drafted after consulting a number of RWAs over three-four years. “Construction dust and vehicular pollution are problems throughout the year. They affect the whole of Delhi,” observed Goyal. “We have not had any respite from these two woes. In order to tackle Delhi’s air pollution, the state government needs to be committed to the cause of decongesting the city, switching to cleaner fuels, reducing vehicles on the road and improving public transport. Our green manifesto also asks for better cooperation with neighbouring states instead of indulging in a blame game.”Amit Aggarwal, a Vasant Kunj resident, said the public had begun to contribute to the fight against pollution, but the government needed to do a lot more to boost Delhi’s air quality. “I got rid of my 15-year-old car though it was in perfect running condition and I used it for only a kilometre or two each day,” the IT consultant said. “As a citizen, I did my bit, but I am not seeing the returns in terms of improved air quality. Since so much more obviously needs to be done, why not tie the perks of MLAs to air quality in some manner?”In New Friends Colony, which falls in the Okhla assembly constituency, people complain about the area’s consistently high AQI. Okhla is one among 13 pollution hotspots identified by Delhi Pollution Control Committee in 2019. The others are Narela, Bawana, Mundka, Punjabi Bagh, Dwarka, Wazirpur, Rohini, Vivek Vihar, Anand Vihar, R K Puram, Jahangirpuri and Ashok Vihar.Madhavi Sachar, who lives in New Friends Colony, said people were becoming more conscious of pollution but felt the government needed to act strong a for sustained fight. “Measures like cars with odd-even licence plates using the road on alternate days raise awareness and cut emissions, but it’s tough to say what is being done in concrete terms to counter pollution,” she said. “Political parties now know they cannot get away with ignoring pollution.”In Dwarka, numerous anti-pollution protests have taken place in the last five years. From strong voices against felling trees to build the Dwarka Expressway to demanding the Bharat Vandana Park as an eco space, residents have been trying to stave off the reduction in green cover in the sub-city. “We are vocal because the government has to take strong measures to preserve trees and improve the air quality. So far, only the reverse is happening,” said V Selvarajan, a local.Many people feel air pollution as an election imperative is discussed only by the elite, with voters in the economically lower categories focused more on existential problems like water, electricity and sewage. “You may not see people in Seelampur or Jahangirpuri worrying about pollution so much. Those who are anxious about the air quality are too few to make an impact on the elections,” rued Bhavreen Kandhari in Defence Colony.Kandhari, however, is happy air pollution has emerged as a talking point now. “The state government is taking notice of the protests and the voices against the bad air. We expect the party that comes to power to focus on decongesting Delhi, reducing air pollution and improving waste management,” said a hopeful Kandhari.

Title: Promote loan waiver scheme, coop principal secretary to dist collectors
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Nashik: Principal secretary of cooperatives Abha Shukla on Thursday asked the collectors of all five districts in Nashik division to ensure enough publicity of Mahatma Jyotirao Phule Shetkari Karj Mukti Yojana so that no beneficiary is left out.

Shukla was addressing a meeting at Niyojan Bhawan in Nashik. Divisional commissioner Rajaram Mane, cooperative commissioner and registrar Satish Soni, district Collectors Suraj Mandhare, Rahul Dwivedi, Avinash Dhaka, Gangatharan D, Rajendra Bharud and ZP chief executive officers Bhuvaneswari S, BN Patil, Vanamati, SS Patil, Vinay Gowda, among were present in the meeting.

Banks have been asked to upload information of farmers who have still not linked their Aadhaar numbers with their accounts. Shukla has directed the banks and revenue officials to ensure that queries and complaints related to Aadhar-linking were resolved in a specific period.

Those farmers who have taken loan between April 1, 2015, and March 31, 2019, eligible for loan waiver scheme provided there outstanding was less than Rs 2 lakh till September 2019.

Loans given by nationalised banks, district central cooperative banks, private, rural banks, Vividh Karyakari Sahakari Sanstha, merchant banks and other such organisations are eligible for the waiver. Shukla pointed out that none of the elected representatives, former employees of government or semi-government or cooperative receiving pension of around Rs 25,000 per month and government employees are eligible for the loan waiver scheme.

So far, only the reverse is happening,” said V Selvarajan, a local.Many people feel air pollution as an election imperative is discussed only by the elite, with voters in the economically lower categories focused more on existential problems like water, electricity and sewage. “You may not see people in Seelampur or Jahangirpuri worrying about pollution so much. Those who are anxious about the air quality are too few to make an impact on the elections,” rued Bhavreen Kandhari in Defence Colony.Kandhari, however, is happy air pollution has emerged as a talking point now. “The state government is taking notice of the protests and the voices against the bad air. We expect the party that comes to power to focus on decongesting Delhi, reducing air pollution and improving waste management,” said a hopeful Kandhari.

Title: Four from Delhi arrested for robbery in Meerut's jewellery showroom
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

All the arrested youths are said to be involved in at least four recent cases of robbery, including two in Del... Read More

MEERUT: With the arrest of four Delhi residents, UP police on Thursday claimed to have cracked a sensational robbery which took place in Meerut’s upscale Central Market last month. It comes two days after the jewelers’ association threatened a complete shutdown over rising incidents of robberies in the region.

All the arrested youths, including kingpin Akshya Sharma, are from the national capital, and are said to be involved in at least four recent robberies, including two in Delhi. “From them, we recovered looted jewellery worth Rs 25 lakh and cash to the tune of Rs 11 lakh,” a senior police officer said.

According to police, the gang took “inspiration” from a television crime show on how to dodge police trail and pull off a robbery without leaving surveillance clues that could lead the police to them.

“They disposed of the clothes they had worn during the robbery and also changed their appearance, by haircut and trimmed beard. They went in hiding in different states and maintained minimal contact over phone,” Meerut SSP Ajay Sahani said.

For the local police, the December 17 robbery was a “blind case” as the accused had left no clues. They had decamped with digital video recorder (DVR) of the CCTV camera installed at the premises of the jewellery showroom.

“Police had to trace the suspects through CCTV cameras installed on the route which the robbers took after the crime. They also took inputs from the victims to arrive at the list of suspects,” the police officer said.

“A dedicated team was working round-the-clock to solve the case. Teams were sent to Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Punjab and Rajasthan in search of the suspects who had gone in hiding soon after the incident,” Meerut zone’s additional director general (ADG) Prashant Kumar said.

“Akshay was in debt of over Rs 25 lakh, which he had lost in betting. To recover the amount, he had hatched the robbery with his aides,” SSP Sahani said. Investigation revealed that Akshay worked as an artisan in jewellery manufacturing and has knew about the thriving bullion establishments in the city and security loopholes.

“The gang had been conducting recce for the past 6-7 months before they carried out the robbery on December 17,” the SSP said. Police are probing the role of the gang in at least four robberies, two each in Meerut and Delhi. Their role in other similar cases is also being probed.

Title: Rajasthan government to move Supreme Court over stay of phase four panchayat polls
Content:
The state government will file petition in the apex court challenging the state election commission's decision... Read More

JAIPUR: The state government will file petition in the apex court challenging the state election commission's decision to stay the fourth phase of panchayat elections, which was earlier scheduled on February 1. It will also raise the issue of conducting elections to the panchayat bodies done before their term ends. It may also include conducting the elections to panchayat samitis and zila parishads, the term of which completes on February 7.Secretary, SEC, Shyam Singh Rajpurohit said, “Now, if we conduct elections to the remaining gram panchayats (4563), since the conditions that existed before the high court order on December 13 have been revived, and later SC gives a decision favouring the HC order, then what shall we do? Wouldn't that lead to a constitutional crisis . This is not the final decision of SC, they have only stayed the execution of HC order," he further added.He said, the SEC has decided to lodge a complaint with the police against those who have spread rumours that it has filed a petition in the Supreme Court with regard to the panchayat elections.

Title: SC-ST panel member’s fiat to police as two men assaulted, abused at party
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Nashik: A member of the Maharashtra scheduled castes and scheduled tribes commission, Justice C L Thool, on Thursday said the police should provide security to men who were allegedly assaulted and abused during a birthday party at a farmhouse in rural Nashik last week.

The victims have been admitted to the Nashik civil hospital.

“I have told police to provide full security to the victims, their families and witnesses so that they don’t turn hostile in any case,” said Thool after meeting the victims, police and the district administration.

Thool said that the victims spoke at length about the way they were beaten up. He has instructed the doctors to provide all medication to them and take the help of social justice department, if required, for buying medicines.

According to police, the victims are disk jockeys and were hired for a birthday party at the farmhouse. During the event, there was an altercation between them and the host. The victims were then allegedly beaten up and remarks passed against them.

The main suspect, who has been arrested along with nine others, is a history-sheeter. All the nine suspects have been booked under various sections of the atrocities act. The main suspect has cases against him in various police stations and had been externed from Nashik city. He was arrested from a hideout in Nandurbar.

“I have heard both the victims carefully. I have gone through the station diary as well. As of now, it appears that everything said by the victims has been noted down correctly. I have asked police to complete all the formalities required in the next three days and take the issue to logical conclusion,” Thool said.

The SC-ST commission member instructed police to take extra measures to ensure that evidence is not tampered with. He also advised the doctors and the family members to limit the number of visitors meeting the victims as it was necessary for their own safety.

Title: Team from Rome takes stock of locust crisis in Jaisalmer
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Jaisalmer: A team of officers of Food and Agriculture Organisation, Rome on Thursday visited the locust affected areas of Jaisalmer district and witnessed the locust control activities on the field. The team went to the fields and took feedback from the farmers about the situation.

Keith Krismon and Rajesh Dubey along with agriculture department’s deputy director Radheyshyam Narwal, assistant director Om Prakash, agriculture officer C S Rathore and B L Dabla and others visited the fields.

The team visited Bainsda, Rasla, Devikot, Dabla and other villages. FAO officers praised the farmers and villagers for their help in controlling locusts. Farmers told that situation is under control and in future if such situation arises then they will partner with government to control locusts. Farmers suggested that modern machines and equipment should be used in controlling locusts so that they should not suffer.

These officers praised the district administration, various departments such as locust control and agriculture department for their efforts and expressed satisfaction on locust control activities. The team in the evening met Jaisalmer collector Namit Mehta and discussed in detail about the locust control efforts in the district. Collector informed in detail about controlling the locusts and the activities done so far and emphasised on making preventive measures using modern technique and equipment.

Collector Mehta told FAO officers that information and communication about the locust arrival and available areas at the international level should be further strengthened so that all measures can be taken on time to control them.

On Thursday, locust control department and agriculture department with 10 vehicles sprayed pesticide at Phalsoond area and controlled the locusts. The locusts were spread on 3-4km area.

Title: Vaikunta Ekadasi festival concludes in Srirangam
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Trichy: Nammalvar Motcham was observed in Arulmigu Ranganathaswamy temple in Srirangam, which marked the conclusion of the 21-day long Vaikunta Ekadasi festival on Thursday. The Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) department that manages the Srirangam temple said that the festival attracted close to 12 lakh devotees during the festival.

On Thursday morning, at around 5.30 am, senior temple priests initiated the rituals of Nammalvar Motcham. The idol of Nammalvar, one of the 12 supreme devotees of Lord Vishnu, was placed at the feet of Lord Namperumal, the processional deity of Ranganathaswamy temple. HR&CE sources said that the practice was observed to re-enact the act of saint Nammalvar achieving Motcham (transcendent state).

“The last two days of Vaikunta Ekadasi festival attracted a significant number of devotees as they overlapped with the Pongal holidays.

Around two lakh people visited the temple during the opening of Paramapadavasal on January 6,” said P Jayaraman, HR&CE joint-commissioner of the temple. During the 21 days, officials said that 12 lakh people thronged the temple.

The next opening of Paramapada Vaasal is scheduled to be celebrated on December 25. Every year, during the Tamil month Margazhi (December-January), Vaikunta Ekadasi is celebrated in the pattern of Pagal Pathu (daytime celebrations for 10 days) and Raa Pathu (night-time celebrations for 10 days).

On the first day of Raa Paththu, Namperumal was taken in a procession from sanctum sanctorum, exiting the Paramapatha Vaasal also known as Sorga Vaasal (gateway to heaven) to appear for the devotees in thousand pillar mandapam.

Title: Madurai: Man arrested for sexually harassing two minor girls
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

Title: Tamil Nadu: Youth found murdered, three friends under suspicion
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: The body of a 24-year-old man with his face mutilated was found on a vacant plot near Uzhavar Sandhai in Thennur here on Wednesday. The deceased was identified as P Santhoshkumar from Kooni Bazaar in Palakkarai in the city.

On getting the information, Santhoshkumar’s mother P Muthulakshmi came to the spot and confirmed the identity of the deceased. According to the complaint by his mother, Santhoshkumar and his younger brother Sathish were labourers in the fish market in Puthur. Their father died a few years ago.

Santhoshkumar left home on January 13 but did not return. His mother and brother tried reaching him on his mobile phone but the phone remained switched off.

On Wednesday, she got the information from her relative about his body being found with the face crushed.

Muthulakshmi pointed the needle of suspicion on three of his friends who were also working at the fish market. She said that Arun, Sathish and Durai could have settled scores with him over some trivial issues.

Based on her complaint, Thillai Nagar police registered a case against the three and are on their lookout. The police brought the body to Mahatma Gandhi memorial government hospital for postmortem.

Title: Pawar, Nagpurians want power plants shifted to Nashik
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Sharad Pawar

NAGPUR: Even as new energy minister Nitin Raut has ruled out scrapping of two new 660MW thermal units at Koradi power plant, NCP supremo Sharad Pawar wants new ones in Nashik.

A source in Mahagenco said that there are only three units in Nashik power plant. “Only one is being run at present because the power is costlier than other power stations. There were plans for a 660MW unit but it is stuck due to the objection raised by ministry of defence (MoD) over the height of the chimney,” he added.

Nashik minister Chhagan Bhujbal wants new units there so that locals can get jobs. He requested Mahagenco to start new ones there but did not get much response. He therefore contacted his boss Sharad Pawar.

The source said that Pawar recently held a meeting in this regard with chairman-cum-managing director (CMD) of Mahagenco and other senior officials.

The officials told him about the problem of chimney’s height. They also said that as Nashik plant was far away from coal mines, the cost of its power was higher than those located in Vidarbha. “We told him that Nashik power would not be purchased under merit order dispatch (MOD),” said the source.

Pawar however, was adamant on new units. The officials therefore proposed that the non-operational old units would be renovated and made online. The NCP chief asked the officials to submit a report within days about all the options.

Even though Mahagenco is having difficulties in getting environmental clearance for Koradi units, it is not ready to shift them to Nashik, where locals are ready.

Local environmentalists trashed Mahagenco’s contentions that Nashik power would not be purchased. “Mahagenco will sign a power purchase agreement (PPA) with MSEDCL, its sole consumer, and if there is need for power then Nashik power will be consumed,” said an environmentalist.

The Mahagenco source also said that with solar power costing around Rs3 per unit, Nashik power would be costly too at over Rs4 per unit. However, this logic is true for Koradi units too.

Raut wants new units in Koradi as they will generate 5,000 jobs for locals. He is however, completely ignoring the damage to health of people due to increase in pollution.

Title: Don’t waste trees for Harsul plant: Greens
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Aurangabad: Environmentalists have raised a strong objection to the civic administration’s move to cut around a large number of trees in the Harsul area for setting up a waste processing plant, saying that the facility can be established without harming the trees.

The deputy mayor, however, said that the said trees will be transplanted and the city will not lose them at any cost.

The Harsul tree issue has drawn much attention as experts have already been opposing the proposal to cut trees for the memorials of Balasaheb Thackeray and Gopinath Munde.

The AMC has selected ‘gut’ number 5 and 14 in the Harsul area to set up the 150 tonne per day (TPD) waste management plant.

According to civic activist Ayyub Patel, the proposed waste management facility at Harsul would require cutting of around 150 trees. “The site selected for the plant has 50 mango trees on the 7/12 extract. In fact, the number of trees is more. Around 150 trees of neem, chiku, mango and other varieties will be cut by the AMC,” he said.

The civic body had started dumping garbage at the site in April 2018, turning the area into a mound of mixed waste. Two months later, in July, the AMC buried around 70 trucks of waste under the ground around 200m away from the site. A 16 TPD unit was also raised at the site in 2019 for processing waste. All these activities were undertaken in Harsul, but not without cutting trees.

Asked to comment on the issue current issue, deputy mayor Rajendra Janjal said the trees from the site in Harsul would be carefully transplanted at another location.

However, Kishor Pathak, an expert and also a member of the local tree authority, said, “If they want to raise a waste processing unit, they can do so without harming the trees. No tree can be cut without the tree authority’s permission. Even if permission is sought, we will not approve it,” he added.

Title: Four women among six dead in two accidents on Pongal day
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

THANJAVUR: Six people died in two road accidents that took place in Thanjavur and Tiruvarur districts on Wednesday.

In the first accident, four women were killed as a speeding car ran amok into a group of people walking along the road near Thanjavur on Wednesday.

The deceased have been identified as M Kavitha, 25, Selvi, 45, her daughter Keerthi, 20, and Kanniyammal, 48, from Netaji Nagar in Bengaluru. Jothi, 45, from Bengaluru, Balakrishnan, 42, of Thirukattupalli in Thanjavur, car driver R Sathyanarayanan, 42, his father Ramachandran, 68, mother R Revathi, 65, residents of Thiru Nagar in Dindigul, sustained injuries.

Hundreds of devotees from various parts of Thanjavur and neighbouring states like Karnataka and Kerala had arrived at Vallam in Thanjavur to participate in a prayer meeting organised by a Christian evangelist at Thirumalai Samudram near Vallam on Wednesday.

A section of people who arrived there had gone to a tank located at Vallam Puthur to take bath before attending the prayer meeting scheduled at 6pm on Wednesday. Around 35 people were returning from the tank towards the meeting hall along the Trichy-Thanjavur national highway, when a Thanjavur-bound ambassador car from Trichy ran amok and mowed down Kavitha, Selvi, Keerthi, and Kanniyammal. Kavitha died on the spot while the three others succumbed at the hospital on Thursday, police said.

On information, the Vallam police rushed to the spot and rescued the injured and admitted to the hospital. Further investigations are on.

Meanwhile, in another incident, two youths died on the spot after a Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation bus hit a two-wheeler in which the victims were riding. The accident took place near Mannargudi in Tiruvarur district .

The deceased have been identified as Rajkumar, 24, an engineering graduate, and his relative Dinesh, 24, of Karakottai in Mannargudi. Both of them were on the way to Mannargudi on the new bike, which Rajkumar had bought on Wednesday evening. When they were nearing Serumangalam, the bus proceeding towards Coimbatore hit the two-wheeler killing both on the spot.

The Vaduvoor police rushed to the spot and retrieved the bodies and arrested the bus driver Durairaj, 50, of Eda Keezhaiyur. Police are investigating.

Title: BJP couldn’t find candidates in 739 municipal wards, Cong in 436
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Hyderabad: With the dust settling on the nominations, as the last date for withdrawal was January 14, the battle lines are drawn for the forthcoming municipal polls on January 22.

National parties, including BJP and Congress, could field candidates in just 75% of 3,052 wards, including divisions, going to the polls in less than a week. According to State Election Commission data, BJP has fielded 2,313 candidates for 3,052 wards, while Congress candidates are in the fray in 2,616 wards. In other words, BJP did not get candidates for the contest in 739 wards, while Congress has no candidate in 436 wards.

On the other hand, TRS has already bagged 80 wards unanimously.

“Last time, we could find candidates for just 50% of the wards. This time, however, we found nearly 80% candidates. In some areas, our candidates were threatened by TRS leaders and they were abused otherwise we would have returned better numbers” BJP national spokesperson K Subhash said.

BJP district units were backing independents in 120 wards, wherever they did not find suitable candidates or party’s nominees did not file nominations. Sources said BJP had a tough time finding candidates in erstwhile Khammam district, a former Communist citadel, Mahbubabad, and Medak. The sources said the party had difficulty in finding candidates in Muslim-dominated areas too. “We did not have our base in certain areas like Huzurnagar, so we could not find candidates there,” a senior leader admitted.

Even Congress faced difficulties in some areas as more than one candidate was eyeing the same ward. In such cases, the party remained neutral. “There are at least 100 wards across the state where we have more than one candidate in the fray, even though we did not find candidates for all wards. We had more candidates than last time. In many areas, our candidates are being lured or threatened with cases. In such areas, we are supporting independent candidates,” Nayani Rajendar Reddy, a District Pradesh Congress president, told TOI

Congress faced difficulties in finding candidates in surrounding areas of Hyderabad like Rangareddy, Medchal, Sangareddy, Jayashankar-Bhupalapally districts, Warangal Rural and Parakala. Incidentally, BJP observed Parakala bandh on Thursday alleging that TRS was misusing state machinery.

Title: Bhopal and Satna students rank low in reading abilities and calculations, reports ASER
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Bhopal:

The Annual Status of Education Report (ASER 2019 ‘Early Years’) released on Thursday shows that the students of Bhopal and Satna districts are far behind in reading and cognitive abilities as compared to rural districts of other states.

The report is based on a survey conducted in 26 districts across 24 states with total of 1,515 villages, 30,425 households and 36,930 children of the 4-8 years age group.

While the report shows that 90% of children between the ages of 4-8 are enrolled in some type of educational institutes, the proportion of children not enrolled anywhere is much higher in both Bhopal (17.9%) and Satna (17.2%).

Bhopal and Satna also fall behind when it comes to reading levels of students enrolled in Classes 1 to 3. In Bhopal, only 6% children in Class 1 could read a Class 1 level text and only 25.3% of Class 3 students could read Class 1 text.

In Satna, 10.6% children in Class 1 could read a Class 1 level text while only 38.4% children in Class 3 could do so.

In Bhopal 54.9 % of Class 1, students could not even identify letters while 22.2% of Class 3 were also not able to do so. In Satna, 44.4% of Class 1 students and 16% of Class 3 students could not identify letters.

The students of the two districts also lag behind when it comes to recognising numbers from 1-100. According to NCERT, a Class 1 student should be able to identify numbers from 1 to 99 — in Bhopal, 40.2% children in Class 1 could not even recognise number from 1 to 9, while only 57.2% children of Class 3, could recognize numbers from 11-99.

In Satna district, 44.9% students of Class 1 could not recognize number 1 to 9 and only 56.9% children of Class 3 could identify the number between 11-99.

Only 18.2 % of Class 3 students of Bhopal can perform 2-digit numeric subtraction while the percentage of students of Class 3 in Satna district who could perform 2-digit subtraction was 22.8%.

Title: Maharashtra: Man-animal conflict behind tiger’s death said minister
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Representative image

CHANDRAPUR: Minister for relief and rehabilitation and salt pan development Vijay Wadettiwar on Thursday blamed the raging man-animal conflict in forests for the recent death of a tiger in South Brahmapuri range.

The tiger’s carcass, sans the head, paws and tail was recovered last Saturday in South Brahmapuri forest range. The forest department suspects it to be a case of poaching and have arrested eight villagers from Mudjha holding them responsible for chopping off the tiger’s body parts.

Brahmapuri is the assembly constituency of Wadettiwar. Addressing a press conference, he claimed that such incidents can happen due to farmers’ anger. “Those having farms in the fringe forest often suffer losses due to intrusion of wild animals and cattle killing by the predators. Man-animal conflict is at its peak in Brahmapuri,” he said.

Wadettiwar also said that a committee will be formed soon to study high pollution in Chandrapur. “The panel will evaluate the reasons behind the rising pollution and suggest remedies and measures to deal with it. The recommendations will be effectively implemented,” he added.

Title: BJP, Sena lock horns over plant
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Aurangabad: The waste processing unit to be raised at Harsul has been embroiled in politics with the BJP and Shiv Sena warring over the tender proposal. Deputy mayor Rajendra Janjal said on Thursday said that the re-tendering for the waste processing unit would require more time and money and that the standing committee members may face legal complications for posing as a roadblock to the implementation of the project.

In September 2019, the standing committee, chaired by BJP’s Jaishree Kulkarni, had rejected the tender proposal submitted by the AMC, citing inefficiency of P H Jadhav— the agency shortlisted based on the lowest bid. The committee asked the administration to carry out the tender process afresh. Subsequently, the Sena members again brought the old tender before the standing committee during a meeting on Tuesday. While Sena members wanted the committee to reconsider the old tender, the BJP pushed for re-tendering.

On Wednesday, BJP city chief Kishanchand Tanwani questioned the Sena’s stand. He asked, “How come the Sena, which had agreed on retendering in the standing committee meeting in September, is now pushing for the agency shortlisted in the old tender?”

On Thursday, Janjal said that the BJP’s persistence for a new tender would disturb the financial management of the solid waste management (SWM) project. “The state government has already approved Rs 148 crore for the SWM project. The BJP members want to issue a combined tender for the waste processing plant and civil construction. However, the work order for civil construction at Harsul has already been issued to a contractor based on the rates of 2017-18. If we go for retendering, it is going to take more time and money as the agencies will quote increased rates,” he said.tnn

Title: Sriganganagar,Bikaner villagescome under new locust attacks
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Ravla (Sriganganagar): After battling the lethal attack by pink locusts from early this week, the farmers and local administration were in for a nasty surprise on Thursday as a fresh swarm flew into villages in Sriganganagar and Bikaner districts.

The locusts were seen flying in an area of 40km, starting with villages near Khajuwala in Bikaner district to the Ravla area in Sriganganagar. A team from the Locust Control Organization (LCO), agriculture department and district administration rushed to the affected villages and began supplying pesticides to destroy the pests.

Some villages of 14 KND came under the attack of fresh swarms in the evening. “Look at them, they are coming from 13 KND village near Khajuwala which is close to the international border after passed through 1 to 6 BBM villages to reach here via 12 KND,” said Bhagwan Meghwal, a villager.

Title: RSS Muslim wing to allay CAA fears over khichdi bhoj
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

Lucknow: While senior BJP leaders will soon arrive in UP to gather support for the amended citizenship law, the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh has roped in its minority arm, Muslim Rashtriya Manch (MRM), to allay fears on CAA over a platter of Khichdi.

On Friday, MRM will organise a Khichdi bhoj (traditionally organised on Makar Sankranti, which was celebrated on January 15) for Hindus and Muslims where the nuances of the new citizenship law will be discussed.

Sources said Sangh also plans to organise public meetings under the aegis of Rashtriya Ekta Mission to convince Muslims, most of whom are staunchly opposed to the amended citizenship law.

Murari Das, national co-convener of MRM, told TOI that the manch would depute its Muslim cadre in cities which witnessed violent protests against the CAA in December. These cities included Lujcknow, Kanpur and parts of west UP. In Lucknow, Khichdi bhoj is scheduled on Friday. MRM will organise a khichdi bhoj and karyakarta sammelan in Allahabad and Kanpur on January 19 and 20, respectively. MRM also plans to rope in some clerics and Muslim professionals including Maulana Taqeer, Prof Jahan Ara, Nikhat Parveen, Hasan Kausar and Salman Ahmad in its campaign.

Title: Madurai: It’s 660 bulls V 675 tamers in Palamedu
Content:
This story is from January 17, 2020

A tamer in action at the jallikattu arena at Palamedu

MADURAI: As many as 660 bulls were released through the vaadivasal in Palamedu jallikattu and 675 tamers tackled them in an eventful day held under the supervision of the jallikattu organizing committee on Thursday.

The number of injured has slightly come down to 26, compared to last year (32). While 10 of them were referred to a tertiary care centre, none of them had life threatening injuries, according to Madurai district police. Eight tamers, 10 visitors, six bull owners and one policeman who was on duty inside the arena, were injured. A bull suffered minor injury, which was treated.
